In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses, the family started to breed livestock animals. They started two years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. And now reselling some animals after fattening, they make 3,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase livestock animals for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock animals

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul L. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. He is 47 years old. Raul is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Raul owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like sardines and mackerel, in the local community. Raul has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Raul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raul has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Raul is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like sardines and milk fish. This will be the third loan taken out by Raul from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue he generates to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of quicker oats

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Q., 52, is from the town of Trinidad. He is married and has four children. To make a living, Jose raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Jose also buys and sells fruits like bananas. He also plans to raise pigs in his backyard.

Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Jose is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and piglets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie M. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 37 years old. Elsie is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family. About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Marivel después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta artesanía, ella en su domicilio tiene un pequeño taller de fabricación de artesanía. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. Marivel requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo alambres y otras cosas más. 

Marivel pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
32-year old Marivel is married and has three children. She lives in the town of Pisaq, in Calca province, Cusco department, Peru. After completing her household tasks, Marivel sells crafts. In her house she has a small workshop where she makes crafts. She’s been doing this work for 15 years and all is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in.  She now needs a loan to buy materials such as wire.

Marivel belongs to the Mosoq Ñusta community bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for the opportunity this loan brings and promises to pay back the money according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy craft supplies such as wire

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: El sr P. labora como ALBAÑIL es  casado,  tiene TRES hijos a su cargo, es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para realizarse compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para mejora de su vivienda PARA CONSTRUIR PARDE DE SU CASA.
texts.en: Mr P. works as a builder. He is married and has three children to support. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He is grateful with the support received, as the money will enable him to buy building materials such as sand, cement, iron and labour to build part of his house and improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, cement, iron and labour in order to improve his home.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes S. is from the village of P-10 Manabay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Mercedes is separated and has one school age child. 

To make a living, Mercedes is engaged in video games and direct selling. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over four year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2009, Mercedes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital of her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mercedes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to have access to working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He has been working in selling car spare parts for the last 10 years. And in 2009, he opened his own shop and began his car trade operation. He is thankful for his business income because it allows him to provide good life conditions to his family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his shop’s inventory in order to increase his sales. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anita L., is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Anita is married and has three school-age children. 

To make a living, Anita owns and operates a fruit-vending business. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anita has successfully repaid a loan of 20,000 PHP. 

Anita is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayment and the education of her children.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 35 years old and married with 8 children who all go to school.

Mary borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Thaciana

texts.en:
Thaciana is 37 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 8 and 16. She owns a general store in which she sells several items such as sorghum, rice, maize flour and other items. She runs the general store together with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy sorghum and beans to add to her store in order to make more profits. She plans to add the profits she hopes to make to her savings.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 40 years old and married. She has been running a tailoring business for 11 years and earns around 10,000 KES a month. Winfred intends to take a 10,000 KES loan to buy more materials to make clothes.  

Winfred has been a good client who repays her loans well. This is her fourth loan with KADET. As a trustworthy and hardworking individual, she plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothes

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa buys fresh fish from the seashore to smoke for resale. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a carpenter. Abenawa uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Abenawa will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. Abenawa plans to plow the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Yeli

texts.en:
Yeli is 30 years old and married with two children, ages 6 and 18. She runs a clothing and textiles store in Goderich near Freetown.

Yeli has owned this business for seven years and sells threads, needles and buttons at her store. Her business is the only source of income she has. Her business is doing well.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing and textiles items. Yeli says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the living standard of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and textiles items.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 26 years old and her husband, Seng is 29 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and have one young daughter. 

Yan sells chickens. She buys chickens from the local market and carries them by her motorbike to sell in Phnom Penh market. Unfortunately, the motorbike was stolen. Because of this, Yan decided to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike. 

Yan and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motor to carry chicken to market.

loans.name: Rocio Yaneth

texts.es: La Sra Rocío es una persona  trabajadora  y  muy  responsable la cual se  dedica  a  la   venta  y  distribución de  cosméticos  y es  de  esta  manera  que  ella  obtiene   sus  ingresos  para   salir  adelante, en este  momento  ella  necesita  de  nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar  la   compra de mercancía    ya  que    no  cuenta  con el  capital   necesario para  realizar  dicha  inversión,  agradece    el  apoyo    brindado para la realización de   su  proyecto  ya  que   ve   en  el crédito la  oportunidad  de  realizar   su   sueño   y   a  su vez    brindar a  su  familia  una   excelente  calidad  de  vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Rocio is a hard-working and very responsible person who sells and distributes cosmetics. This is how she makes an income to get ahead. She now needs our support in order to purchase merchandise, since she does not have the necessary capital to make this investment. She is grateful for the support offered for her project. In this loan she sees the opportunity to realize her dreams and offer her family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Rubia Antonia

texts.es: Rubia Antonia de 60 años de edad, reside en su casa con su esposo Crisanto de 66 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura en el área del cultivo de caña de azúcar y maíz. Mientrás que Rubia posee una tienda y además un molino de nixtamal en el cual muele todo tipo de granos, este es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que los frutos de la agricultura a los que se dedica su esposo se perciben al final de cada año. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra ubicado frente a la Plaza Central del lugar donde ella reside, además es el único molino que existe en la zona por lo que no posee competencia alguna. Actualmente la capacidad del molino no dá abasto a toda la demanda que tiene y se ha visto en la necesidad de comprar otro con mayor capacidad con que logre cubrirla y tener satisfechos a todos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para comprar un molino de nixtamal con mayor capacidad al que ya posee. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta manera podrá mejorar los ingresos familiares y consecuentemente la calidad de sus vidas
texts.en: Rubia Antonia, 60, lives in her house with her husband Crisanto, who is 66 years old.  Her husband is a farmer who cultivates sugar cane and corn.  Meanwhile, Rubia has a store and also a corn mill where she grinds all types of grains.  This is her main source of income, since her husband's income from farming comes at the end of every year.  Rubia's business is strategically located, since it is in front of the Central Plaza in her town.  In addition, hers is the only mill in the area, so she doesn't have any competition.  At this time the capacity of the mill is not sufficient to meet all of her demand, so she has seen the need to buy another mill with greater capacity so that she can satisfy all of the demands of her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a corn mill that has a greater capacity than the one she has.  She trusts in God and in her work that in this way she will be able to improve her family's income and consequently their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill with greater capacity

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Señora Gabriela es de la ciudad de Santaní. Tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, hace más de 7 años. Ella se define como una mujer my trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable.
Comenta que día a día se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para ir a surtirse con productos frescos. Ella es muy conocida en el barrio, por lo que se hizo de buena fama. Su objetivo es llegar a tener un Mini supermercado, donde pueda tener todos los articulos de primera necesidad, para que sus clientes encuentren todos en este lugar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles como panificados, carnes, además hortalizas, bebidas y demás para el abastecimiento del local. Ella está esperanzada en el crédito, ya que le será de gran ayuda. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señora Gabriela comes from the city of Santaní.  She has a well stocked storeroom in her home, which she has had for seven years.  She describes herself as a very hard-working woman, who is enterprising and responsible. She comments that she gets up very early in the morning on a daily basis to stock up on cold products.  She is very well known in her neighborhood, because she has earned a good reputation. 

Her goal is to have a mini supermarket, where she can stock all kinds of everyday items so that her customers can find everything in one place.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of food such as bakery items and meat, and also vegetables, drinks and other items for stocking her premises.

She is hopeful about the loan, as it will be of great help to her.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, and other items to stock up her premises.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
A. rakhi is a mother of two sons. Both of her sons are very young and are not of school-going age yet. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He uses his rickshaw to provide pick up and drop off services to schoolchildren and to passengers. Currently, his rickshaw is creating problems and needs repair work. That’s why A. rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, her husband will buy new spare parts for his rickshaw, which will help his rickshaw run more smoothly. He has been operating his transport business for the past 15 years and A. rakhi is very confident that an investment will help him make his business better and increase his profits.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is A. rakhi.

loans.use: To buy new spare parts for a rickshaw

loans.name: Safo

texts.en: Safo is married to a cleaner and they have five children. After receiving schooling until the end of junior high school, Safo began selling gari (cassava flour) and maize in Jukwa, which she has now done for 25 years. Safo is grateful to the lenders for helping her to maintain her business to continue buying more bags of maize to sell. She has been able to assist her husband in supporting their family.

loans.use: to continue buying more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow and has six children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past three years; her potential clients are local area customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Luvuno is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of charcoal bags. She decided to join Yehu because of fast accessibility to loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal bags.

loans.name: Jessica De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora. Jessica es socia del banco comunal Ensueños, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, es considerada patrimonio arquitectónico y cultural del Ecuador. Su gente es amable, gentil, cálida y mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía.

La Señora. Jessica tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 12 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo está en la escuela inicial. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Jessica labora en una boutique que es propia y lo que más vende es ropa de niños, tiene su negocio 5 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal es socia hace 2 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa de niños, camisetas, blusas y pantalones para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jessica is a member of the "Ensueños" communal bank, and lives in the central area of the city of Azogues. This city is the capital of Cañar province, and is considered part of the architectural and cultural heritage of Ecuador. Its people are friendly, kind, and warm. They maintain their culture and traditions, and have a varied cuisine.

Jessica is 29, married, and has two children, ages 12 and 4. Her eldest son goes to a secondary school in the city, and her second son is in pre-school.  Her husband is a shopkeeper. They don't have their own house, so they rent. 

Jessica works in her own boutique, and what she mainly sells is children's clothing. She has had the business for five years, and works Mondays through Saturdays, from 9:00am to 7:00pm. She has been in the communal bank for two years. 

She is going to use her new loan to buy children's clothing, t-shirts, blouses, and pants to stock her merchandise. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, t-shirts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es casada, elabora y comercializa loza (olla, comales), dicho negocio surgió gracias a su madre quien la apoyo y le enseño la labor, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m. 
Ella, esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para la elaboración de loza, barro, nacazcolt, leña, ademas para transportarla, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y a incrementar las ganancias.
Su mayor sueño es crecer en el mercado, para darle los estudios a sus hijos y darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband and two children.  She’s married and sells earthenware (pots and griddles).  The business arose thanks to her mother who supported her and taught her the skill.  She works Monday through Friday from 8am until 5pm.

She’s asking for a loan to buy raw materials to make the earthenware: clay, nacazcol [a black dye] and fire wood and also to transport it.  This purchase will help her improve the business and increase profits.  Her greatest dream is to grow in the marketplace to provide her children with an education and a better life.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol and firewood.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 33 years old. He is married and together they have two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for mixed farming.

He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of dwelling. He has been a good client and this will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy farm produce like fertilizers and seeds for planting.

He will also use the loan money to prepare land for farming and during weeding.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. He is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 29 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past two years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells mainly phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronics and phone accessories, and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger phone center and become a tech consultant for all of mid-western Uganda. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more electronics and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 53, is the mother of four children. Since 2005 she has sold used clothes in a local market in the Ornlong Veng district in Siem Reap province. She is skillful in her communications with her customers. Generally, she is able to earn a profit of $5.00 a day.

This loan of $1,000 will be Touch’s first loan from HKL and Kiva. She will use it to buy more used clothes for her business. In the future Touch plans to expand her shop and sell more types of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Judith Estrellita

texts.es:
Judith de 24 años, trabaja vendiendo desayunos por la mañana y por la noche se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como hamburguesas, hot dog y salchipapas…etc. 

Trabaja solo desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Gracias a dios no ha tenido ningún problema con la delincuencia en su trabajo. Es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Tiene muachas aspiraciones con su restaurante por eso quiere comprar una cocina y cemento, arena para mejorar su local. Su meta es poder estudiar y así ser profesional, y con el tiempo hacer una familia feliz.
texts.en:
Judith is 24 years old. She works selling breakfasts mornings and nights she sells fast food such as hamburgers, hot dogs and sausage with french fries, etc.  

She works from 10 in the morning until 10 at night every day. Thankfully, she has had no problem with crime at her job. She is single and has no children. 

She has a lot of dreams for her restaurant and that is why she wants to buy a stove and cement and sand to improve her locale. Her goal is to be able to go to school and get a degree and in time have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a stove and do some repairs in her locale.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 38 years old and the mother of two children.  She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over nine years. They sell noodles and many kinds of dishes for breakfast and lunch. 

Diep is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase better quality materials to make food she can sell.  She hopes this will help her earn more money so she can reinvest in her business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy new furniture for her stall and purchase better quality materials to make food for selling.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking man. He is married and has two children. In order to acquire an income to sustain the family, he plants and harvests rice to sell upon maturity and harvest. He usually earns a yield twice per year, during the months of April and November. He would like to make his crops more productive. According to him, he needs to increase his earnings because the cost of living currently is highly expensive.

As of now, he is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) and to pay for laborers hired for land preparation. 

In the future, he would like to earn good profits every harvest season to make his family live fortunately.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pay for laborers hired for land preparation.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is 36 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Lona is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Señora Lucila se dedica a la venta de comida en la zona de El Tejar, en la casa de sus suegros, ella vive en la ciudad de El Alto donde diariamente baja a la ciudad a vender su comida para generar ingresos para la construcción de su domicilio, su sueño es ver terminada su casa tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 aún viven con ella y su esposo quien es empleado en un Supermercado de la Ciudad de La Paz, ella es muy trabajadora y esta muy contenta por acceder al préstamo ya que ayudara a mejorar su patio para estas épocas de lluvia. En la zona donde ella vende su comida es muy conocida ya que tiene muy buen sazón sus platillos, y por tal motivo tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Lucila sells food in the El Tejar area, in her in-laws house. She lives in the city of El Alto and every day she goes down to the city to sell her food in order to earn income for the construction of her home. Her dream is to see her house finished.

She has five children, and two still live with her and her husband, who is employed in a city supermarket in La Paz. She is very hardworking and is very content to be given a loan that will help her improve her courtyard for the rainy season. 

In the area where she sells her food she is well known as she has very tasty food and this is why she has lots of clients.

loans.use: to invest in the courtyard repairs of her home

loans.name: Blema Tesa Group

texts.en:
Regina is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Teshi, a place that is well-known in the country because the ethnic group the ga live there. The area is known for its beautiful countryside, its ethnic groups, and for being the land bridge that joins the mountain range with the coast. Regina is maried, her husband, and her two children live there.

She is a very diligent woman whose destiny has been to work hard to support her family. She has the support of her husband, who works in interior and exterior design.

Currently, Rigina makes a living by selling clothes. She started the business several years back, with her mother as her example to follow. She works every day in the afternoon, but her mainstay are the weekends, when she visits the majority of her customers. She also sometimes goes to fairs in the city.

With this loan, she will be able to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business. It is a very good time to invest because the city is in a season of celebration, which is when people buy her products most.

She thanks Kiva for supporting her as she moves forward, and in the near future, establishes a permanent storefront. She is thankful that this business continues to be strengthened so that her family lacks nothing. 

She represent the 'Blema tesa' group of four hardworking members.

loans.use: to buy more pants, shirts, and underwear to stock her business.

loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en: Mwajabu is married with  six children.She lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.Mwajabu runs a shop selling cosmetics.She has been in this business for more than three years now.Before undertaking this business she was in food vending business.The business couldn’t turn to be profitable because of inappropriate business skills.Then she decided to turn into cosmetics business after being adviced by a friend.In 2005 she attended a Business and Entrepreneurship Training offered by YOSEFO.She noticed tremendous improvement on her business after putting into practice the lessons she learned.She now want to replenish her stock after sales she made during  x-mass.She is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: Increase stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Xx

texts.en: X.

loans.use: xx

loans.name: Lele

texts.en: Lele is a 36 year old mother of six children.  She runs a flea market stall at the main marketplace in town, Savalalo.  There she sells her own sewing creations – Samoan dresses in the popular style (puletasis), t-shirts, and handicrafts that her husband and other villagers make, such as large wooden bowls for mixing kava.  She will use a SPBD loan to purchase a new sewing machine, fabric and handicraft supplies.  Lele says that she is able to make decent money from her flea market stall each week and as a result was able to vastly improve her family’s housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, fabric, and handicraft supplies

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a married woman. She has three children aged 20, 15 and 8 years old. Her husband is employed in a business but his income is not sufficient to support the family. Hence, she decided to set up her own business which initially rented a small shop and sold basic supplies.

Little by little her business grew and now, seven years later, she owns the shop and wishes to keep growing.

Martha is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase merchandise for her business and supply it with more products so that she can keep and increase her clientèle. She is offering to pay back the loan in 6 months.

Her and her family thank you for the support you give them so that they can provide a better education to their children and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Martha es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 15 y 8 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa y sus ingresos no son suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, fue por esto, que ella decidió poner su negocio, el cual inicialmente lo empezó rentando un pequeño local y vendiendo cosas básicas, que poco a poco fue creciendo con el mismo hasta ahora ya después de siete años con su negocio ahora ya tiene su local propio, y desea continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

Martha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar mercancía para su negocio y así surtirlo de más productos y así mantener y tener mayor cantidad de clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para poder brindarles educación a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Võ Thị Thịnh, 33 years old, lives in Nghi Trung, Nghi Lộc. She is a bridal make up artist for 5 years now. When she contracted her first loan from "Quỹ Tình thương" fund, she started a business selling shoes. In the following years, she had contracted bigger loans to invest in a bridal beauty salon. Her husband, Trần Thái Hòa, helps her out in his free time. They have a 6 years old son. Ms Thịnh's plan is to expand her bridal business. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy more make up accessories and bridal dresses

Translated from Vietnamese by Khanh Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Võ Thị Thịnh, 33 tuổi, sống tại xã Nghi Trung, Nghi Lộc làm nghề trang điểm cô dâu được 5 năm nay. Khi mới bắt đầu tham gia Quỹ Tình thương chị chỉ vay 75 USD về để buôn bán dày dép. Những năm tiếp theo chị vay mức vốn lớn đề đầu tư vào cửa hàng trang điểm cô dâu. Anh Trần Thái Hòa chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm việc đồng áng cũng tích cực hỗ trợ vợ trong công việc kinh doanh. Anh chị đang có 1 cháu trai lên 6 tuổi. Dự định của chị Thịnh là tiếp tục mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Chị đã làm đơn đề nghị vay 950 USD để mua dụng cụ trang điểm và áo cưới.

loans.use: buy wedding dress for hire, making up tool

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.en:
Yennifer, 42, is a very wise and hard-working woman. She is married, with seven children (two boys and five girls). The children attend the public school of the town. With profits from her sales activity, she has been able to buy a small piece of land and build a house made of stone.

This entrepreneur dedicates herself to the sale of pants, shirts and shoes. She has been doing this business fore more than sixteen years. She says that with incomes from her activity she is able to provide education and food for her children.

Yennifer is looking for funds to purchase wholesale clothes to sell during the Christmas period. She believes that it’s a great opportunity for her to increase her income and go on taking care of her very large family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to sell during the Christmas period in order to increase her income

loans.name: Seseei

texts.en:
Seseei is from the village of Faleula. She is forty-eight years of age and she has eleven children. She has no job and she is responsible for taking care of the kids. The husband also has no job and there in no regular income for her and the family.

This is a very good opportunity for her. This is the first time ever she is entitled to borrow money and she said that the opportunity should not be ignored. She is using her first loan to start up a pancake business. She is planning to sell at the primary school compound and she is targeting the school children as her core market. She is happy to run her own business and she is looking forward to continuing to earn more loans from SBPD.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, flour and oil for the pancake business

loans.name: Oibeck

texts.en: Oibeck T. lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006.  He is a cook and supplements his earnings by raising and selling livestock.  It is the family business started by his ancestors. He is requesting a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: for purchasing a cow

loans.name: Kasanja East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madina L.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to expand her fish business. Madina is 33 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Madina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and construct a house. Madina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Madina is joined in her small group by Eva T., Jane N., Harriet M., and Sarah L.. Eva T. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more food warmers. Jane N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to expand business. Harriet M. operates a business of selling matooke and wants to add to the business. Sarah L. is currently in the business of selling old clothes and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.use: To boost fish selling business

loans.name: Thi Chung's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Chung, 30 years old, has 3 children who are going to school. Her husband and she have been making rice noodles for about 5 to 6 years. She wants to borrow 2,006,000VND to buy rice in order to make noodles. Besides making noodles, she also breeds pigs and chickens. Mrs. Chung likes the microcredit program offered by TYM because with her daily income of 100,000 VN Dong she can manage to pay the weekly repayment. All of the women in her group include: Mrs. D. Thi Dinh, who want to take out 2,006,000 VNDong to buy more cloth for her tailor business. Mrs. C. Thi Bac want to take out the same amount to buy food to breed pigs. Mrs. N. Thi Lieu need the money to buy breed-chickens and gardening. Both Mrs. D. Thi Lien and N. Thi Lien want to borrow money to buy food for pigs and poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong N., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nghiêm Thị Chung, 30 tuổi, 3 con nhỏ đang đi học. Hai vợ chồng chị làm mỳ gạo từ rất lâu rồi (khoảng 5, 6 năm). Chị vay 2006000 đồng để mua gạo làm mỳ. Ngoài làm mỳ, chị còn chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì với thu nhập hàng ngày 100000 đồng chị có thể trả góp hàng tuần dễ dàng. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị gồm: Chị Đặng Thị Dinh vay 2006000 đồng để thêm tiền mua vải làm nghề may. Chị C. Thị Bắc vay 2006000 đồng để thêm tiền mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liệu vay 2006000 đồng để mua gà và trồng rau sạch. Chị Đỗ Thị Liên vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên vay 2006000 đồng để mua cám nuôi gà.

loans.use: breeding animals and gardening

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru:
Gulsara B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 52 and married with three children. She has a secondary school education. Gulsara has a business to support her family. She has a trading stall at the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been in business for 18 years. With the coming season, she needs to buy new goods. To increase her sales volume, Gulsara needs financial assistance. She decided to apply for a loan of 600 US dollars. This will help her increase the assortment of goods and meet the demands of the local population. Gulsara plans to repay her loan within nine months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Баротова Гульсара проживает в городе Турсун-Заде.Возраст 52 года, замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Чтобы обеспечить семью Гульсара занялась торговлей. На данный момент имеет торговую точку на рынке , где продает фрукты и овощи. . Занимается торговлей уже 18 лет. С приходом нового сезона для торговли необходимо закупить новый товар. А для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот ей необходима финансовая помощь. Поэтому она решила получить кредит в размере 600 долларов США. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент и удовлетворить спрос населения. Погасить кредит Гульсара планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Zoraida Victoria

texts.es:
Zoraida is a member of the bank Comunal Glorioso.

Zoraida is married, is 38 years old and has two children. Zoraida owns a store located in her neighborhood where she sells groceries, cosmetics, clothing and wallets. Her time is shared between her business and her housework. In addition, Zoraida and her husband provide Internet and photocopying services. Zoraida’s husband has a lock shop where he also invests the loans that he is granted.

Zoraida needs a loan of $700 which she will invest in the purchase of sugar, pastas, sodas and beer.

Zoraida’s dreams are to build her home, expand her business and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Zoraida pertenece al Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Zoraida es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Zoraida tiene una bodega surtida ubicada en su domicilio donde vende abarrotes, cosméticos, ropas, carteras, bebidas, Zoraida comparte sus tareas del hogar con la atención de sus negocios. Además Zoraida junto a su esposo tienen cabinas de Internet y servicios de fotocopiado. El esposo de Zoraida tiene una cerrajería en donde también invierte los prestamos que obtiene.

Zoraida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideos, gaseosas y cerveza.

Los sueños de Zoraida son construir su casa, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, pastas and soft drinks.

loans.name: Dienaba

texts.fr:
Dienaba B. is 52 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is requesting this loan in order to boost her business of buying and selling of vegetables and of “thioup” dyed fabrics. This loan will be repaid all at once in full at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Dienaba B., agée de 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans l’achat et la revente de tissu teint « Thioup » et de légumes. Ce prêt sera remboursé au bout de six mois et en une seule échéance .

loans.use: Buying and selling vegetables and “thioup” dyed fabrics.

loans.name: Mirzomuddin

texts.ru:
Mirzomuddin P. lives in the Jomi region. He is 33 years old and has 3 children. He has a bachelor's degree in journalism. Since his salary is very low, which is not sufficient to maintain his family, he has been in the farming business for the past 6 years. He plants corn on the small piece of land he owns every year. He uses the corn as a feedstock for chickens and cattle. He sells any extra corn to the neighbors. Since he is the sole provider for his family, this activity helps him to pay for all of the necessities. At this point in time, Mirzomuddin wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers so he could grow quality crops. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Мирзомудин житель района А.Джоми . Возраст 33 года, женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности журналист. Так как заработная плата маленькая и ее не хватает на содержании семьи клиент вот уже 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он сеет кукурузу на своем набольшом участке каждый год. Кукурузу использует как корм курам и фураж для своей коровы. Лишнее продает своим соседям .Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать свою семьюьТак как кормильцем семьи является он сам. В данный момент Мирзомудин хочет купить семеня и минеральные удобрения ,что бы получить качественный урожай. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sabaheta

texts.en: 39-year-old Sabaheta is married with two children, ages 20 and 22. Her husband has a job that earns about 250 KM monthly. This is Sabaheta's first loan at WWI in the amount of 1000 KM. She will use it to buy seeds and compost to expand her vegetable business. She hopes this business expansion will allow her to better support her household.

loans.use: To buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai S., 42, is married and often works with his wife in the Siem Reap province selling vegetables and fish in the market. Since 2006, his wife, Pot Sila (pictured), 30, has been selling vegetables and fish to earn approximately US$20 in revenue everyday. The couple have four children together. Mr. Mai S. requests a loan of US$500 to begin breeding pigs for sale.

loans.use: To breed pigs for sale.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn P. was born in 1960 and now lives in Sdok Thom Village in Kampong Cham Province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn his living. On his plantation he now faces a small problem because his field is infertile and this is affecting his crop.

To deal with this problem, he decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Mach Mon, assists him on the plantation. She is pictured here on the left of the photo.

Mr. Sorn P. is the father of nine children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while six others are attending the local school. The youngest one is staying at home because the child is too young for school.  .

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, su esposa e hija, por el momento viven en la ciudad, él vive con su padre. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, su padre es propietario de varias parcelas de terreno con acceso a la carretera, por ello que siembran en todas sus chacras, mayormente cultivan carambolas y demás frutas cítricas, cuando es tiempo de cosecha, envían sus frutas por camión a la ciudad. Sembrar carambolas le es muy rentable, porque es una planta que una vez que empieza a dar fruto no detiene su producción, es por ello que casi en todas sus chacras han sembrado carambolas, Fidel conoce muy bien cuando abonar y cuidar adecuadamente la planta. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insecticidas para evitar a las mosquitas que perjudican las hojas a las carambolas, también comprará abono para su chacra.
texts.en:
Fidel, 41, is partnered. His wife and daughter are living in the city for now, while he's living with his father. He's worked on farms since he was a boy. His father owns some land with access to a road so they can plant all over the land. They mostly grow "carambolas" [a kind of mango] and citrus fruits. At harvest time, they deliver their fruit to the city by truck. Growing carambolas is very profitable because once it starts to fruit, it doesn't quit. That's why almost the entire farm is planted in carambolas. Fidel well knows when to fertilize and how to adequately care for the crop. This is his third MFP loan. With the money, he will buy insecticides to ward off the bugs that damage the leaves of the carambolas. He'll also buy fertilizer for the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa Sané P. est une veuve remariée. Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente à crédit (mensuel) de tissu teinté mais en même temps elle fait un commerce quotidien de salade et légumes. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Hawa Sané P. is a remarried widow who is active in the commerce of dyed fabrics, sold on a monthly credit plan. But at the same time, she sells salad and vegetables each day. She would like to use this loan to increase her capital to improve family living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth and concurrently in salad and vegetables

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely M., 53, is married to Melchor, a farmer. Their marriage has been blessed with four children: Ferdinand, 29, Janeth, 25, George, 23, and Darwin, 21. All of them were unable to graduate from high school due to lack of financial resources. Today, Mely and her husband live in their house alone, as all their children are busy with their own jobs.  

Mely has been running a simple store in their village since 2003. She is currently asking for a PHP 6000 (150 USD) loan in order to increase the variety products that she sells in her store and to support their farming needs. She has said that she must work double duty in order to assist her husband in their farm so that they can always provide for the needs of their family.  Mely always prays to God to give them good health, especially now as they are getting older.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernán es un hombre de 48 años, padre de 4 hijos, José de 17, Jaime de 15, Rina de 11 y Juana de 9 años, el tiene una casa propia hecha de adobe, donde vive con ellos y a los cuales quiere dar unos buenos estudios superiores. Hernán a trabajado en muchas cosas en su vida, pero desde hace 18 años se decida al trabajo de la albañilería, en su alejado barrio Villa el Salvador de la ciudad de Juliaca, él es el albañil con más experiencia, al que sus vecinos recurren cuando hay que hacer un techamiento o levantar una pared, Hernán disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede pagar la educación de sus hijos, el desea comprar más tablones y puntales, para realizar mejor las construcciones, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Lo difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente, pero no les ha quitado la fuerza y las ganas de superación que llevan dentro. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con el dinero solicitado comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Hernan is a 48 year old man and father of 4 children; Jose is 17, Jaime is 15, Rina is 11 and Juana is 9 years old. He has his own home made of adobe, where he lives with his children and would like to provide them with a good advanced education. Hernan has worked at many things in his life, but for the last 18 years he dedicates his time to brickwork in his remote neighborhood of Villa el Salvador of the city of Juliaca. He is the most experienced bricklayer to whom his neighbors come when there is a need for roofing or building of a wall. Hernan enjoys working in construction and knows that this noble profession will enable him to pay for the education of his children. He wants to buy more beams and struts to be able to improve his construction projects and thus improve his income. The difficult part of his work is carrying the heavy bricks and having to handle the cement at times even with his hands. This has caused his hands to age rapidly, but has not taken away their strength nor the desire to get ahead that he carries inside him. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he does not want to stop paying on it due to lack of money, so he is already signing more contracts for construction work. He is the only male in his community bank and always tries to be responsible and respectful with the other members. With the money from the loan he will buy new beams and will increase the number of struts, which will allow him to work in more construction projects and improve his income

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessary supplies for his work.

loans.name: Ronaldo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ronaldo G. es muy trabajador por la razón de que se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de canastos y otros objetos derivados del bambú. Ha adquirido mucha experiencia en este ramo por lo que se ha catalogado como un excelente trabajador del bambú en la ciudad de Masaya.

Es importante destacar que actualmente atraviesa una necesidad como lo es la de adquirir su material de trabajo por lo que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para dichas compras y así continuar en su actividad beneficiando a su pequeña hija que tanto requiere del apoyo de su padre por lo que está en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronaldo G. is a very hard worker, dedicating himself to making baskets and other objects from bamboo. He has gained a lot of experience in this arena, and has become well-known in the city of Masaya for his excellent work in bamboo crafts. It’s important to highlight that he currently is going through a time of need that involves purchasing the raw materials for his work. For this reason, he has sought out the backing of Ceprodel to become the recipient of a loan for said purchases. In this manner, he can continue his work, which is of great benefit to his young daughter. She very much needs her father’s support, as she is still of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his work.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es: La Señora Mirtha tiene 32 años, esta casada con el Sr. Anibal Figueredo, tienen un hijo en edad escolar. Se dedican a la fabricacion de prendas desde hace quince años. Adquiriò este oficio de la madre quien tambien era costurera. Iniciò sus labores con una maquina familiar y actualmente ya cuenta con  catorce maquinas industriales, dando empleo a mas de seis familias. La Señora Mirtha es la encargada de los obreros del area de produccion, mientras que su marido asume la responsabilidad de las ventas hacia el interior del pais. El credito será  destinado a la compra telas para la temporada de otoño-invierno y asi cumplir con la demanda  y continuar ayudando a tanta gente dàndoles la oportunidad de trabajar dignamente. Ella anhela poder expandir sus productos a la mayor cantidad de localidades de nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirtha is 32 years old and married to Mr. Anibal Figueredo. They have a school-age son. For the past 15 years they have worked making clothing. She learned this trade from her mother who was also a seamstress. She began working with her family's machine and now has fourteen industrial machines, providing employment to six more families. Mrs. Mirtha is in charge of the workers in the production area, while her husband assumes responsibility of the sales in the central part of the country. The loan will be used to buy fabrics for the fall-winter season to supply for demand and to continue helping so many people by giving them the opportunity of having a dignified job. She desires to be able to expand and sell their products to even more locations in their country.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, brooches, needles, etc.

loans.name: Sekela S.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Sekela M. from Kyela. She is single with one child, age 12. Sekela has been running a crops-selling business since 2001. A typical maize business is a stand on the side of the road where maize is often piled high in baskets.  Customers can scrutinize the quality of the product before purchase and specify the exact amount they would like to purchase. Maize is very important to the Tanzanian culture as maize is used to make one of their staple dishes, ugali. Ugali is made solely of maize flour and water.
She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sekela currently earns about 130USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to establish another business. Sekela thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos  del Distrito D. Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos.  Vive en el Barrio 3 D. Mayo y cuenta con estudios D. 1ro D. primaria.

Martha viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 11 años, es socia fundadora e inició sus préstamos con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió comprar víveres para si negocio D. venta D. comidas (alimentos).
En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. 1200.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad D. productos como gaseosas y golosinas, además D. insumos para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.  Su mayor deseo es poner su restaurante o poner una tienda D. venta D. golosinas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank in Mazocruz, Coallo, Puno. She is 54 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in the 3 D. Mayo neighborhood. Martha completed her formal education through elementary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years, and is one of the founding members. With her first loan of 300 soles, Martha was able to purchase foodstuffs to sell. Now she would like another loan of 1200 soles, which she will use to purchase more food, such as soft drinks and sweets to sell. Additionally, Martha plans to purchase ingredients to use in the preparation of food. Her goal is to open a restaurant or a candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, sweets and other foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Vanessa Isadora

texts.es: Doña Vanessa Isadora  es una mujer que desde joven trabaja en la venta de cosmético, para ayudar a los gastos de la familia. Tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo es Tipógrafo, tiene dos hijos de 9 y 16 años estudiantes, ella comenzó con prestamos en Afodenic es su cuarto ciclo y da las gracias por el beneficio que ha podido mantener su negocio. Con este préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de la casa que esta en malas condiciones y embaldosar la sala para poder estar cómoda con su familia y gozar de los esfuerzos. Sus planes  es poder incrementar las ventas, captar clientes.
texts.en:
Vanessa Isador is a woman who has worked selling cosmetics to help with family expenses since she was a young girl. She is 37 and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband is a printer. She has two children, ages 9 and 16. They are students. She started with loans from Afodenic. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she is thankful for the benefit of having been able to keep her business. With this loan she will buy construction materials to change the roof of her house, which is in bad condition. She will also tile the living room to make her family comfortable and enjoy the benefits of her hard work. Her plan is to be able to increase sales and get customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to change the roof

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa Q. is from Agsu city, Azerbaijan. For the last 20 years she and her husband have been dedicated to her sheep breeding  business, a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. She is the mother of five children who she cares for and has the responsibility of educating.

It’s important to note that Shukufa is very conscious of her duty to support her family financially. It’s for this reason that she turned to AqorInvest Credit Union to obtain a loan to purchase some sheep to help her increase their income. With your help, Shukufa will be able to make her business succeed and support her family.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: William

texts.en: William S. is a young barber who uses old equipment in his barber shop in Hohoe. William has received education to a junior high level. He is responsible for paying his food, clothing and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy equipment and a sterilizer for his sharp implements. He hopes to reinvest the new profit from his business for expansion.

loans.use: To buy barbers' equipment.

loans.name: Antonita

texts.en:
Antonita S. is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials for distillation.  Antonita is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials for distillation

loans.name: Farid

texts.en: Farid is a 40-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He has owned a car electric shop since 1992. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Farid is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase tools for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his shop.

loans.name: Rasidatu

texts.en:
Rasidatu sells foodstuffs and drinks. She has been in business for the past nine years and with this income assists her husband in the children's upbringing. She has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years and is a faithful client. She goes to Cotonou once every two weeks to get foodstuffs in bags in large quantity at a discount. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs which will enable her to meet customers' demand.

Rasidatu is 32 years old and has four children. She says thank you and promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Djonmahmad

texts.en:
The agriculture business is labour intensive because it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. For four years Djonmahmad has dedicated himself to raising cattle to support his humble and reliant family. Currently Djonmahmad has turned to IMON International for a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase calves to raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him but also his dearest parents.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of young cattle

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla D. C. is married to Renato D. C. for 15 years. They reside in Agusan Del Sur. They are both rice planters. In need of additional financial support, Perla joined CEVI to avail of its financial service. She applied for a loan of Php6, 000, which will be used for farm inputs. She likes CEVI’s program especially of the low interest rate and monthly meetings. Her loan will assist her to have a good produce out of her farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is a 50-year-old mother of three children, ages 15, 17, and 20.  She currently lives with her common-law husband, and all three of her children are currently studying at university. For the past 15 years, Lidia has been tending to the land she inherited from her parents in an area of Cochabamba Department called Albra Rancho. Lidia is a very hard worker and has been through many tough times. A short while ago, her husband became psychologically ill and she has had to support her family on her own for over two years. She continues to work hard to make sure that her children do not miss out on any opportunities; Lidia wakes up at 4:30am to bring her livestock food and to begin milking them.  

With this loan from CIDRE, Lidia plans on purchasing soy husks for feeding her dairy cows. She believes this will help them increase her milk production, and in turn increase her earnings. Her dream is that her children all become professionals and have families of their own.

loans.use: The purchase of soy for livestock feed

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en: M. Pascal, aged thirty-five years old, has a family of six members, that is, four children, his wife, and himself. He is operating a retail/wholesale shop located at Tawakan stores in Kasese Town. He has been in his business so far for five years. He is requesting the loan to purchase retail items such as soap, basins, plates, cooking oil, etc for more profit return. He dreams of developing his shop and he wishes to try his level best to work hard for his business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, basins, plates, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 2 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso,  troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur sixième  prêt de groupe. Les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font la vente de fritures, d’atiecké, d’huile alimentaires, de savons traditionnels et  de la restauration, de la teinture etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter près d’une dizaine de complets de bazins teintés, 2 paniers et 1/2 de poissons fumés, 3 balles de friperie et 5 colorants différents  et 15kg de soude caustique. Elles s’approvisionnent aux grands marchés de la ville de Sikasso et à Bamako. Elles vendent dans les marchés de Sikasso ville, à domicile et de façon ambulante, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent demander des prêts plus importants pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi are married women averaging 32 years of age and 2 children each living mainly in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers and are now on their sixth group loan. The past loans have been repaid. The women of the group sell atiecké fritters, cooking oil, and traditional soaps, and they work at food catering, dyeing cloth, etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy nearly a dozen dyed damask outfits, 2½ baskets of smoked fish, 3 bales of second-hand clothing, 5 different coloring agents, and 15 kg of caustic soda. Supplies are gotten at the big markets of Sikasso City and in Bamako. Sales are made in cash and often on credit to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Sikasso City, in homes, and door-to-door. The group members each anticipate earning an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be put into savings and used for family needs. The other portion will be invested in the businesses. Their ambition is to ask for bigger loans to satisfy their customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., age 40, is married and lives with her five children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer who works for US $2 each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a horse-cart driver who makes US $3 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have made this a difficult year for many Cambodians, Seng S. included. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of US $300. Her husband will use the money to purchase a new horse-cart.

loans.use: purchasing a new horse-cart

loans.name: Pedra's Group

texts.en:
Pedra I. is from the town of Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Pedra owns and operates a business providing a jeep, the Filipino version of a bus, for transportation to local community member. She inherited the jeep from her mother-in-law, Evangeline, who passed away but still holds the jeep's operating license in her name for the next three years(as pictured). Pedra will transfer the license and name of the jeep to herself after the three years. Pedra has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pedra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.

Pedra is requesting a new loan of 14,800 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her vehicle's maintenance and repair

loans.name: Assanatou

texts.fr: Assanatou Bâ est mariée, elle est âgée de 44 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 9 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe une activité de vente de tabac. Ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants et d'appuyer financièrement son papa.
texts.en:
Assanatou Bâ is married, 44-years-old, and has two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for four and a half years and has received nine loans from them before. She is developing a business to sell tobacco. Her profits will ensure the schooling and health of her children and provide financial support for her father.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promotion of commercial business

loans.name: Jovelita

texts.en:
Jovelita B. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Jovelita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as candies, some food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jovelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes H. D. A. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente. Vive junto a su hija y su madre D. 91 años D. edad, la cual necesita mucha atención médica, lo que incluye un enorme gasto D. medicinas. Mercedes posee un comedor y una venta D. tortillas, las cuales la elabora en las mañanas y mediodías. Durante largos años este negocio ha sido muy rentable para ella y su familia, lo cual la ha incentivado a querer surtirlo más, situación que le ha sido difícil, ya que posee grandes gastos D. medicina para su madre y la responsabilidad D. pagar mensualmente su casa la cual ha comprado a crédito. Es por ello que Mercedes solicita un préstamo, con el fin D. contar con la capacidad monetaria para adquirir nuevos productos y comprar mayor cantidad D. los que ya posee, tales como arroz frijoles, maíz, verduras, frutas y otros más. Esto con el deseo D. poder vender más comida y D. esta manera obtener mayores ganancias, lo cual le permita mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
