Mercedes H. D. A., 62, lives in San Vicente department with her daugther and her 91-year-old mother, who needs much medical attention, which means huge medical expenses. Mercedes has an eatery and she sells tortillas, which she makes mornings and afternoons. This business has been profitable for her and her family for many years. She has wanted to stock it better but this has been very difficult due to her mother's medical expenses and her monthly house payment which she must make. For these reasons, Mercedes is asking for funding to buy more supplies like rice, beans, corn, vegetables, fruits, etc. Her aim is to sell more meals so that her profits will increase thus improving her economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo cuenta con 22 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos y  cuenta con lote de terreno. Su principal actividad es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia vagoneta, en la ruta local perteneciendo a una línea de los trufi local, contando con ruta y parada fija. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte. En el sector del transporte de pasajeros existe fuerte competencia, sin embargo su fortaleza radica en que trabaja en una ruta fija y cuenta con una parada fija perteneciendo a una línea de transporte que cubre la ruta de una ciudad a otra que se encuentra al otro lado del país, quienes por  el buen servicio cuentan con bastante clientela. El crédito que lo obtuvo lo destino para el amurallado de su lote y compra de un portón.
Teofilo y su familiar cuentan con 4 créditos en la institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, contando con crédito tan solo en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 22 years old, single, does not have children, and owns a plot of land. His main business activity is providing passenger transportation services in the station wagon that he owns. Teofilo operates locally as a “trufi” (a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops) and has four years of experience in this business. In the passenger transport sector there is strong competition, but Teofilo has the advantage of driving a fixed route with established stops for a company that is known for providing good transportation services to the other side of the country and has a steady clientele.

This loan will be used to build a wall on his property and purchase a gate. He and his family have taken out four loans with the Institution and has demonstrated a good payment history. Teofilo has only requested loans from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and install a gate on his property

loans.name: Nakisunga Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: S. Cate at the top left also appears in the group photo and she is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is 43 years old and married with 7 children as she takes care of 1 orphan, yet all the children are in school. Cate is a friendly lady with a salon business in Nakisunga that has been in existence for 17 years and she is able to make 35,000/= as profits weekly although she is faced with a challenge of the defaulters that usually affect her cash flow. She has a goal of building a residential house of her own for rent as well as expanding her business and being able to get her children’s school dues on time and being able to feed them continuously. Cate needs a loan to be able to restock her salon with more goods like braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair pieces and so on.

loans.use: Restocking her salon with more goods like braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair pieces and others.

loans.name: Eleuterio Del Carmen

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	
Don Eleuterio Gómez R. tiene una propiedad donde él se dedica a las actividades de trabajo agropecuarias específicamente a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos como frijol y maíz, y a la ganadería como pequeño productor. Este financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de dos toretes para desarrollo o engorde,  la razón por la cual este cliente  quiere este crédito es para comprar ganado y después venderlos,  de esta forma el obtendrá una ganancia por  la venta de estos, lo que le permitirá mantener una forma de trabajo que le genere otros ingresos en todo el año. Don Eleuterio Gómez comenzó este tipo de actividad de trabajo sembrando únicamente  granos, frijol y maíz desde su infancia adquiriendo bastante experiencia en este rubro,  
El señor Eleuterio Gómez antes de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado el todo el tiempo se dedicaba a la agricultura sembrando granos básicos ya que esto se practica de forma tradicional en el campo y a la vez es un rubro bastante importante, que se utiliza  para el comercio de estos  y en nuestra economía tiene mucha importancia, debido a que estos granos son un producto de vital  consumo en nuestra dieta alimenticia. Con este crédito el espera mantener una actividad de trabajo permanente en todo el año, esto le generara los ingresos que necesita para poder mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos que ellos necesitan, ya que él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de él. El Señor Eleuterio Gómez lleva 9 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y 8 créditos que se le han otorgado. El impacto y beneficio que ha tenido este cliente en todo el tiempo que lleva de trabajar con Ceprodel es bastante notable ya que ha incrementado su unidad productiva lo que le generado mayores ingresos no solamente en épocas de invierno con la cosecha, con la compra venta de ganado este cliente obtiene otros ingresos en épocas de verano, esto le ha impactado de forma positiva en su economía mejorando sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Borrower Profile Eleuterio Gómez R. has land where he works in agriculture; specifically, he plants basic grains such as beans and corn. He also raises cattle on a small scale. He will use this loan to buy two young bulls for fattening. He wants this loan to buy the animals and later sell them so that he can make a profit from them. This will allow him to have work that will generate income for him during the whole year. Eleuterio Gómez began by planting only beans and corn, which he has done since he was a child so he has a lot of experience in this work. Eleuterio Gómez, used to work at planting basic grains before he started buying and selling cattle year-round. Planting basic grains is done in a traditional manner in the countryside and it is a very important business because basic grains are traded commercially and in our economy this is very important. These products are of vital importance in our diet. With this loan he hopes to continue an economic activity during the whole year. This will generate the income that he needs to provide for his family and cover their expenses. He is married and has four children who depend on him. Eleuterio Gómez has been working with Ceprodel for 9 years and it has granted him 8 loans. The impact and benefit to this borrower during the time he has worked with Ceprodel is notable. He has increased his productivity, which has generated improved income, and not only during the winter harvest. With the buying and selling of cattle, this borrower obtains income during the summer, as well. This has had a positive impact for him, improving his economic situation, his income, and his living standards.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two young bulls

loans.name: Brenda Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Brenda del Socorro G. M., tiene un negocio de venta de frutas ubicados a cuatro cuadras aledañas del mercado central en la esquina de la Ferretería Navarro ahí la señora G. M. tiene 10 años de estar operando en ese lugar su negocio empezo con  un capital de C$ 1,000.00, capital que fue una ayuda para ella de parte de su mamá.
La Señora Brenda G. vende frutas peladas en bolsas bananos, sandias, naranjas etc, de los cuales necesita los financiamientos para surtir su negocio.
Siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante tiene una niña de  que es la razón por la cual se esfuerza cada día mas trabaja de lunes a domingos de 8 de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde sin descansar un día a su niña se la trae al tramo junto con ella por que no tiene quien se la cuide lleva  dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel y siente que la hemos ayudado bastante por que al suave ha venido comprando sus  cositas que son útiles para ella en su casa además
texts.en:
Sra. Brenda del Socorro G. M. has a business selling fruits in the four blocks surrounding the central market. Her stand is located on the corner near the Navarro Hardware Store.

Sra. G. has ten years of experience running her business at this location. She started with capital worth 1000 NIO, which was assistance she received from her mother. Brenda sells bags of bananas, watermelons, oranges, and other fruits. She needs financing in order to restock her business.

Brenda has always strived to get ahead. She has a daughter who is the reason why she works hard every day. Brenda looks after her stand Monday through Sunday from 8am until 4pm without taking a day of rest. She brings her daughter with her because she does not have anyone to take care of her.

Brenda has been working with CEPRODEL for two years. She feels the assistance she has received has gone smoothly in helping her buy things that are useful to her and for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & bags for her business

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “PROGRESO”, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo y está conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El banco comunal está representado por la socia Bertha que es la presidenta, Susana que es la secretaria y Yeni Pilar que es la Tesorera. Las socias se reúnen cada treinta días en las oficinas D. la unidad D. micro finanzas D. la Asociación Arariwa. 
 
Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo: venta D. golosinas, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. videos y cd’s, venta D. comida, venta D. ropas, venta D. caldos y emolientes y venta D. cuadros D. oleo y otros socios ofrecen servicios D. ayudante D. cocina y estibador. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, las socias se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal. 

Josefina forma parte del banco comunal “Progreso”, tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida D. forma ambulatoria en la zona del parque industrial D. la ciudad del Cusco. Josefina se levanta a las 2 D. la madrugada para preparar sus platos D. comida y despues lleva a vender todos los días a las 6 a.m. D. mañana y se queda hasta las 10 a.m. Por las tardes, ella a partir D. las 2 p.m. hasta las 4 p.m. se va a comprar al mercado sus insumos al mercado para preparar sus platos D. comida para el día siguiente. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a la venta D. comida y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Antes ella tenía un restaurante cerca a la empresa “Coca Cola” pero le fue muy mal y tuvo que retirarse del lugar. Actualmente, Josefina tiene un puesto D. venta D. forma ambulatoria. Josefina requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y papa. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco es una ciudad que se caracteriza por sus centros arqueológicos, su centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia, siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país.
texts.en:
The “PROGRESO” communal bank composed of 14 hard-working, enterprising members, who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and offer their children a better future through their own efforts, is currently in its 6th loan cycle. It is represented by its president, Bertha, its secretary, Susana and Yeni Pilar, treasurer. Members meet every 30 days in the Asociación Arariwa’s microfinance unit’s offices. Members are involved in a variety of commercial activities, such as the sales of: snacks, cosmetics, videos and CDs, food, clothing, soups and healing creams, oil paintings. Others work as kitchen helpers and stevedores. The bank has had several loan cycles and, as the members state, they are happy and satisfied with credit services, savings and training and the length of time the bank has been in existence. Josefina is 57 years old, married and a member of “Progreso.” She peddles prepared meals at an industrial park in Cusco. She rises at 2am to prepare her meals and then goes out to sell them from 6am until 10am daily. In the afternoon, from 2pm until 4pm, she does her marketing to buy the ingredients for next day’s meals. She has been in this line of work for 12 years now and does well thanks to the efforts she puts into it. She used to have an eatery near the Coca-Cola bottling plant but she didn’t fare well and had to leave that location. Currently, she sells from a portable cart. She needs funds to buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil and potatoes. The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. Cusco is a city famous for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history being an enchanting city in the south of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Josefina needs funds to buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil and potatoes.

loans.name: Roselmira

texts.es: Roselmira tiene 39 años, ella vive con su pareja Aquiles de 40 años, quien es panadero y sus hijos Pierina de 12 años, Brayan de 11 años, Kenedy de 7 años y Yamira de 4 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de muñecos de peluches, por lo que va a la ciudad a comprarlos al por mayor, para luego ser vendidos a sus clientes y vecinos que le gustan estos productos, la gran mayoría de las veces son ofrecidos de forma ambulatoria, en donde logra mayor aceptación de sus compradores. Con este trabajo Roselmira se siente muy contenta, ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo libre para dedicarse a sus hijos. Las ventas que logra hacer son muy buenas, es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo y convertir su negocio en un gran bazar, donde pueda exhibir mejor su mercadería, evitando el cansancio durante el día cuando va caminando porla ciudad para ofrecer sus productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará peluches para aumentar sus ventas en estas próximas festividades por el día de la madre.
texts.en:
Roselmira is 39 years old and has her own home. She lives with her partner Aquiles (age 40), who is a baker, and their children: Pierina (age 12), Brayan (age 11), Kenedy (age 7), and Yamira (age 4).

For more than six months, Roselmira has been selling stuffed toys. She travels to the city to buy her products in bulk and then sells them to customers and neighbors who enjoy this type of merchandise. Most of her sales are made as a street vendor, which gives her great recognition among her buyers. Roselmira is very happy with her work because it provides her enough free time to dedicate to her children. Her sales have gone very well, so she wants to continue investing in her business and convert it into a large bazaar where she can display more merchandise. She avoids getting fatigued during the day by walking through the city as she offers her products.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Roselmira promises to complete all of her payments on time. The loan she requested will be used to buy stuffed toys so that she can increase her sales for the upcoming Mother’s Day holiday.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stuffed toys

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es:
La Señor Jhony H. C. 25 años de edad, el se vino a ivirgarzama ya que no pudo encontrar trabajo en Cochabamba él a muy corta edad quedo huérfano y creció con su hermana mayor hasta la edad de 20 años no pudo ingresar a la universidad por dedicarse a trabajar, el se reunió un poco de capital como albañil y monto una pequeña  venta de ropa en el mercado de la playa de autos de ivirgarzama, el se vino a ivirgarzama por el comentario de uno de sus amigos que le dijo que en el trópico  había mercado para los comerciantes el dejo su familia en Cochabamba y se vino para trabajar como comerciante en ivirgarzama. 

El solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos para que en un fututo pueda formar una familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jhony H. C., 25, came to Ivirgarzama since he couldn’t find work in Chochabamba. He was orphaned at a very young age and grew up living with his older sister until he was 20. He couldn’t enter the university because he had to work. He put some money together working as a mason and started selling clothing in the market at the beach of Ivirgarzama. He came to Ivirgarzama because one of his friends told him that in the tropics there was work for salespeople. He left his family in Cochabamba and came to work as a merchant in Ivirgarzama. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise so that he can increase his income because he wants to start a family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (to buy merchandise)

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A., 53, was one of the poorest among the poor women who joined ASHI in 1997. She hoped that someday through loans requested from ASHI, she would be able to have an established business to support her in bringing her family out of the umbrella of poverty.  She and her husband started cultivating a small parcel of land in their backyard, growing rice and vegetables to sell. They were both very familiar with this occupation from childhood, having learned the skills from their farmer parents. After receiving several loans since joining ASHI, their business eventually improved, as did the quality of their family life. Using her profit, Maria was able to send her two children to a vocational course in college and has been supporting the needs of her eldest child, who is unemployed due to his limited education. 

Since farming is the main source of Maria’s financial need to support her dream of improving her family's standard of living, she hopes to make it sustainable and profitable. With more capital, she plans to purchase equipment, a variety of vegetable seedlings, and a better variety of rice seedlings to increase her sales turnover and profit.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for growing rice and vegetables

loans.name: Luz Gladys

texts.es:
Luz Gladys tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, el cual se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su poclación situada en áreas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, especialmente de cerdos. Ella cría estos animales es espacios al aire libre situados cerca de su domicilio, y cuando ya han desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona adquiriendo animales para venderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos ella ayuda al sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Luz Gladys desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus cerdos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz Gladys siempre está buscando formas de agenciarse de ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la fotografía nos muestra uno de sus cerdos listo para ser vendido.
texts.en:
Luz Gladys is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in the community of Quemazón, a rural area belonging to the district of Mórrope. It is characterized by having a large part of its population located in rural areas that are very far apart from each other. The place belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For ten years, she has been raising and selling animals, especially pigs. She raises these animals in outdoor areas located close to her residence. When they have developed enough, she offers them for sale to the merchants who always visit the area to adquire animals to sell them in the city of Chiclayo. In addition, she also sells basic necessity items and groceries in a small store in her residence. With this income, she helps to support her family. Luz Gladys wants to acquire feed to improve the raising of her pigs. For this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 800 nuevos soles to help her acheive her goal. Luz Gladys is always looking for ways to acquire income that will allow her to get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to offer them a better quality of life. One of the pigs that are ready to be sold is shown in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed to improve the raising of the pigs for sale.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun T. and her husband, Mr. Khom Moun, have been married since 1972 and have seven children: three sons and four daughters. They live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. Her husband is a construction worker and rice farmer. Sokhoeun is applying for a $600 loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita C.'s main source of income comes from selling bamboo shoots in her community. She is 56 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Capellan. Carmelita has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional cartons of plastic bowls

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 23 años, el tiene un pequeño local donde vende materiales de construcción, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). 

Por la falta de oportunidades laborables su familia lo ayudo a conseguir materiales de construcción para que tuviera su propio negocio, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo tener su propia local para vender mas materiales de construcción. Trabaja todo el día con un ayudante. 

Para tener mas materias y venderlos con mas rapidez a su clientela el quiere compra con el préstamo cemento y ladrillos. En el futuro quiere comprar un solar para su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor, 23, has a small area where he sells building materials and supplies. He lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area in ecological decay. Due to the lack of employment opportunities his family helped him get building materials and supplies so that he could have his own business. With much effort and dedication he managed to get his own locale to sell more building materials and supplies. He works all day with a helper. To have more materials and sell them more quickly to his customers, he wants a loan to buy cement and bricks. In the future, he’d like to buy a lot to install his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and bricks.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina tiene 60 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijas, quienes la apoyan en su trabajo. Hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la preparación y elaboración de panqueques (masa compuesta de harina, zapallo y camote) y café. Su puesto queda a media hora de su casa, lugar muy concurrido, por ser el paradero final de los buses. Es así que a partir de las 3:00 de la tarde hay mucha concurrencia de gente, que gustan de sus platillos. En un inicio solía trabajar sola, por lo que terminaba agotada, conforme pasó el tiempo pudo contar con el apoyo de su sobrina y en ocasiones de su hija. Esta muy contenta con su labor, por lo que sus ganancias son muy buenas y no descuida las labores de su casa. Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es tener un local y poner un restaurante, ya que la cocina le apasiona mucho. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy en día. Agripina  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un toldo para cubrirse de la lluvia, ya que se encuentra en temporada de invierno, asimismo le ayudará protegerse del sol en verano.
texts.en:
Agripina, 60, is a hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters who help her with the work. For over 10 years she has worked preparing and making “panqueques” (dough made from flour, pumpkin and sweet potatoes) and coffee. Her stand is half an hour from home in a very crowded spot because it’s the last stop on a bus route. From 3pm on there are a lot of people there that like her dishes. When she started out she used to work by herself but she would finish exhausted. As time went by she was able to count on her niece’s help and occasionally on help from her daughter. She is very happy with her work because her profits are good and she does not neglect her household chores. Her greatest wish is to have a fixed locale to install a restaurant because cooking is a passion of hers. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments on time like she’s been doing to date. Agripina plans to use the requested funds to buy a tarp to cover herself because it’s the winter rainy season. The tarp will equally protect her from the sun during the summer

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tarp to protect her food stand from the rain.

loans.name: Ilsy Estela

texts.es:
Para Ilsy T., la venta de alimentos pasteles y fritos es su trabajo y lo realiza con alegría desde hace ya diez años  porque le trae muchas satisfacciones. Ella inició vendiendo fritos diariamente cuando en una época su esposo quedó sin trabajo y debió resolver las necesidades de sostenimiento de su hogar.

Ilsy  ha visto crecer poco a poco su microempresa, ella gradualmente ha ido agregándole otras comidas como pasteles y hoy quiere incursionar en la venta de comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, sánduches, chuzos y arepas asadas, por lo cual solicita su credikiva, que es su sexto crédito, para comprar un carro de perros y materias primas para su nuevos productos como embutidos, salsas, harina y hasta refrescos. 

Ilsy distribuye bien su tiempo para el desarrollo de cada actividad, así  todos los días, se dedica a la fritangueria de arepas, empanadas caribañolas como una opción de desayuno, los pasteles los elabora los fines de semanas para que las familias descansen y no cocinen y muy pronto diversificará su oferta,   adicionándole  comidas rápidas, que tienen su mayor repunte de ventas   en las noches de los fines de semanas desde los viernes a domingos y los días feriados. Desde que Ilsy T.  inició como cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha mejorado sus ingresos, su negocio ha crecido lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos de 7 y 12 años  estudien con un mejor nivel de calidad. Por eso sus sueños están enfocados en el crecimiento aun mas de él,   especialmente tener un local con las condiciones de infraestructura que amerita para el desarrollo de su actividad productiva de alimentos, porque respecto a su ubicación es muy propicia, pues vive en el barrio las Nieves, comunidad que tradicionalmente  conserva el perfil de alegría de la gente Barranquillera y esto hace que su clientela se potencialice mediante fiestas y eventos recreativos que fortalecen su negocio.
texts.en:
For Ilsy T. the sale of food, cakes and fried dishes is her work and she has been happily doing it for 10 years because it gives her a lot of satisfaction. She started selling fried foods during a period when her husband lost his job and she needed to cover the household expenses. Ilsy has seen her micro-business grow little by little. She has gradually added other food items such as cakes and now she wants to include fast food items such as hot dogs, sandwiches, chuzos (meat on a stick), grilled arepas (a type of flatbread). The reason for her kiva loan request, her sixth loan, is the desire to purchase a hot dog cart and supplies for her new products such as sausages, sauces, flour and also soft drinks. Ilsy allocates her time well to each activity. Every day she fries the arepas, empanadas and caribañolas (yucca stuffed with meat) which are her breakfast options. She makes the cakes on the weekends allowing the families to rest and not cook and soon she will diversify her offerings by adding fast foods which have a higher sales level on the weekend evenings from Friday to Sunday and on holidays. Since Ilsy T. started as a client of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she has improved her income, her business has grown which has allowed her to improve the quality of education of her two children, 7 and 12 years of age. Her goals are focused on further growing her business, especially having a space with a structure that befits her activity of making food. She is very fortunate in terms of her location as she lives in the Las Nieves neighborhood, a community that maintains the happy profile of the people of Barranquillera which attracts customers during festivities and recreational events and strengthens her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hot dog cart and raw materials for her new products such as sausages,sauces, flour and refreshments.

loans.name: Elizabeth Aba Yaabu

texts.en: Elizabeth Aba Yaabu Q. is married and has two children. She has no educational background. Elizabeth sells jewelry and panties at Elmina. She is able to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase additional goods to meet the demand of her customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase additional goods to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Mr. Ronald P. is from the Barangay of P4 Digson, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old, single and has no dependents. To make a living, he is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. He’s been engaged in this kind of business for twenty years already. He is earning an approximate amount of $70 a month from this business activity. 

Just this year, Ronald joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronald, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP as his 1st loan,  which will be used to add to his capital for his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for his existing Sari-sari Store business

location.town: Tangub-P4 Digson, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, M

loans.name: Regencia's Group

texts.en:
Teola R. lives in the village of Villaramos. She is 44 years old and leads a five-person loan group that gets funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teola is married and has three school-aged children. She makes a living by making and selling food, especially snacks and other delicacies that are popular in her area. She has been in this business for more than 11 years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Teola joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them to buy ingredients to make the items she sells. She and her loan group are applying for a new loan, for 10,000 PHP, to buy more ingredients.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make food to sell to her cusotmers

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria M. is 46 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures:  general store/eatery, pig fattening, and ready to wear clothes. She lives in Mabinuligon Village, Brgy. San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store/eatery, pig fattening, and ready to wear clothes businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP25,000. Candelaria is now borrowing PHP16,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP26,500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Candelaria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia M. is from the village of Tonggo,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Delia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Treas

texts.en: Mr. K. is 40 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where he earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house. He is married with three children, and all of them are single. His wife helps him in the business. Presently, Mr. K.’s business is going well and he wants to add more funds to purchase some feed and small ducks to raise. That is why Mr. K. has applied for a $1,200 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL.

loans.use: To purchase some feed and small ducks to raise

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 40 year-old ambitious man, married with four children living in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

His family's desire is to own a permanent house and also to educate his children up to university. He is a farmer and has owned a pharmacy shop for over ten years. This has helped him provide basics to the family and move closer to his dream of becoming a commercial farmer.

Godfrey intends to use the loan to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: To plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita J. lives in the village of San Antonio. She is 42 years old, married, has three grown children and runs a retail store where she sells fresh fish to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than eight years and earns about 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid six previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 7,000 PHP, to buy fresh fish to sell. She plans to use the additional income she earns from this loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the village of Bato, Plaridel. She is 53 years old. Erlinda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Kulafai Rashedeen Primary School, Mafuki village, 3 miles to Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1982 by the Kulafai Rashedeen Mission. The school is currently staffed with 37 teachers and has an enrollment of 550 pupils. This is the first loan that teachers of this institution have benefited from Kiva lenders. 

Edward F. is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. Edward is approximately forty year old and was born in Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. He has been in the teaching profession for fourteen years now. Edward is married and has four children. He has requested for a loan of SLL 800,000.00 in order to invest in business. Edward will buy locally produce goods like palm-oil and rice at large quantity for sale. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: Buys locally produce goods like palm-oil and rice at large quantity for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds to prepare snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing drywall work. He has been involved in this profession for the past 10 years. He started working independently in his field back in 2007.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase scaffolding and new tools needed for his work. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening a construction office and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new tools.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 38-year-old man, married and father of three, working in construction. He lives in Beirut and has six years of experience. He makes aluminum frames (for windows and doors) and kitchen cabinets. He is committed to his business and considered an expert in his field. His clients can be anyone in need of such a service. He reports that he has not faced any obstacles because his experience and hard work helped him a lot.

He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools such as a special gun to open holes as well as to fix the bathroom in his own house. In the future, he hopes to open a new branch of his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools and fix the bathroom in his own house.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has been living there in the area of Mangal Mandi with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 18 years. She is a seamstress by profession and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is a very talented woman and sews very good quality clothes. She has a good number of clients in her area who give her regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband whose name is R. A.. He runs a grocery store in the community. Through his store, he sells daily-used items such as sugar, spices, cooking oil, etc to the community and generates income for the family. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store to fulfill the customer needs on time and increase his monthly profits. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident about the progress of her husband’s business as a result of the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Koemly

texts.en:
Mr. Koemly C., 41 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Pot You, 40 years old, live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and two daughters. One works along with his father and the others are still young. 

Koemly is a construction worker. His wife stays at home and does housework. Koemly's son wants to launch a new business fixing flat tires and motorbikes and cleaning cars. Koemly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help with his son’s business by purchasing an air compressor and car washing materials.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and car washing materials for his son's business.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is 35 years old, married and has four children who range in age from two to 16 years old. Her husband makes a living as a driver while Nasira helps support the family by selling food items such as cassava flour, tomatoes and berries. She enjoys her work because it has allowed her to develop her abilities. She plans to use the additional profits earned from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Farijika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katungu est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Farijika »,  âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un hôtelier. La cliente est vendeuse poissons frais au marché communal de Katindo-Alanine.  Il ya 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 15 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  20$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  4 paniers de poissons frais et le reste sera affecté aux mini projets de ménage.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison pour la location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Farijika» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client Katungu is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the business group Farijika. She is 42, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is a hotel operator.

Katungu sells fresh fish at the communal market in Katindo-Alanine. She has been in this business for twelve years.  She has just finished her 15th loan cycle with Hekima. Her business began with $20 received from her husband. 

The new loan should help her stock up with four baskets of fresh fish, and the rest will go to the family's small projects. 

Furthermore, she hopes to build her business, school her children, and build a house to rent out. 

The client thanks Hekima for its work to help the poor who are normally excluded from a classic bank. It should be said that the business group Farijika consists primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy four baskets.

loans.name: Blanca's Group

texts.en:
Blanca is the president of a solidarity group consisting of three women from Cayambe, Ecuador.  Miryan and Rosa are the other two members of the group. 

Blanca is 29 years old and is a single mother of two children ages eight and two.  She is a responsable person who is very attached to her family and business.  Three and a half years ago she bought a small store.  To support her small enterprise she took out her first loan with FODEMI.  Thanks to the help of that first loan, her business grew and she is satisfied with the help she has gotten. 

She formed a solidarity group and is now soliciting her second loan.  This loan will be used to purchase displays, showcases, and more merchandise for her store.  Blanca wants her family to not lack anything and wants her children to get an education.  She also dreams that her business will grow so that she can keep supporting her family and establish another store.

loans.use: to purchase displays, showcases, and more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Las Divinas De Ojo De Agua Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "LAS DIVINAS DE OJO DE AGUA", PORQUE SON UNAS MUJERES DIVINAS Y ESTAN EN LA COMUNIDAD DE OJO DE AGUA EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR NUEVE INTEGRANTES, LA SEÑORA MARGARITA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL TERCER AÑO DE PRIMARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS UNO DE 14 Y OTRO DE 16 AÑOS DE EDAD. LA SEÑORA QUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR SABANAS, COLCHAS, COBERTORES, COBIJAS Y COLCHAS. HACE TRES AÑOS INICIO UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EL CUAL CONSISTE EN SALIR A VENDER SU MERCANCIA (SABANAS, COBIJAS COLCHAS, COBERTORES, EDREDONES ETC). ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO YA QUE DEBIDO A LA TEMPORADA DE LLUVIAS INCREMENTARAN SUS VENTAS Y ES LA TEMPORADA EN LA QUE SU NEGOCIO LE DEJA MUY BUENAS GANANCIAS CON LAS CUALES QUIERE EMPESAR A CONSTRUIR UN LOCAL PARA FIJAR SU NEGOCIO, PARTE DE LAS GANANCIAS LAS UTILIZARA PARA LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS Y PUEDAN TENER UN MEJOR FUTURO.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS DIVINAS DE OJO DE AGUA" ("The Divine Women of Ojo de Agua"), because they are a few divine women and they live in the community of Ojo de Agua in the State of Mexico.  The group is made up of nine members.  Señora Margarita is the president of the group.  She is 42 years old, and has studied up to the third year of primary education.  She has two children, one aged 14 and another aged 16.

The Señora wants the loan in order to buy sheets, bedspreads, covers, blankets and bedspreads.  She started a small business three years ago, which consists of going out and selling her merchandise (sheets, blankets, bedspreads, covers, quilts, etc.)  She is looking for the loan to invest in her business, the sales of which increase due to the rainy season.  This is the season in which her business earns very good profits, with which she wants to start construction on a place to use as a setting for her business.  She will use part of the earnings for the education of her children, so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, covers,blankets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Alik's Group

texts.en:
Alik is a member of this group. He is 43 and married to a supervisor in the factory of Kadamjai. Together they bring up two sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at university and the sons are in school. Alik works as a teacher at school. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs he rents a shop and sells foodstuffs. He is also engaged in cattle breeding. With this loan, Alik wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future he wants to see his children get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos a la señora Rosa Maria y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 33 años edad, tengo dos hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mi actividad económica que es la venta de comida”. 

Rosa María es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. Hace 6 meses atrás abrió un pequeño restaurante de venta de comida donde sirve desayuno, almuerzo, cena y comidas especiales o extras. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar una congeladora. Su sueño de Rosa María es convertirse en una empresaria y quiere abrir un restaurante turístico.
texts.en:
In the lower town center of Kiteni, district of Quillabamba, province of La Convencion, in Cusco, we meet Mrs. Rosa Maria and she tells us:

"I was born in the city of Quillabamba. I am 33, I have two children, and I now live in the city of Kiteni where I have my business selling food".

Rosa Maria is a hard-working and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead. Six months ago she opened a small restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, dinner and extra or special meals. She belongs to the Asociacion Arariwa's "Choclo de Oro de Kiteni" communal bank. She currently needs a loan to purchase a freezer. Her dream is to become a businesswoman, and she wants to open a tourist restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Mercedes Rosa

texts.es:
Mercedes de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona es agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Mercedes se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, actividad que viene realizando desde hace varios años en su domicilio, donde también lo vende,  tiene su propia clientela, últimamente su negocio se a incrementado en la zona donde vive, lo que le permite tener mayores ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.  

Para seguir elaborando su pan como hasta el momento a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios para seguir preparando pan, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir su crédito y brindar un poco más de comodidades para su familia.  Mercedes a sabido sacar adelante a su familia con mucho trabajo y dedicación, con la finalidad de alcanzar sus ideales propuestos.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 35, lives with her family in her own house which does not have basic utilities and is located in Mochumí District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This is a farming, livestock raising and crafts making zone.

Mercedes bakes bread to sell, an activity she’s been doing at home, which is also where she sells it, for many years.  She has her own clientele.  Her business where she lives has grown lately which means higher income to meet household daily expenses.

To continue baking bread like’s she’s been doing to date, she thought it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy ingredients and utensils to continue making bread.  With income she earns she will be able to repay the loan and provide her family with a bit more comfort.  Mercedes has learned how to move her family ahead through much work and dedication with the aim in mind of reaching the goals she’s set for herself.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensiles to continue baking the bread she sells.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, es madre soltera, vive con cuatro nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, cosméticos y lociones, este negocio tiene 30 años de existir, lo fundo por iniciativa propia, lo atiende de 5:00am a 2:00pm, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella comprara maíz, leña y gas, para elaborar tortillas, esto le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio con el que espera continuar recibiendo ingresos y prestando un buen servicio a los clientes.
Esta inversión es con el propósito de mejorar, ayudando a sus nietos en sus estudios y proveyendo la alimentación necesaria para ellos.
texts.en:
Catalina is a single mother and lives with her 4 grandchildren. She sells tortillas, cosmetics, and lotions. Her business has existed for 30 years. She founded it on her own initiative, and she attends to it from 5:00 am until 2:00 pm. Her customers are neighbors and close friends.

Catalina will buy corn, firewood and gas to make tortillas, enabling her to strengthen her business. She hopes to continue receiving income while offering good service to her customers. With this investment she intends to bring improvement, helping her grandchildren in their studies and providing the food they need.

loans.use: buy corn, firewood, and gas to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma de 30 años de edad, casado con Antonio de 34 años con quien tiene 2 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada  en el distrito de Pichari. Norma desde ya un par de años viene  dedicándose  a la venta de golosinas en el cafetín del centro educativo la victoria del distrito de Pichari. en un comienzo no sabia nada, pero gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres supo sacar ese don que tenia dentro de ella, es por ello que sus clientes se siente satisfechos, pero no todo fue alegría en su vida, ya que tuvo momentos en que no tenia clientes, cuando incursionó en abrir su primer centro de trabajo, su primera herramienta un triciclo donde trasladaba sus golosinas y los expendía, ella sabe que a los inicios fue tan duro pero ese esfuerzo que hizo valió la pena, gracias ala perseverancia que tuvo, ahora norma esta feliz con este negocio que tiene, a la ves agradece a MFP. Por darles el crédito que gracias a ello supo incrementar su capital de negocio, ahora lo único que ella realiza es ofrecer buenos productos y aun precio cómodo y lo que mas interesa es ese trato especial que norma ofrece a todos sus clientes.Este es su primer crédito con MFP,  por lo que ella se compromete a ser efectivo  el pago de sus cuotas.Ella esta feliz  y agradecida a los de su banco comunal por que la recibieron con los brazos abiertos.Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos para su cafetín.
texts.en: Norma is 30 years old and married to Antonio, 34, with whom she has two children. They live together in a home they own in the district of Pichari, Peru. For the past couple years Norma has made a living selling snacks at a cafe in La Victoria education center in Pichari. At first she didn't know anything, but thanks to the lessons of her parents she knew how to find the gift she had inside herself. It's for this reason her customers feel satisfied. However, her life wasn't always filled with joy because there were times when she didn't have customers. When she started working, her primary tool was a tricycle she used to transport and sell her snacks. Norma knows that her humble beginnings were rather difficult, but she worked hard to make it worth the trouble. Thanks to her perseverance, now she is happy with the business she has, and is grateful to Kiva partner MFP at the same time for giving her this loan to help her increase her capital. Now all she does is provide good products at reasonable prices, and what matters most is the special treatment she offers to all of her customers. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. Norma feels happy and grateful to her community bank for welcoming her with open arms. With the 1,000 soles, she plans to invest in the purchase of new products for her cafe.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new products for her cafe.

loans.name: Filadelfia Enma

texts.es:
Filadelfia Enma es soltera vive con los hijos de trece, dieciséis y seis años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Filadelfia tiene una mini tienda se dedica a la venta de productos como los víveres, harinas, bebidas gaseosas, productos para consumo humano. Los productos los compra en Ventanas.

El crédito lo solicita para poder ampliar el negocio para adquirir más productos como víveres, productos de limpieza, productos de aseo personal y poder venderlos, el crédito le ayudará muchísimo para obtener  mejores utilidades.

 El sueño es poder tener una tienda que sea más amplia y los productos que sean surtidos.
texts.en:
Filadelfia Enma is single living with her children who are 13, 16 and 6 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank located in Ciudadela 10 de Noviembre belonging to Ventanas Canton.  She’s a merchant.

Filadelfia has a mini mart where she sells foodstuffs, flour, soft-drinks and human consumption products.  She buys her products in Ventanas.

She is asking for the loan to expand the business acquiring more products like foodstuffs, cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items to sell.  The loan will help her very much to earn higher profits.

Her dream is to have a larger store and that her products are more varied.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Abou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abou est un jeune mécanicien de 33 ans qui évolue dans ce secteur d’activité depuis plus de 20 ans.  C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour et par passion depuis son tendre enfance, ce qui lui a valu même d’abandonner ses études pour s ‘adonner à la mécanique. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2004. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un moteur  destiné  a réfectionner  son véhicule qui est tombé en panne.
texts.en: Mr Abou, aged 33, is a young mechanic who has been working in this activity for over 20 years. He chose it because of the passion and love that he has felt for it since his early childhood. He even dropped out of school to become a mechanic. Abou has been a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since July 2004. He applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy an engine for a car that broke down.

loans.use: to buy an engine for a car that broke down.

loans.name: Noor Elahi's Group

texts.en:
Noor elahi is the mother of 7 children, 2 of them are daughter and 5 sons. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate all of her children so only 3 of them are studying. 

Her three sons work as salesmen while her elder daughter sews clothes. 

Noor also works, making Paranday (an ornament used to tie-back hairs) and elastics. These are high demand products and she receives good amount of profits from her business every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who prepares bakery items and supplies different bakeries. With the loan, he will buy flour, oil etc to prepare larger quantity of bakery items to be able to increase his sales and profits. 

Noor is very confident about her husband’s business and very much sure that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady hold a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Noor Elahi”

loans.use: To buy required items for preparing bakery items for sale

loans.name: Luis Gilberto

texts.es:
Luis de 27 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”. Su negocio es de brindar servicios de moto taxi, la cual escogió esta actividad porque el empleo  anterior le dio una liquidación y con ese dinero se compro una moticleta.

Su horario es lunes a domingo, desde las 6:00am hasta las 20:00pm. Su dificultad es la competencia, ya que en su sector es bien transitado por motocicleta. No está casada y no tiene hijo.

El solicita el préstamo para repuesto de la moto, ya que está un poco deteriorada. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir su vivienda ya que vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and he lives in the suburban region named "Duran". His business is providing taxi services with his motorcycle transport. He chose this activity because his previous employment gave him a severance pay and with this money he purchased a motorcycle.

His schedule is from Monday to Sunday from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. The difficulty which he faces is the competition. His sector is highly transited by motorcycles. He is not married and he does not have children.

He requests a loan to purchase a spare part for his motorcycle. It is somewhat deteriorated. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and to build a house. He currently lives with his parents.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance repairs to his motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 7 years old, and 2 are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper. Rehema has operated a general store for the past 8 years and her primary customers are local residents. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality, and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rehema will use the Kes 80,000 loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, bars of soap and matchboxes to sell. Rehema aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because the organization empowers small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, salt, bars of soap and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Uganda. He is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 12 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his welding business, which makes window and door frames among other products. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more supplies for welding, and it will help Charles to generate greater profits and build more rental houses. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business like a restaurant. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for welding.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married with two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

Vilma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 41 años de edad casado con María de 34 años de edad, fruto de este amor tiene 5 hijos. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Manuel es un hombre que no se da  por vencido fácilmente, al contrario es cauto, primero los analiza luego le busca la solución exacta. Desde entonces cuando inicio su trabajo como agricultor, se dedico al cultivo de café, actualmente tiene extensiones de terreno y con las ganancias ayuda a sus 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad de huamanga, enviándoles dinero constantemente para sus gastos de alimentación y estudio.
Manuel está feliz por todo los logros que viene obteniendo pero él sabe que la fuerza ya se le va decayendo por la edad es por esta razón que ahora piensa en abrir una tienda de agroquímicos. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles comprará una fumigadora y algunos insecticidas para eliminar la plaga de insectos que aquejan su cultivo de café
texts.en:
Manuel, age 41, is married to 34 year old María.  Their love has produced five children.  They live in their own house in the Monterrico community in the district of Sivia.  Manuel is a man who does not give up easily.  To the contrary, he is prudent.  First he analyzes, and then he looks for the exact solution.

Ever since he started his work as a farmer he has been growing coffee.  He currently has tracts of land.  With the income he helps his two children attend the University of Huamanga.  He continually sends them money for their food and educational expenses.

Manuel is happy about all of the profits he is getting.  However, he knows his strength is diminishing with age.  That is why he now plans to open an agrochemical store.

This will be his third loan with MFP.  He pledges to make his payments punctually.  He will use the 1,000 soles to buy a fumigator and some insecticides to eliminate the pest infestation that afflict his coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy a fumigator and insecticides.

loans.name: Macelina

texts.en: Macelina is a 25-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling fish in Yei, South Sudan, for one year. Macelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is married and has 2 children. He is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Michael is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years, and every month he earns PHP2,500 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to repair the existing vehicle for better service.

Michael has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Michael hopes to help his children finish their studies, and to gain double income out from his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 61 years old, married to Margaret and they are blessed with four children.  He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,600 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  James will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: La Patience Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PATIENCE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pélagie Yawa est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pélagie Yawa est âgée de 24 ans et vit au Bénin. Pélagie Yawa a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pélagie Yawa est mariée à un certain Martial. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pélagie Yawa vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pélagie Yawa vend depuis deux ans, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans son quartier. Pélagie Yawa s'approvisionne dans un quartier du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Pélagie Yawa sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA PATIENCE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group La Patience is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s third time seeking financial support from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Pélagie Yawa, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Pélagie Yawa is 24 years old and lives in Benin. She attended primary school. She is married to a man named Martial, and the couple have three dependent children, all in school. Pélagie Yawa lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

To help support the family, Pélagie Yawa has been selling mobile phone recharge cards around her neighborhood for the past two years. She buys her stock in Benin. Eager to achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase her revenue and profits, Pélagie Yawa is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other members of La PATIENCE. The first two loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Rocio Angelica

texts.es:
Rocio es una joven de 18 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Rocio trabaja desde pequeña, debido a que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos y debido a ello solo logro estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria; pero a pesar de ello Rocio se esfuerza cada día por salir adelante.

Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Rocio logro iniciar su negocio de venta de desayunos, ella empieza su trabajo desde las 4 de la mañana ya que a esa hora hay muchas personas que se encuentran esperando los buses para ir a trabajar a los fundos y mayormente no desayunan por ello Rocio les ofrece sus ricos platillos y tal es así que diariamente puede atender hasta 25  clientes en el día; ella cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Rocio está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para poder conservar mejor los insumos que utiliza como verduras y carne y de esta manera no comprarlas de manera diaria; así ella mejorara la atención a los clientes, incrementara sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Rocio is a young woman of 18.  She lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm, comfortable climate.  It is also a farming city specializing in cotton, grapes, asparagus, and other crops.  Rocio has worked since she was a little girl, as her parents did not have a lot of money and she had to help them.  Because of that, she was only able to attend school until the fifth grade, but despite that Rocio works every day to get ahead.

After a lot of hard work and saving, Rocio was able to start her business selling breakfasts.  She starts her work at four in the morning, as at that time there are a lot of people waiting to take the bus to work on farms and most of them have not had breakfast.  That is why Rocio offers them her delicious dishes and she can serve up to 25 customers per day.  She believes that she is getting ahead with her business because she is very nice to her customers and above all because everything is very well seasoned.

Rocio is very thankful to Kiva's lenders as it is thanks to the help they have offered her that she will be able to buy a freezer to preserve her ingredients better, such as vegetables and meat, so she will not have to buy them every day.  This will improve the service she provides to her customers and increase her income and she will keep working to be able to make her greatest dream a reality: owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is the head of Think Liberia located at the ELWA Community. She hopes selling SE4ALL products
like the CH-2300 clean cookstoves and solar home system like Scandle solar lantern, solar powered radio,
and phone charger will be very profitable and add to the success of the group.														
The Kiva loan allows her to obtain this SE4ALL product to sell and make a profit, allowing her to easily repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Mamou's Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  KANTIGUIYA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
