Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec AWA YIRIBA, 1ère personne  assise de la  gauche vers   la  droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de DIALAKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto considera muy necesario solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá sembrar maíz en dos manzanas de tierra, espera preparar el terreno en un corto tiempo para seguir trabajando y tener una fuente de ingresos estable.
Con la utilización del crédito anterior Roberto ha tenido mejores cosechas y sus ingresos han aumentado, lo cual es muy oportuno, ya que en tiene un hijo recién nacido y debe cuidar que su familia siga teniendo un mejor estilo de vida.

loans.use: comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá sembrar maíz en dos manzanas de tierra

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to buy bananas, pawpaw, avocados and pineapples.

loans.name: Dunia Aracely

texts.en:
I have a small food stand in my neighborhood. My sales are consistent. Currently I don't have enough products to offer my clients, so I need capital to supply my business and increase my sales so I can help my family with expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo una pequeña pulperia en mi colonia, mis ventas son regulares ya que no tengo tanto producto que ofrecer a mis clientes, por lo que necesito capital para surtir mi negocio e incrementar mis ventas, asi como ayudar a mi familia en sus gastos.

loans.use: Buy drinks, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, churros, candy, etc.

loans.name: Tuanai

texts.en: Tuanai is a very active young lady.  She is committed to the SPBD program and says that she doesn’t think she’ll ever leave the program.  She has taken out four loans from SPBD and has an outstanding repayment record.  With her first loan, she started her business of designing and hand-printing fabrics.  She sold the hand-printed fabrics to her fellow villagers.  With her second and third loan, she expanded the business further.  Lastly, with her fourth loan, she set up a flea market business.  At her stall, she sells her own hand-printed fabrics as well as other villagers’ handicrafts and retail items such as shoes.  Her recent loan request will go towards purchasing more merchandise for her stall as well as making some basic repairs to the house where she lives with her extended family.  Like many Samoans, Tuanai is very close to her extended family. The profits from her hard work are the most consistent source of financial support for her family unit of twenty-two people.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her flea market stall and make home repairs

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.en:
Abdoulaye M. is a dynamic and ambitious 34-year-old man. He is married and is the father of a 3-year-old daughter. Abdoulaye lives with his family in Port-Bouët, a popular district in the southern region of Abidjan.

He has been in the fashion clothes selling business since 1997 (10 years experience) and he performs very well. He heard about AE&I early in 2004 from his sister. He then joined the AE&I microcredit program. He wants now to expand and diversify his business.

loans.use: Abdoulaye Mahamane will use the loan to purchase fashion clothes

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
NawA., 39 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children. She lives in the city of Aley, in the mountains. NawA. specializes in handicraft and "crochet" work. She learned these skills from her mother and other family relatives. NawA.'s living conditions are not very good. Her husband is a daily worker and is not able to find a stable job. For a long time, NawA. has been the main family's bread-winner. She needs a $300 loan to purchase basic materiA. for her handicraft and crochet work.

NawA. is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually comprised of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rurA. areas. The group lending theory is based on the idea that group solidarity helps to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages collaboration in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool toward economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Purchase of material for her handicraft and "crochet" work

loans.name: Trinity Women's Lending Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a very friendly and hardworking businessperson. She is the chairperson of Trinity Women's Lending Group. In the photo, she is the one sitting in the front row on the right. The lending group meets once a week in one of the classrooms at the Mperewe High School, a private school. The members meet to discuss topics concerning their loans and businesses. This is also a time to do a lot of social networking. Since all are business owners, they tend to be very involved in their village and are often on other committees that support the well-being of their communities.

The village of Mperewe is located on a very busy road on the outskirts of Kampala. Although the road bisects the town, it is very good for roadside businesses. The roadsides are alive with people selling hot food from small charcoal cookers, beverages from small huts, and bananas that they carry in baskets on their heads, while boda boda (motorbikes) drivers offer rides as people exit matatoos (passenger vans). Everywhere there are people walking, visiting, trading, etc. It is a very vibrant place to be.

Sarah owns the Benoneto Shoe Wholesale, a wholesale shoe business. With the holiday season approaching, she is interested in increasing her inventory of shoes. This is one of the busiest times for her business.

loans.use: Sarah plans to use her loan to buy more shoes for her shoe business. The holidays are approaching, and this is her busiest season.

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Mrs. Va K. S., age 68, is a widow who works with her one daughter on a plot of land growing crops and raising pigs, Together they earn around $7 each day. Va would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase seeds and pigs to expand her livestock and generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pigs to expand her livestock and generate additional income

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah, 41, and her husband, B., are rice farmers. They sell the rice to the market. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of USD75 to expand the business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani T. is married with four children. She is 36-years-old and comes from the Mushin Area of Lagos State.  Mrs.T. has been in business since 2003 selling soft drinks. Her loan request of $450 will be used to purchase additional inventory.

loans.use: To purchase additional soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.en: Julia Margarita is thirty-seven years old and mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is mechanic. To supplement her family’s income, Julia sells clothing to men, women and children of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She runs her business generally from her house, but on weekends she sells the clothing in La Pulga, one of the most famous informal markets of Santo Domingo, the capital. Julia will use her loan to buy recommended clothing to add to her stock. She expects to become one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her community.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk to replenish a small store.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is a trader who deals in the sale of second hand clothing. He travels to Accra to buy the goods for sale. He is not yet married. He is focused on developing himself and expanding his business.

He is requesting $1025 as additional capital to enable him to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to enable him to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Mr. Chi J. is a 26-year-old fisherman who supplements his income by driving a motorbike taxi. He earns an average of about $5 per day. J. lives with his 25-year-old wife, Yem Sangom, and his four children in the Veal Village, Siem Reap Province. J. works hard to support his family’s living expenses. He is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fishing tools, which will help him expand his fishing catch and improve his income.

loans.use: To enlarge his fishing business by purchasing more fishing tools

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina A. sells cosmetics and women's underwear. She is married but her husband's income from his job at the hospital is not sufficient to support Paulina and her child. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cosmetics and underwear.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou D. is a 42-year old widow with five children in her care. She is requesting a loan to buy fabrics that she can use to craft and sell clothing. This loan will also allow her to buy and sell baobab fruit. This is her first loan, which she will repay all at once in full at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Bintou D., 42 ans est veuve et a à sa charge de 05 enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des tissus, en confectionne des habits qu’elle va revendre. Ce prêt lui permettra en même temps d’acheter et de revendre du pain de singe. voici son premier prêt qu’elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Making and selling clothing.  Buying and selling baobab fruit.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Born in the 1970s in Cotonou in southern Benin, Ms. Elisabeth A. is married and has five children, of which two are still in school and under her care. For more than a decade, she has lived in Agblangandan, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, where she sells saltwater fish and freshwater fish in her shopfront. The size of her client base has become so large that it is almost impossible for her to keep up with the ever-growing demand, due to a lack of financial means. In order to do so, she took out her first loan in 2007 for 50,000 francs, which allowed her to stock up sufficiently. The experience was very profitable for her because her capital was increased. With the goal of reinvesting even more into her business, and satisfying customer demand, she is requesting her second loan for the sum of 200,000 francs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1970 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN, dame A. Elisabeth est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont les 02 derniers scolarisés sont à sa charge. Elle s'est installée depuis plus d'une décennie à AGBLANGANDAN un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou où elle se livre à la vente de poisson de mer et aussi de lac à sa devanture. L'affluence des clients est devenue si importante qu'il lui était devenu quasi impossible de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante des clients faute de moyens financiers. Pour ce faire, elle a contracté en 2007 un premier prêt de 50 000 francs qui lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante. L’expérience a été très profitable pour elle car son capital s’est accru. Dans le but de renforcer davantage cette activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle vient solliciter pour son deuxième prêt la somme de 200 000 francs.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cartons of frozen fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour and other raw materials for his pastry shop

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en: Taulau T., 34, is married with seven children. She has many years of experience making pancakes. She sells to the general public & other villagers five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Taulau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Taulau aims to start her own business to help her husband support their family

loans.use: Purchase sack of sugar, flour, cooking oil, yeast and frying pan

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells clothing materials (sarong) that can be used to make various designs like the dress she is wearing in this picture. Toyin buys the clothing materials from Lagos Island and brings it to Egbeda in Lagos to sell. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She needs the loan to buy more clothing materials in bulk at a reduced cost. She wants to meet the demands of her customers as the festive season is approaching. Toyin is 45 years old and is married with three children. When her children are on holidays they assist her in selling clothing materials. Toyin says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders for their financial support and LAPO MICROFINANCE for their business training.

loans.use: To Purchase more clothing materials (sarong) to sell

loans.name: Gwokyalya Erena’Sgroup

texts.en:
Erena is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is 43 and married with 6 children, aged between 10 and 21 years. All her children go to school. Erena takes care of her old parents. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day and rarely take tea.

Erena works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from work. She sells to an average of 20 customers day, and besides selling beer, she sells to all categories of people. Erena has been in this business for five years working six days a week. She is faced with a challenge of seasonality and medication. She has been with MCDT for four years working all this time with the same group mates and wants to use this very loan to have a permanent place and aspires to educating her children up to university level.

loans.use: To built a permanet place for her business

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Mme Aissatou D. est une brave dame qui tient un petit commerce en face de son domicile. Avec cette activité elle soutient son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 3 enfants. Cette résidente du populaire quartier de Boucotte demande ce crédit pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs Aissatou D. is a brave woman who runs a small shop opposite her home. Thanks to this business, she helps her husband in providing for their 3 children. She lives in the popular Boucotte neighborhood and seeks this loan to increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Zubaida Ali Akbar Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a 35-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Zubaida baji is an uneducated lady and she doesn’t hesitate to mention the reason that her family didn't send her to school: they didn't know the worth of education. Her husband is also not an educated person. He has been a cloth merchant for the past 10 years. Zubaida baji is the mother of six kids: four boys and two girls. She sends all the children to school because she has a dream to give them a better living standard, and for this she sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy cloth to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Azizan baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy paint for her paint shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her husband's cloth-selling business

loans.name: Sara Dina

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen pastor.
Sara es conviviente, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 16 y 9 años ambos estudian en la escuela privada.
Estudio contabilidad técnica, esto le permitió trabajaren un estudio contable, lo dejo de trabajar por que se caso, su mama hacia dulces en su casa, a  ella siempre le gusto,  y empezó a estudiar pastelería fina, vende al por mayor y menor. Tiene una fuente de soda “la vallita” distribuye a los mercados y a dulcerías, su hija mayor  le ayuda.     
Desde que esta en Finca, ella siente un apoyo a podido comprar varias cosas entre ellos una batidora industrial, horno industrial antes preparaba sus dulces en horno de su  cocina. Aprende de las experiencias de las demás socias.  
Sara necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de miel en insumo, harina, leche, huevos.   
El sueño de Sara es tener una dulcería y partería fina, fuera de San Juan.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the community bank "Mi Buen Pastor". Sara is married common-law, 38 years old, and has two children aged 16 and 9 who both attend private school. She studied accounting which allowed her to work in an accounting office. She stopped working when she got married. Her mother made candies at home, which she always enjoyed doing, and she began studying fine baking. She sells wholesale and retail. She also has a soda fountain, "la vallita". She distributes to the marketplaces and candy shops with her eldest daughter's help. Since joining Finca, she has felt supported in being able to buy a variety of things such as an industrial mixer, and an industrial oven. Previously she had been preparing her sweets in the oven of her kitchen. She also learns from her fellow members' experience. Sara needs a 2,000 soles loan to buy honey in bulk, flour, milk and eggs. Sara dreams of owning a fine cake shop outside of San Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey in bulk, flour, milk and eggs

loans.name: Peati

texts.en: Peati (Betty) M., 28, is married with one child.  She has five years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $145.  SPBD loans are Peati’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used to buy ingredients needed for making the barbecue she sells at her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed to run the BBQ business

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Felicita del Socorro A. C. tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Felicita tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Felicita es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años de que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Felicita son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. El financiamiento solicitado por Doña Felicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de más productos para su pulpería como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y granos básicos. Sus sueños son que la economía del país mejore para que le permita su negocio salir adelante. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 14.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro A. C. is 48 years old and single. Felicita has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a grocery store, which she has worked in for over 10 years. Her goal is to get ahead with her business because it is the primary source of income for her and her family. She is seeking funding to buy more products for her store like sweets, natural beverages, bread and basic grains. Her dream is that the national economy will improve, allowing her business to advance. The amount she seeks is 14,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en:
Patricidra S. is married to Danilo Sr. Their marriage was blessed with four children: Danilo is 38 years old; the twins Rowena and Ronald are 31 years old and both are high school graduates; the youngest, Quincy, is 22 years old and a college student. They live in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela, a place that has rough road conditions and that is far from the public market.

Patricia is into direct selling business of Avon products. With her need of additional capital, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that she will use for her direct selling business. She promised herself to exert more effort in selling to have additional income for the education of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: Improve her Avon selling business

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Khy K. is 48 years old and a resident of the province of Kompong Tom. Here she helps with her family's expenses by selling fritters. She earns a profit of $1.50 per day. She is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children; four of them are employed at different jobs, and the other one attends school. The family members purposed to build a house because their house is too old but due to the family's financial problems they can't make that possible. Therefore, Mrs. K. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira T. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.

Elvira owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Agwe Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is married and has six children. Unable to meet the demands of his family, he sought assistance from GHAPE in the form of business capital when he became a member and received his first loan of 40,000FCFA ($80) in the year 2007. He invested this money in the rearing of pigs and fowl. Given the high demand for pigs and fowl in his community, there is need for expansion.

With this new loan, Jeremiah plans to buy 50 day-old chickens, feeders, animal feed, and medication, and repair his pigsty. Jeremiah has been in this business of pig- and fowl-rearing for a long time but has never had the opportunity to produce on a large scale because of limited resources. The profit he gets from this loan shall be used to increase the standard of living of his family and help pay for his children’s education.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Day-Old Chickens, Animal Feed, Vaccinations and Pig Sty Repairs

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Julia Mercedes F. se ha dedicado desde hace 22 largos años a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual le ha permitido sustentar su humilde hogar de habitación. 

Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones económicas y salir adelante por medio de la venta de la ropa, la señora Julia ha adquirido un crédito que le permita la compra de dicha ropa para ofertarla y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Mercedes F. has worked for the last 22 long years in her clothing sales business which has allowed her to sustain her humble home. With the goal of improving her economic conditions and get ahead through clothing sales, Julia has acquired a loan that will allow her to purchase this clothing to sell it and advance in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing

loans.name: Ovia's Group

texts.en:
K. Ovia, 42, is the leader of Kyegwisa Bakyara group in Ibanda. She is a married lady with five children in primary and tertiary institutions of learning and she helps pay their school fees with the help of her husband. Ovia also helps to cater for four dependents including paying their school fees.

Ovia has had a grocery and a tailoring business in Kyegwisa for thirteen years and, over the years, she is now able to make weekly profits of 26,000/=. She is able to sustain her business because of her good customer care and her well-stocked businesses. In future, she hopes to have a much bigger business as well as to educate her children further.

Ovia’s loans help in keeping up stock and having more clothing materials for her tailoring business - hence business expansion.This loan will help her with the same purpose.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store and to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2005, he decided to open a furniture shop to start a new career. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools in order to develop his work and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Mwangata borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 42 years old woman,she is married.

sara started her own shop business selling commodities like sugar,cooking oil.rice,salts 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.


With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Sara hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Bobogoib

texts.en:
Bobogoib G. is 24 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Isfara where he processes and sells dried apricots in the local market. He is experienced in marketing dried apricots; he purchases apricots from local farmers at wholesale, then processes them for sale to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He also offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means.

All this has made Bobogoib’s business quite successful and has provided a stable income for his family. He is currently requesting a loan of $600 USD to buy more supplies so as to continue to offer a good assortment of products to his customers. Bobogoib would like to express his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the northeastern boundary of Alexander the Great's empire. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet and Western cultures and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While Tajikistan is working to improve its agricultural productivity and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been, and will continue to be, distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing his range of goods for sale

loans.name: Yeoun

texts.en: Yeoun S., age 26, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Battambong Province. To make a living, she and her husband manufacture rice wine and raise pigs at home. They typically earn collectively US $6 per day. S. has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for her family and her two young children. Therefore, she is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more piglets that she can raise and then sell. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: piglet purchase.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 39 years old, married, and is blessed with six children. Her supermarket business is located in Junction in Eldoret Town. Regina was introduced to KADET by another client. With the loan she is expecting from KADET she intends to add more stock which includes sugar, bar soap, rice and oil. Her dreams are to improve the business and also improve the family’s living standards. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more goods to her store

loans.name: Urima

texts.en:
Urima P. is a 26-year-old woman living in the town of Leualesi Leauvaa. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Urima owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Urima has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 320 WST a month from these activities.

In 2006, Urima joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Urima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Urima is now requesting a new loan of 2,250 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Urima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Qoshqar

texts.en:
Qoshqar M. is a 26-year-old cattle breeder who has earned a living from raising cattle since he was teenager. He's not married yet but he is responsible for his aged parents.

It should be said that the low incomes available to people in this rural area aren't enough to maintain a family and for this reason, Qoshqar works enormously hard to provide a better standard of living for his current and future family.

Qoshqar urgently needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of 1,606 AZN. Be an important part of the growth of Qoshqar’s business as he needs to save money to get married next year.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and a cow

loans.name: Badal

texts.ru: Бадал Мунаварова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 47 лет. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Мунавара по специальности "учительница", но она более 9 лет занимается торговлей, она торгует запчастями от велосипеда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента.
texts.en:
Badal M. lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 47 years old. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Badal is a teacher by profession, but she has been in the retail business for more than nine years now. She sells spare parts for bicycles. She is asking for a loan to buy a new assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new assortment

loans.name: Dol

texts.en: Dol S. is a longtime businessman who earns a living fishing as well as by providing a taxi service. He earns an average of $4 per day. Dol S. lives with other family members in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is married with nine children: three are married and live independently and the other six are single. Three of his children are employed and provide their little income for the family’s living expenses. His wife (in the photo) sells the fish that he catches. Dol S. is taking out this loan to buy more nets and traps for fishing as well as to repair his motorbike taxi.

loans.use: To buy more nets and traps for fishing as well as to repair his motorbike taxi

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter works as a secondary school teacher, while the younger children both attend a secondary school.

Purevsuren manages a dairy retail business in a rented stall at a local market. She began her business in 2006 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). After several successful years in business, her working capital has grown to 450,000 tugrugs (~315 USD). Because of the business’s success, not only is she able to pay for her children’s tuition fees, but she is also able to greatly contribute to the family’s overall financial health.

Purevsuren would like to keep growing her business in the future and says, “I would eventually like to buy a house so that my family and I can live comfortably.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of dairy products which she can sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of dairy products

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en: Mariel C. is from the town of Tuguegarao Echague. She is 28 years old. Mariel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Mariel runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. In 2009, Mariel joined ASKI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mariel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Абдуазизов Хусан проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдуазизов Хусан имеет высшее образование по специальности "Экономист". В области торговли работает более 16 лет. Имеет торговую точку на рынке. Абдуазизов Хусан покупает и продает на рынке хлопковое масло. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Husan A. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. Husan has a higher education as an economist. He has been working in the retail sales field for over 16 years. He has a retail outlet at a market. Husan buys and sells cottonseed oil at the market. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María Lourdes,  es una mujer muy amable, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es viuda.  Tiene cuatro hijos que son todavía dependientes, ella se dedica a la costura. María Lourdes forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de telas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la adquisición de listones, telas y accesorios para mejorar su negocio. La meta de María Lourdes es tener un taller más grande donde pueda producir más.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is a very considerate woman. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is a 55 year old widow. She has four children who are still dependent upon her. She is a seamstress. María Lourdes has been a part of the Las Activas Communal Bank for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy fabric. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy ribbons, fabric, and accessories to improve her business. María Lourdes’s goal is to have a bigger shop where she could produce more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ribbons, fabric, and accessories to improve her business

loans.name: Analyn's Group

texts.en:
Analyn A. is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Analyn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Analyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Analyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Analyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Miguel Antonio Z. A. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Maria Leonarda Rodriguez con quien tiene 5 hijos,  todos estan pequeños.
su mujer le ayuda a los trabajos del hogar, cuidar sus hijos y el se dedica a trabajar en el taller de ladrillos y tejas que tiene desde hace 3 años. 
 
el transporta los materiales en un carro de su propiedad y tambien hace los trabajos de transportar su producto terminado cuando el cliente no tiene como llevarselos.
 
tiene dos empleados que le fabrican el ladrillo y la teja, el proceso es que los fabrican, los secan y luego proceden a la cocion del producto terminado en un horno de adobe en donde lo queman con leña o aserrin
 
esta solicitando el credito para compra de materia prima tierra,leña y barro.
texts.en:
Miguel is 37 years old and lives with Maria. Together they have five young children. [Maria] helps with the household chores and cares for the children, while he works in his brick and roof tile mill, which he has had for three years. He transports his materials in his car and also delivers the finished items to his customers when they don’t have their own means. He has two employees who make bricks and roofing tiles for him. First they make the items, and then they dry them, and fire the finished items in an adobe kiln, which they heat with a wood or sawdust fire. He is requesting this loan in order to buy raw materials, firewood, and clay.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Johana

texts.en: Johana is 40 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been running a cafeteria for two years and has two employees. He also grows fruits such as pineapples which he sells to earn more income to provide for his family and educate his children. He had previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business. He plans to renovate his business premises so as to attract more customers. He has requested for a loan to add more cooking ingredients.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Mien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mien P. has been recruited to be the leader of this group by the other borrowers. She is 38, married, and the mother of five children. Four of her children are students.  The other is no longer in school and is working as a porter. Mien P. currently earns her daily living by working as a carrying laborer in the local market, earning $2 each day. Her husband is also a porter in the same the market. The family’s living conditions are not comfortable because their house needs repairs.  Mien P. is seeking a loan to make some improvements to her house.

The other borrowers who have joined this loan group are: Am P., a grocery seller who is seeking a loan to run her business more smoothly; Hoat N., a fish porter who needs a loan to decorate her old house; and Ren K., who is asking for a loan to mend her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza del Socorro tiene 67 años, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con financiamientos. La actividad económica de Maritza es la venta de comida y otros. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. El negocio inicio con recursos propios, pues para ella ha sido muy difícil, pues la experiencia que ha tenido hasta los momentos con su negocio ha sido muy gratificante para mejorar su condición la de su familia. Así lograra realizar las compras de frijoles, arroz, aceite, pollo y gaseosas ya que el precio de estos productos está muy caro. Por lo que más desea es mejorar cada día en su negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Maritza del Socorro is 67 years old. This is not her first experience dealing with loans. She has been selling food and other items for more than nine years. Maritza started her business using her own resources. Even though the work can be difficult, she says her business is very rewarding because it has allowed her to improve her family’s condition.

Maritza will use her loan to buy beans, rice, oil, chicken, and sodas since the prices of these items are very inexpensive. What she wants most is to improve her business every day and keep it active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy beans, rice, oil, chicken, and sodas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower from Lebanon is a 20-year old single man. He lives with his parents and five siblings. Five of his family members are also working. He has been working as a carpenter for five years. He has been running his own carpentry shop since 2005.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to buy a car to help him with his work. He is requesting a loan of $1,000. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to more than 41,000 borrowers and disbursed more than 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy a car to help with his work

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen M. is from the village of District 4. She is 57 years old. Helen is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish balls and other dimsums to the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Helen is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita B. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Miranda, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing/fish vending.

Amelita’s 41-year-old husband, Dolphy, is a fisherman. They have three children who are between 16 and 19 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Amelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the fishing/fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Amelita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her fishing/fish vending, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 19,500, which she intends to use on her fishing/fish vending business. Amelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Kham

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 44 years old and is a resident of Battambang Province where she earns a living raising poultry in a cage next to her house. She raises ducks, chickens, other birds and pigs to produce eggs and young ones. She also sells her cattle to a buyer when they come to maturity.

S. is married with two kids who are unmarried and live at home. Her husband’s name is Horm Pov and he is skilled in carving traditional statues.

S. says that their current income is not enough to serve them and she hopes to invest in a new business. Because she doesn’t have the capital, she decided to apply for a $500 loan to be used to purchase a cart, a juice machine, and other essential equipment that she will use to squeeze sugarcane to produce juice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a cart, a juice machine, and other essential equipment

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly T. D. is 43 years old and has two children who are going to school. Her husband is a worker. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND.

Mrs Ly breeds pigs and poultry and wants to expand her livestock, so she borrowed from SEDA. She has participated in SEDA since 2007. For her last loan, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and has completely repaid this amount punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs and her poultry.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and her poultry

loans.name: Tataesusai Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tataesusai” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These are petty businesswomen who want a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their SLL 500,000 loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

Isatu C. (left) is the leader of this group. Isatu is married and has six children – three in primary school and three in secondary school. Isatu sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), peppers, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, aged 40 years, is a married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in photography and has a videography business, an activity which he has been in for eight years. He wants his children to study and to build a good family standard of living. He wants a loan to buy a black-and-white printing machine.

loans.use: Buying a black-and-white printing machine

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr:
SUZANNE D. est une femme de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP depuis 12 ans. Elle a reçu 24 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement.

Elle fait de l'élevage de porcs. Elle achète des porcs qu'elle embouche pour faire de l'abattage ou pour revendre sur pied.

Avec nouveau crédit elle va acheter 20 porcs pour continuer son activité de porcherie

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Suzanne D. is a 50-year old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ngascop for 12 years. She obtained loans 24 times in the past and always repaid them on time. She raises pigs. She buys pigs and fattens them before slaughtering or reselling them live. With this new credit she is going to purchase 20 pigs to continue with her business. Her goal is to bolster her savings and help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 20 pigs

loans.name: Yawoa

texts.fr: S. est une dame  de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de bè klouvé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu  le commerce de céréales. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des céréales. elle  a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a 34-year-old married woman. The mother of three children, she lives with her family in the Bè Klouvé neighborhood. She makes money selling cereals, and her customer base includes everyone. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy cereals. She has been in this business since 2005.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es:
Juana Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito pesquero D. San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace siete años al procesamiento y comercialización D. pescado seco – salado. Ella adquiere el pescado a los pescadores del lugar o se dirige al terminal pesquero D. la zona, luego lo procesa y lo deja secar para luego venderlo en los principales mercados D. la zona. El negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre trata D. brindar todo su esfuerzo para sacarlo adelante.

Juana Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más pescado fresco, D. ese modo pueD. procesar más y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Juana Rosa es una mujer bastante trabajora y empeñosa. Anteriormente ya ha trabajo con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is a 48 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the San José fishing district, a zone that is part of the Lambayeque province, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past seven years she’s been processing and selling dried salted fish.  She either buys the fish from the fishermen in the area or heads to the zone’s fishing terminal.  She then processes and dries it so she can sell it in the zone’s principle markets.  Her business is an important source of income for her family, for which she puts forth a lot of effort to get ahead.

Juana Rosa wants to expand her business by buying more fresh fish.  In this way she can process more and increase her profits through her sales.  Because of this, she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana Rosa is a hard working enterprising woman.  She has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has proven herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: Fish for processing and resale

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby B. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old. Ruby is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts or copra in the local community. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Vincent Elmer

texts.en:
Vincent Elmer L., age 43, provides transportation services to local and nearby community members. He has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 26,000 PHP a month. He and his wife have two school-aged children and live in the village of Goleo.
  
In 2009, Vincent joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Vincent has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. He is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Vincent from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in his transportation business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. S. sells food, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband is a cleaner, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. 

S. has to spend USD 150 on food, USD 15 on electricity and water, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more food to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more food to resell

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita J. lives in the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. For the last 23 years, she has made a living as a rice farmer, earning about 2,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a rice farm

loans.name: Yu

texts.en: Yu S., 36, is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase equipment for his dental care business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. S. is a dentist, earning an income of USD 15 per day. He is single and lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. He spends USD 35 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy equipment to improve his dental care business

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk K. lives in Gyumri City, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia that was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. People of Gyumri have been greatly affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive.

Hayk is married with two children. Before moving from the dilapidated hut that was given to his family after the earthquake as temporary housing, he had a small grocery shop. Now he and his family have moved to a new apartment built for earthquake survivors on the city's outskirts. He has also moved his grocery shop to the newly-built apartment block, which is the only one in this area.

Hayk has applied for this loan to increase the shop's inventory.

loans.use: increasing shop's inventory

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar lives in Multan which is a big city in Pakistan, known for its shrines and hot weather. She has been living there with her family in the area of Kher Abad in a 2-room brick house for over 24 years. She is a caring lady, who prefers to stay at home and carry out her duties as a housewife. She is also good at hand embroidery. She learnt this skill from her mother. She makes hand embroidery when she finds herself free from household work. She does this work part time. The money she earns helps her fulfill the basic needs of her family. 

Her husband’s name is M. R. and he is a loader by profession. He uses his horse cart for his business and loads different items such as fruits & vegetables and construction supplies on it and earns a good income by dropping the load at the destinations.  

Munawar is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver while her younger son works at a petrol pump for a low income.  Her daughters are attending school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to dispose of his  current business because it requires great physical effort and sometimes he gets work and sometimes not, so he will buy a rickshaw with the loan amount. The rickshaw will help him to serve many passengers and earn a good income for his family.  

Munawar is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband and he will successfully operate his new business.  She is new loan user of Asasah.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Munawar.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie V., 27 years old, lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 2 daughters and 2 sons. Angie owns and operates a fishing business. She operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. She works hard to provide for her family's needs. Angie is in need of  fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She has applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva's partner, CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: La Sra. Erlinda Vive en el municipio D. el Torno, localidad D. junta Pirai, es nacida en el departamento D. Oruro, su esposo es D. ocupación albañil, y dragero, es decir extrae piedras del rio, su trabajo lo desempeña en el rio espejo D. la comunidad, hace unos 10 años que radica en la zona, el destino del crédito es para compra D. material D. construcción para terminar D. construir un cuarto en su domicilio y así poder brindar mas comodidad a sus hijos; la Sra. Erlinda es muy trabajadora y se siente contenta con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en: Erlinda lives in the municipality of Torno, at the Pirai location, she was born in the department of Oruro, her husband is a construction worker and a "dragero" (a job which involves extracting sand, gravel and stones from rivers to be used in construction work) working at the river of the community.  They have lived in this zone for 10 years, the purpose of the loan is to buy construction material to finish building a room in their home and be able to proviD. more comfort to their children, Erlinda is very hardworking and feels happy with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Mujeres De Pacanac Group

texts.es: doña Juana I. Tzún, tiene 35 años D. edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos D. los cuales los tres estudian, es una persona que no tuvo ningún año D. escolaridad, tiene deseos D. superacion, se dedica a vender frutas, por esa razon reunió a caterce compañeras mas formar un grupo y solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR e invertirlo como capital D. tabajo en cada una D. las actividades que realizan cada integrante como: vender ropa, crianza D. animales, venta D. alimentos, elaboración D. canastas, elaboración D. sobrefundas y pabellones, esperan con esta inversiòn mejorar sus ingresos y su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana I. Tzún is 35 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Although she did not have the opportunity to attend school, Juana possesses the desire to succeed. She sells fruit to earn a living. For this reason, she met with fourteen other members to form a group so that they could request a loan from Asociación ASDIR. They will invest the money as operating capital in each of their businesses. These incluD. selling clothes, raising animals, selling food, making baskets, and embroidering pillowcases and banners.

The members hope this investment will improve their incomes and their living conditions.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: C6303 Dukore Group

texts.en:
Jean is 60 years old and married, with six children between 7 and 21 years old. He is the president of a group called “Dukore." Jean sells rice, sugar, beans and other goods.  Others in the group have businesses selling beans at the local market. Jean employs two people in his business and has been working for three years in this business. He is the first person on the right side, wearing blue and black.

Jean and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy more goods such as rice, sugar and beans to sell at the market. He would like to use any profits to start saving and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Ben Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles monogames, les quatre femmes du groupe Ben ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et habitent le village de Zambougou, dans la commune rurale de Sanando relevant de la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques, de tomates fraîches et de pagnes brodés. 
Dans le but d’avoir un fonds de commerce pour mieux mener leurs activités génératrices de revenus, les membres du groupe ont intégré l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles  sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou  D. est une vendeuse de pagnes brodés dans le village. Avec une très grande réputation dans son activité surtout du côté des jeunes fiancées, elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 pièces de pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou.  La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans les villages voisins à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Bintou  D. espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux petits besoins du foyer et  pour l’épargne.
texts.en:
All married in monogamous families, the four women of the group Ben have an average age of 38, 5 children and live in the village of Zambougou, in the rural commune of Sanando in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They met each other through friend and family networks.

The members of the group do small trade selling plastic utensils, fresh tomatoes and embroidered pagnes. In order to acquire the funds to better drive their income generating activities, the members of the group approached the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and took out their first collective loan. 

Madame Bintou D. sells embroidered pagnes in the village. With a very big reputation, especially among young fiancees, she intends to use the loan to buy 2 pieces of cloth at the main market of Segou. Sales are made in cash and credit, and she sells both from home and in neighbouring villages to a predominantly female clientele.

With this loan, Madame Bintou D. hopes to make a monthly profit of 15000 FCFA which she will use to pay for basic needs at home and put aside in savings.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des pagnes brodés

loans.name: Isatu I

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Isatu C.. She is married and has four children, aged 3, 6, 10 and 12 years. In 2001, Isatu established her essential drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy essential drugs for her drug store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Isatu plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders, hire a sales person, and open another drug store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy essential drugs for her drug store

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 31 years old and married with five children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store and sells items such as canned goods, detergent, soap and shampoo to people in her community. Jenefer buys and sells fresh fish as well. She also dries fish to sell. 

Jenefer is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, and fish.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, shampoo, and fish to sell

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en:
Emerance is a 37-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have five children, who are between the ages of 6 and 16 years old. Her husband is a carpenter.

Emerance owns a small shop, where she sells various everyday items such as soap and matches, as well as green bananas. Her business has enabled her to pay for her children’s school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy more green bananas. With the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans to continue to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items, including green bananas.

loans.name: Samparuan

texts.en: Samparuan is 33 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He grew up on a farm and learned how to plant and harvest by watching and working with his parents. Today, he raises different types of crops on his farm and sells them in the local market. He also supplements his income by raising cattle. He is applying for his third loan from KADET and we are happy to have another opportunity to help him operate his business. He will use the money to buy seeds and fertilizers. He also hopes to see his farming activities grow to a level that will allow him to meet all of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus padres, cuenta con sólo  servicio de luz y esta ubicada en el distrito de Túcume - Lambayeque.  Esta ciudad tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y el turismo, debido a que es zona arqueológica.

Modesto desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, él alimenta a sus animales con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que estos llegan a un crecimiento óptimo, Modesto los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene ganancias para solventar los gastos familiares.

Modesto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar animales y su respectiva comida para tenerlos bien alimentados, con la finalidad de venderlos a mejores precios y así mejorar  su calidad de vida.  Modesto es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable cuyos únicos deseos son  que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
Modesto is 36 years old and lives with his wife and children in the home of his parents. The only service he receives is electricity. He resides in the District of Túcume-Lambayeque. The main business activities in this city involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism. This area is known for its archaeological sites.

Modesto has been raising and selling cattle for a few years. He has a corral located behind his house. The diet of his animals consists of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the optimal stage of development, he offers them for sale at different markets in the area so that he can generate income to cover the family expenses.

Modesto is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more animals and the appropriate feed so that they will have a good diet. He hopes that he can sell them at a good price and improve his quality of life.

Modesto is a hardworking and responsible person. His only wishes are to grow his business with each opportunity and to help his family succeed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier-maçon. Ils ont un enfant.  
Afi a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend de pagne et fait la couture. Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine à coudre et de pagne.
texts.en:
Afi is a woman of 38. She is married to a carpenter/mason and they have one child. 
 
Afi has worked at selling goods since 1996. She sells lengths of African print cloth and does sewing. She buys her products at the Grand Market in Lomé.

Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy a sewing machine and African print cloth.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been in the quarry industry in the Ndunyu Njeru area for the last eleven years. He is 48 years old, married to Rachael, and they have eight school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 3rd loan. He paid for all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. This will diversify his sources of income, so he'll stop relying on quarry income alone. 

In future, Peter hopes to add more dairy cows to enable him to supply milk on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kimchhouen

texts.en: Kimchhouen, 32 year old, is a spa supervisor.  Her husband is a Tok Tok driver. Their income is $13 per day. She has one child and he is four years old. Every month she has to spend $75 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike to use to travel to work. She likes her job and works hard to get a bonus and a high salary.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.
