Marcelina; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de cafetín, ella es propietaria de un cafetín que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella prepara sándwich, gaseosas, cervezas y cenas, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cafetín. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, cervezas y productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santo Domingo” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 51 years old, married, and has six children. Marcelina divides her time between her daily activities and her cafeteria business. As the owner, she manages her business between the hours of 7am and 10pm. She serves sandwiches, sodas, beer, and dinner items. Through her business, she is able to help her children get ahead. Marcelina wants to expand and improve her cafeteria business, so she is requesting a loan to buy sodas, beer, and products for cooking such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

Marcelina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 60 years old and a widow with seven children.

Loreta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Loreta has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for one year and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Loreta aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a widow. She is now 58 years old with two grown-up children. She owns a vacant lot which she cultivates to earn a living. Gardening is the work she started three years ago. She grows many varieties of crops which she sells in turn to neighbors, mini-markets and nearby communities. This gives her a monthly income of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Remedios joined GDMPC to access its financial services. She has confidence from past loans taken out. Loans prior to this request have been repaid. The current loan of 3,000 PHP is intended to buy seeds and seedlings to plant. In the future, she hopes to continue this activity for long, long years and earn more income from it. Increased revenue is planned with widening of the business area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 29 años, es una persona alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja de 30 años y su querida hija Daysi de 08 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Edith junto a su pareja en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingreso, es la venta de cacao, café y plátano, poseyendo en total 03 cuadras de terreno. Los frutos son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco y en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros y de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en las extracciones de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos. Lleva 08 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que atacan los brotes de sus plantas. Es por ello, con el crédito solicitado comprará insecticidas para combatir la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es será su sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y trabaja sin causar problemas a la entidad financiera, espera contar en esta oportunidad con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando. Con los 3,000 soles comprará fertilizantes para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Edith is a native of the city of Santa Rosa. She is 29 years old and a cheerful and hardworking person. Rosa lives in her own home with her 30-year-old partner and their 8-year-old daughter named Daysi, who is the reason behind all of her efforts. The hard work put forth by Edith and her partner on their farm have resulted in crops that receive excellent care. When it comes time to sell, their products are bought up very quickly. Her main source of income comes from the sale of cacao, coffee, and bananas. In total, she has three plots of land. Edith sells her crops in the city of San Francisco. During harvest time, she hires laborers so that the work can be completed faster. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting because this is the time when she sees the fruits of her labor. Edith has been farming for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops against plagues of insects that can attack the shoots of her plants. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy insecticides to combat these plague of insects. Over time, she wants to acquire additional land so that she can plant more crops.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP. Edith has been very punctual with her previous loans and works without causing problems for her Communal Bank. At this moment, she hopes to have the support of Kiva lenders so that she can continue prospering. Her loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy fertilizers so that she can improve production.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Maricel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

Maricel is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors, windows and security grating for the windows to upgrade living conditions and security

loans.name: Mirlith

texts.es: Mirlith, de 37 años, es madre soltera, vive en una casa propia a lado de siete personas entre alguno de sus hermanos y sus hijos, ella trabaja duro todos los días para mejorar su ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mirlith consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas, pues compra a las distribuidoras en cantidades y se encarga de venderlos al menudeo pero heladas. Esto hace que sus clientes vayan a su casa muy seguido, ya que en su casa se venden las bebidas más heladas de la cuadra y teniendo en cuenta el calor que hay en la zona donde vive. Su negocio es muy bueno, lleva aproximadamente cuatro años trabajando en esto y lo hace sola. Le gusta que en su trabajo pueda cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, además que le gusta interrelacionarse con ellos. Lo que más anhela es instalar una bodega, pues no hay negocio de este rubro en la calle por donde vive. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, se encuentra muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido anteriormente y desea ahora que peudan apoyarlo para invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará bebidas al por mayor en los carros distribuidores.
texts.en:
Mirlith is 37 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own home beside 7 people, among whom are her siblings and their children. She works very hard every day to improve her income and have a better quality of life. Mirlith’s work consists of selling soft drinks which she buys in bulk from wholesalers and she then sells them on when they are freezing cold.

The heat in the area in which she lives makes her customers come to her house very often as she sells the coldest drinks on her block. Her business is very good and she has spent approximately four years working at it by herself. She likes that she can meet the demands of her customers and she also enjoys interacting with them. 

She longs to set up a store since there are no other businesses of this kind on her street. This will be her sixth loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the support that she has received previously and she now hopes that they can help her by investing in her business. With the amount requested, she will buy drinks in bulk from the wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks in bulk.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is a 37-year-old farmer from the village of Karaleti in the Kartli region of East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family, which includes his wife, Shorena, two daughters (17 and 10 years old), and his mother-in-law. Both of the children go to school. 

All of the adult family members are involved in the family's farming activities, which are the primary source of income for them. In particular, the family owns a dairy cow and sells on average 20 kilograms of cheese per month. In addition, they grow garlic, cabbage, and tomatoes on their family-owned one hectare of land. The total average income of the family is 800 laris (about 480 USD) per month. 

Kakha requested a loan to purchase seeds for garlic. He will purchase quality seeds and count on a good harvest in the summer. After selling the harvest, he will get income, which will be used for the well-being of the family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for garlic

loans.name: Mujeres Con Propositos 1 Group

texts.en:
Angela is a borrower who lives in Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic, in one of the most rural communities located on the outside of the city. She is one of the members of the group Mujeres con Propositos 1 (Women with Purpose).

Angela lives with her long term partner and two of her three children in a simple home. This community has scarce resources like bad roads and unsafe transportation, and people need to cross a big river on foot. Despite these difficulties, Angela runs a successful miscellaneous sales business. With this loan, she will be purchasing dozens of shoes, underwear for women and men, and various pieces of clothing.

This is Angela’s fourth loan with Esperanza International in almost 2 years of taking loans with us, and her profits have been saved and spent on her daughter's studies. She hopes to continue the growth of her business. Angela dreams of having a car. She could go to work easily, drive around with friends and visit different places. 

Her most difficult challenge has been to deal with the illness of her father. She enjoys eating and dancing. Thank you for lending to Angela and the Mujeres con Propositos group!

loans.use: to buy shoes, underwear and clothing.

loans.name: Amalyn

texts.en:
Amalyn is married with 1 child. Amalyn is 30 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
Amalyn sells electronic load to earn a living and had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP3000 to purchase cellular phone loads for her reloading business.
Amalyn has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Amalyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phone load for her reloading business

loans.name: Paulina Vigilia

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Ahorro es Progreso”  ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene dos hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora Paulina se dedica a la producción de chompas, chalinas, medias, etc, trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de tejidos.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de diez conos de lanas,  helios de diferentes colores, para su fabricación de prendas, en el negocio le ayuda su mamá.

La señora desea tener una maquina de tejer y tener un local propio para poder vender lanas al por mayor.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión, la puntualidad y la solidaridad
texts.en:
Paulina’s a member of the “Ahorro es Progreso” communal bank located in Puno Province and Department.  She’s 47 years old, single and has two children.  She attended secondary school.

Paulina makes sweaters, shawls, stockings, etc.  She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years.  Her first loan was in the amount of 300 new soles which she invested in her knitwear business.

She will request a new, 800 new sol, loan to buy ten cones of wool yarn and Helios thread [polyester] in various colors to make her items; her mother helps her in the business.

She would like to own a knitting machine and to have a place of her own to sell wool at wholesale.  What she likes best about her communal bank is the unity, the punctuality and the mutual support.

loans.use: to buy ten cones of yarn and thread in assorted colors.

loans.name: Simbaredenga Group

texts.en:
This is Joseph, 47, from Machipisa, Harare. He is married and has four children, three still at school. He also cares for his parents from his rural home. 

Joseph runs a services business specializing in sewing men's wear of various ranges. His business has been in operation for four years. He indicated that the main challenge he faces is that electricity is in short supply, which can sometimes reduce production. 

Joseph has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothing materials and a small generator. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to send his children to a better school. In the future, Joseph plans to have a big generator to use during power outages.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is married and has two children. He buys and sells pigs. Gilbert has been in this business for six years and is successful in it. He started the business with two pigs and gradually expanded the business. At this time, he has five heads. He wants to receive a loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs. He is thanking everyone in advance for your support and help. Thank you very much.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar, 40, makes Mongolian national musical instruments such as horse-head fiddles. A horse-head fiddle is one of the Mongolian national respectful musical instruments and there are just a few carpenters who make it correctly in Mongolia. Boldbaatar is one of them. He sells his products to the supermarkets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for 21 years and already has his own permanent customers. He lives with his wife and his two sons. His two sons also have been studying carpentry skills.
  
Boldbaatar wants to increase his working capital to purchase wooden material and some other materials needed to make more products because he is planning to sell a large numbers of horse-head fiddles to his customers. It is beneficial for his business future and its expansion. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the raw materials for carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for carpentry

loans.name: Les Anges De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES ANGES DE DIEU est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elisabeth est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Elisabeth est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Olalekan. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Elisabeth vend depuis trois des téléphones portables par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire ; Elisabeth vend des mèches et des produits de beauté. Elisabeth s’approvisionne au Togo et au Nigéria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LES ANGES DE DIEU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
LES ANGES DE DIEU Group is made up of three persons who live in the same area. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Elisabeth, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 48 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a reseller named Olalekan. She never attended school.

The couple has four school-attending children to support. Elisabeth lives together with her husband and children, and the couple covers the various household expenses together.

In order to provide for her family, Elisabeth has been selling mobile phones through the distribution system for three years. As a secondary business, she also sells hair extensions and cosmetics.

She gets her supplies in Togo and Nigeria. Eager to satisfy her customers, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Elisabeth, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, cosmetics, and hair extensions

loans.name: Manal's Group

texts.en:
Manal is a member of this group from Iraq. Manal is 35 years old widow and mother of one child, she started her sewing business six  years ago .
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provides for divorced and widow women to buy fabric and sewing machine to increase her production and income .
The story of Manal and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Manal's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy fabric and  sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Mary, who, as a group leader, is representing her group formed by 13 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is married and is a mother to four children. She is known in her community as a very hardworking individual.

Initially, Mary joined One Acre Fund in 2009 because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since she joined the program she says that her life has improved, especially because she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Mary plans to buy a cow.

Between the 13 farmers in Mary's Group, a total of 7.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Esfuerzo De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Janet es una mujer trabajadora con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y bebidas agua gaseosas. El crédito que obtuvo lo invertirá en la compra de  unas champagne y  vino al por mayor para luego expenderlos   por campaña navideña de esa manera podrá obtener buenas ganancias.  El grupo agradece a  los inversionistas  KIVA por el crédito brindado.  Janet es la primera del lado derecho viste polo verde limón.

loans.use: with the purchase of more fruits: tangerines, plantains and apples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Catherine would lke to invest in shares business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and a weighing machine

loans.name: Bunyad

texts.en:
Bunyad has run this business for 5 years.
This man is an  Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region. 
This 32-year-old man works very hard every day to increase his income.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny has been married more than 11 years and has 2 daughters. She has been running the grocery store at home since 1999. In addition, she also sells Chinese noodles at her house. Her husband, Mr. Chum Sotha, is a construction contractor and welds iron tubes in the local communities and he has been in this business for more than 3 years. Their 2 daughters are studying at pre-school in the same village. She has received loans from MAXIMA four times already. At this time, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase grocery items in order to increase her stock. She also will use some amount of the loan to buy one motorbike. As she is an existing client of MAXIMA, we see that there will be no problem for her to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items and one motorbike.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
My name is Glenda, and I'm dedicated to selling seasonings and spices. I buy these in bulk in large bags and then I divide them up into smaller bags to sell in convenience stores, markets and to neighbors. The income allows me to help with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Me llamo Glenda y me dedico a la venta de condimentos, estos los compro en bolsas grandes y luego lo divido en bolsas pequeñas para vender en pulperias, mercaditos y vecinos. Los ingresos que percibo me ayudan con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase seasonings, bags and other items.

loans.name: Kinobi

texts.en:
Kinobi is a very pleasant lady of 37 years. She is married with 2 children and she also cares for one orphan. She operates a well-stocked retail store in Kayunga. She sells beverages, sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, cosmetics, etc.

Most retail stores sell similar items, and there are two basic reasons for the lack of variety. One reason is the villagers have very little means, so they only buy basic necessities or very inexpensive luxuries, i.e. sodas and cosmetics. And the other reason is the owners of the businesses are also without means, so they cannot afford to take risks on items which may not sell. So, the safest course is to copy what other stores sell. One diversifies by having a well-stocked store and developing a loyal clientele. Your ability to befriend people in your community goes a long way towards your success.

Kinobi’s wonderful personality adds greatly to her client base. With her loan, she plans to expand her inventory of basic foodstuffs. She hopes one day to buy a plot of land and construct a commercial building so she will not have to pay rent.

loans.use: To continue buying sugar, rice, maize flour, etc. in order to keep her store well stocked.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long S., age 25, is a garment worker, making around $2 per day. Her husband is a laborer, making about $2.50 each day. Her child is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi, which will enable him to generate much more income than working as a laborer. This will help improve their family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Rohamah

texts.en: Rohamah, 47, sells snacks, candies, rice, etc. at her small shop, earning USD15 a day to provide for her family's needs.  Her husband, T., does not work anymore. She is asking for a loan of USD150 to fill her shop with more inventory and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a mother of three. She is 43-years-old and hails from Mushin, Lagos State, Nigeria.  Since 1990 she has been in the business of reselling plastic containers. Mrs. A.'s loan request of $450 will enable her buy more plastic containers  for resale.

loans.use: To purchase plastic containers for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 25 year-old single woman who owns a small food vending store which she started in 2007. She works everyday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $15 from her sales.
Aisha now hopes for a loan of $100 to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is the thirty-two year old married operator of a small auto parts stand. He has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over nine years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Korea and Holland. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Edward also plans on using the proceeds of his business to help operate his taxi car. The taxi car is driven by his friend. Edward is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Edward would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru:
Sirojidin R. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children. In order to provide for his family Sirojidin raises livestock. He purchases young calves, fattens them and resells them at the same markets. He has been in this business for 15 years. Almost the entire population of the rural area is in this business. Sirojidin would like to get a loan and increase the headcount of his livestock. This will allow him to increase the income for his family. Sirojidin plans to pay back the loan over a 6 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Сироджиддин проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат и имеет 5 детей. Чтобы обеспечить свою семью клиент занимается животнводством. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет.Почти все население сельской местности занимается этим видом бизнеса. Поэтому клиент планирует получить кредит и увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему увеличить доход для своей семьи. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Lesbia Juana

texts.es:
Lesbia R.' business is selling ice cream (Eskimos) and cosmetics, which she sells in her house in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. It's important to mention that since she started her business her life and that of her family has improved.

She is the mother of two children and her goals are to improve the condition of her business to improve the life of her family. It shouldn't be forgotten that since she started her business, it has improved thanks to the support that Ceprodel has given to her through loan which she has invested directly in the purchase of Eskimos and cosmetics for their respective sale in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la señora Lesbia R. es la venta de Eskimos o helados y venta de cosméticos los cuales los comercializa en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur. Es de importancia mencionar que desde que inició su negocio ella ha venido mejorando su condición y la de su familia.

Es madre de dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y son sus metas mejorar las coediciones de su negocio para así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. No podemos obviar que desde que comenzó con su negocio, he venido mejorando satisfactoriamente gracias al apoyo que Ceprodel le ha brindado por medio de la entrega de créditos los cuales los ha invertido directamente en la compra de los Eskimos y los cosméticos para su respectiva venta en su sector de habitación,

loans.use: Purchase of products for her store

loans.name: Moussoura

texts.fr:
Mrs. Moussoura I. is a widow, born in 1947, at Kouna in the state (prefect) of Tchaoudjo. She makes her living selling yams, peanuts and fruits and has been doing this since 1999. She adapts to the season, selling what is available at the time. At the moment, she is selling mangos and yams She has previously made a business loan and it was duly repaid. She is requesting this second loan to purchase 10 baskets of mangos and 30 yam tubers to increase sales.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame I. Moussoura est née en 1967 à KOUNA dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo. Elle est veuve et a pour activité principale la vente d’ignames, d’arachide et de fruits. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1999 et adapte son activité à chaque saison. Elle vend actuellement des mangues et des ignames. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et s’est bien comporté dans le remboursement. Ce second prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 paniers de mangues et 30 tubercules d’ignames afin de mieux vendre.

loans.use: Purchase of mangos and yams

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou E. is 39 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He is a farmer in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Mr. Kokou hopes to increase his production by leasing more land that is suitable for cultivation. The increase of his production will allow him to earn more to support his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Kokou E. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants. Il est cultivateur à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Kokou espère par ce crédit accroître sa production en baillant d’autres parcelles cultivables. L’augmentation de sa production lui permettra de dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To lease land suitable for cultivation

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. He owns a small fruit and vegetables shop in the Palestinian camp of Beddawi. This is the first time Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables. Indeed, the holy month of Ramadan is usually a high season month for this type of business as there is more demand for vegetables than in other months.

loans.use: Increase his inventory of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu L., 67, is married with 8 children. She has many years of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the villagers and general public 7 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Sefulu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She mainly supplies her village and sometimes the general public, people from nearby villages.

loans.use: Purchase kerosene cooker, frying pan, sack of flour, sack of sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, plastic bags and food cover

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells provisions and drinks and she has been in this business for a long time. Margaret buys provisions in dozens and drinks in crates from distributors. She needs the loan amount of 99,000 Naira to buy more drinks to sell. Margaret is 42 years old and married with five children. She says "God bless all Kiva lenders".

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es: La Sr. María de 28 años de edad habitante en Healeah un barrio de la capital de Managua. Casada tiene tres lindos hijos de 8, 10 y 13 años todos estudiando en un colegio de la capital. Trabaja en su negocio de venta de lácteos desde 8 años de experiencia laboral, y posee sus clientes en donde lo vende. Como planes tienen comprar una nueva unidad de taxi y la construcción de un  pequeño garaje para meter su vehiculo,  Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograra cumplir con sus planes  de comprar el auto para ser utilizado como taxi y así general mas ingreso, crecer como negocio y generar mayores ventas con sus nuevos productos y darle  seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and lives in the Healeah district in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has three beautiful children aged 8, 10 and 13, all studying at a Managua school. She has 8 years of experience running her business selling dairy products to local customers. She plans to buy a new taxi, and to construct a small garage for the vehicle. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans she will be able to achieve her goal to buy a car to use as a taxi, and in this way generate more income, grow her business, increase her sales with new products, and offer security to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for a garage

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luís tiene 21 años, habita en el  barrio Reparto Shick, de estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida y obtener con su esfuerzo un patrimonio para el futuro de la familia que tendrá. De profesión zapatero iniciando desde hace nueve años de experiencia en el ramo de la remodelación de zapatos. Sus metas en el ámbito profesional  es crecer, aumentar sus ingresos y alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica Gracias a los prestamos  de Afodenic lograra brindarle a sus clientes una mejor atención y un servicio rápido con la compra de otras  maquinas de zapaterías.
texts.en:
Luís is 21 years old, lives in the Reparto Shick neighborhood, is single and does not have any children. His plans for his family are to improve his standards of living and use his strengths to obtain a legacy for the future family he will have one day. He has been a shoe cobbler for 9 years, working on repairing shoes. His professional goals are to grow, increase his income and achieve a better economic stability. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans he will be able to provide his customers better attention and quick service with the purchase of other shoe repair machines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine and raw materials for his shoe repair business

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: In Gango, Ludivina D. is enjoying her vegetable selling. She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 kids. Her husband works as a laborer.  Ludivina thought of putting up vegetable vending.  Since Ludivina has to pay a large sum of interest from a lender she hasn’t been able to sell different types of vegetables.  With the  loan they hope to increase the sales volume and have more profit so they can have a mode of transportation to import/export vegetables. More than anything else they wish to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg D. is a single mother who lives with four children. Two of her children she adopted after her sibling died a few years ago. Her own son has already graduated from university, and he works as a policeman. Her own daughter is a university student. She has been taking loans with XacBank since 2005 to expand her book sales business. Many types of used and new books are sold at her stall.

Since 2002, Altantsetseg has rented the bookstall at one of the capital city, Ulaanbaatar's, five biggest bookstores. Her business capital is MNT 2,000,000 (about 1,335 USD). She gets an average daily income from sales of MNT 28,000 (about 18.70 USD). At this time, she plans to buy textbooks to sell to high school students who are preparing for their university test. She has a very good credit history with XacBank.

loans.use: To buy students' textbooks for her store

loans.name: Teab

texts.en: Teab S., 34, is married and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, with her husband and four of her children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make US$6 per day, while her husband works as a journalist (Phnom Penh Post) and earns US$280 per month. Mrs. Teab S. will use this loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthou M. lives in Prachum Angk Village, Kandal Province with her husband and two year old child. She is a hard working woman. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sohpal (pictured with her), is a policeman. He has difficulty getting to work because he has no vehicle.  To solve this problem, Mrs. Chanthou M. is requesting a loan to buy motorbike for her husband drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Холмат - мужчина 53 лет. Женат. Отец 5-х детей. Занимается купле-продажей и откормом скота. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи и продает пряжу на рынке. Сыновья тоже помогают по хозяйству. Невестки занимаются домашней работой. У них очень большая семья, поэтому потребность тоже большая. Они откармливают скот и продают на рынке, а раз в два месяца закалывают мелко рогатый скот для себя. Иногда они закалывают крупно-рогатый скот и продают мясо мясникам. Этим они зарабатывают на жизнь.
texts.en:
Kholmat is a 53-year-old man, married and the father of five children. He buys, sells and raises cattle. His wife spins yarn and sells it at the market. Their sons also help on the farm, while their daughters-in-law keep house. They have a very large family with many needs. They fatten the cattle for market, and once every two months butcher a head of small-horned cattle for themselves. Sometimes they slaughter a head of large-horned cattle and sell the meat to the butchers. That's how they earn a living.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling of cattle

loans.name: Fedilita

texts.en:
Fedilita S. is a rice farmer. She is 32 years old and has two children. Her husband, Astrolovio S., is also a farmer. Together, they never mind the hard labor, feeling the heat of the sun and touching the wet soil to ensure food for the family. Farming is their only source of living. Their harvest enables them to easily feed and clothe their children.

Fedilita is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers, seed and insecticides. The loan will help a lot to increase her yield. It will really help her to increase her income.

Fedilita has been a CEVI client for a long time already. She is provided not just with loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seed and insecticides

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
“God always plan the best things for us, just trust in Him” said Erlinda. It was this quote that was her motivating factor to move forward in expanding her business and in overcoming difficulties of life. Erlinda was very lucky to have her business continuously grow through her sacrifices. She really wants her business to develop into a grocery store someday and is working very hard to realize her dream. She is asking to borrow loan amounting to PHP 9,000 as additional working capital.  

She also maintains an eatery business and despite her busy days in the business, Erlinda still does not forget her obligation to her family especially during Sundays when her while family attends mass in their local Church. She is married to Rudy who works with her in their business. They were blessed with 3 children who were all married already. Her daily income from the business is mostly used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish construction of her store.

loans.name: Zoila Margarita

texts.es: Zoila Margarita P. E. de 33 años de edad reside en San Marcos junto a sus padres y sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera y es la única que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos. Zoila posee una venta de frutas en la tiendona, uno de los mercados más grandes del país, cada día ella esta ahí esperando a que los camiones con frutas lleguen para poder escoger las mejores frutas. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder aumentar la variedad de frutas como por ejemplo vender uvas, ciruelas entre otras frutas de estación, lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y tener una mejor vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zoila Margarita P. E. of 33 years of age resides in San Marcos together with her parents and her 3 children. She is a single mother and is the only person to watch over the well-being of her children. Zoila has a fruit business in the tiendona, one of the biggest markets in the country. Every day she is there waiting for the fruit trucks to arrive to be able to select the best fruit. She is seeking a loan now as she desires to be able to expand the variety of fruit, for example to sell grapes and plums, among other fruits, which will permit her to obtain better earnings and have a better life together with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Apu Curi Group

texts.es:
Los socios son un número de 9 miembros, todos ellos pertenecen al banco comunal “APU CURI”, ubicado en la comunidad de Quiquijana en el distrito de Quispicanchis en la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Estos socios alternan sus diferentes actividades tanto del hogar como particular, con la agricultura y la ganadería, también son comerciantes menores, ellos venden lo que sus tierras producen (maíz, alcachofas, papa, habas, trigo, cebada, olluco, entre otras variedades de productos según la época), Nuestros socios también se dedican a otras actividades, como la Sra rosa y su esposo Carlos ambos socios tienen una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en el pueblo, otros socios venden granos de las cosechas que quedan, otos, venden lana de alpaca y todos los socios desean volver a invertir su capital de trabajo en sus negocios ya conocidos. 

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The nine partners belong to “APU CURI,” a community bank located in the Quiquijana in the Quispicanchis district in Cusco. These partners alternate their different activities around the home, working with both agriculture and livestock. They are also small-time vendors, selling what they produce on their land (corn, artichoke, potatoes, beans, wheat, barley, ulluco, and various other products depending on the season). Our partners also dedicate themselves to other activities: Mrs. Rosa and her husband Carlos, have a small store grocery store, others sell the grains that remain from their harvest, and others sell alpaca wool. All the partners want to invest their working capital in their known businesses. The partners appreciate and value the loan granted through these means, and they are committed to complete payment within the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayham

texts.en:
Ayham is an active and hard-working young man. He is 29 years old, single, and lives in his parent’s house. He really feels like doing something to improve his life and succeed. He earns a living taking his customers from one place to another. Inseparable from his taxi, he drives up and down the streets of Nablus City of Palestine, looking for people who wish to use fast and safe transport. 

As any business generating income, the business of Ayham also requires some investment from time to time. Thus, now his car needs some fixing. For this purpose he is requesting a loan. Ayham promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him.

loans.use: fix his vehicle used for providing taxi services

loans.name: Makbouli

texts.en:
Makbouli is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. She lives in southern Lebanon, where she owns a bedcover shop. She requests a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy products and decorate her shop. It is Makbouli’s third cycle as a microcredit client and she has always paid on time.
Makbouli’s clients are mainly her friends and neighbors. She has faced some competition in the past but managed to make a name for herself in the region. Makbouli hopes to expand more and succeed in making her business well-known.

loans.use: To buy products and decorate her shop.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma S. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Alma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. She sells both food & daily use products to local community members. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product inventory. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La señora Teofila C. vive en alquiler con su hija en la calle inca roca de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la elaboración de empanadas fritas en aceite, las cuales las vende al lado del cine todos los días a partir de las 4:00 de la tarde; con esta actividad ella se mantiene desde hace mucho tiempo y el crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos (harina, queso, levadura) por cantidad y así obtener costos menores y por ende mayor ganancia.

Es cliente de Impro Desde el año 2008 y paga muy puntualmente, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Teofila C. lives in a rented home with her daughter in Inca Roca street in the Tacagua zone in La Paz. She makes empanadas fried in oil which she sells beside a cinema every day from 4 o'clock in the afternoon, and she has lived off this small business for a long time. With this loan she will purchase supplies (flour, cheese, yeast) in bulk whose lower cost will result in better earnings for her. Toefila has been a client of Impro since 2008 and pays very punctually, which is why she has been granted a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, cheese, oil and yeast for her fried empanada business

loans.name: Reziel

texts.en: Reziel P. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Reziel owns and operates a business cultivating fruit trees, like coconuts, and harvesting their fruit to process them for coco oil (copra). She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Reziel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  est menuisier dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé ; il est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Il a ouvert cet atelier depuis 1990 et dispose d’une longue expérience dans la menuiserie. Il a su fidéliser la plupart de ses clients qui apprécient la qualité de ses meubles. Pour cette raison, il achète très souvent des planches et confectionne des meubles qu’il revend ensuite. Il achète ses planches au Ghana, le pays voisin mais aussi en Côte d’ivoire pour la bonne qualité de leur bois. En ce moment il est en manque de fonds pour commander les planches ; c’est pour cela qu’il a approché WAGES pour pouvoir lancer de nouvelles commandes.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a furniture maker in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé.  He is married and has two children in his care.  He opened this workshop in 1990 and has extensive experience in carpentry.  He figured out how to earn the loyalty of most of his customers, who appreciate the quality of his work.  For this reason, he buys boards quite often and makes furniture, which he then resells.  He buys his boards in Ghana, the neighboring country, but also in Cote d'Ivoire, for the quality of their wood.  At this time, he lacks the funds for ordering boards.  And so, he has approached WAGES to be able to initiate new orders.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Serjan

texts.en:
Serjan O. is 35-years-old and the father of four children. He resides in Bayan-Olgii province, one of Mongolia's western provinces, with his children and wife. Three of his four children are secondary school students; the fourth is a 1-month-old baby, for whom Serjan's wife stays home to care. 

Serjan has been engaged in small businesses since 2005. He started with a clothing retail business and subsequently switched to a fuel retail business in 2008. He purchases fuel from fuel-trucks that pass through his town to carry fuel from Russia to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He purchases the fuel at a lower price and then sells it to local car owners at a lower price than local fuel stations. Since he offers a better rate than local fuel stations, he receives fuel orders from his customers in advance. Additionally, he repairs broken cars and sells them at profit and runs a small chicken farm at home. His wife takes care of the chicken farm and sells the eggs in local stores. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can purchase some feed for his chicken farm and have more capital with which to purchase fuel for his customers' orders.

About XacBank:

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia; additionally, it has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: purchasing more chicken feed and fuel

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena C. is from the town of Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old and single. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Helfer

texts.es:
Helfer, de 18 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro.
Todas las mañanas, sale de su casa en busca de la leche con la cual puede elaborar sus deliciosos quesos, él trabaja toda la mañana en compañía de sus padres y llegado el medio día lleva sus quesos hasta el mercado del poblado. Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para ayudar en la economía de su casa.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender sus quesos, ya que gana un buen dinero por ellos, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir la leche, ya que tiene que ser de muy buena calidad. 
Para más adelante, espera reunir el dinero necesario para alquilar un puesto en el mercado, ya que actualmente vende sus quesos de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Helfer con MFP, sabe que tiene que esforzarse en su trabajo para no fallar en ninguna de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es uno de los miembros más jóvenes. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más leche, para incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Helfer is 18. He is a very hard-working and happy young man. He lives in his parents’ house. What he wishes for most is to build a good future. Every morning he leaves his house looking for milk that he will be able to use to make his delicious cheese. He works all morning with his parents. When midday comes he takes his cheese to the town market. Even though he is still very young, he knows that he has to work hard to help with the household economy. What he likes best about his work is selling his cheeses. He earns good money for them. He has been doing this for three years. The most difficult part is getting the milk because it has to be very good quality. Later, he hopes to get together enough money to rent a stand in the market. He currently sells his cheeses in an ambulatory fashion. This is Helfer’s first loan with MFP. He knows that he needs to put forth a lot of effort in his work in order to not miss any of his payments. He is much loved in his communal bank because he is one of the youngest members. He will use the 500 PEN that he is asking for to buy more milk in order to increase his cheese production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk

loans.name: Kimtray

texts.en:
Mr. Kimtray L. (pictured here), 29, and his wife, Mrs. Savy Yan, 30, have been married for more than eight and have three daughters. One of them is in school. They live in a small village off National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. 


Kimtray has been a mason for more than eight years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He lives with his parents. Now he wants to live in a separate home, but he does not have money to build his own house. Hence, he is requesting his second loan of US$600 to use for his project.

loans.use: To build his own house

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia P. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 48 years old. Delia is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Delia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Modesto

texts.es: El Sr.T. Morón Luis Modesto natural de ICA , vive con su esposa en su casa propia ubicada en los Grimaldos C-01, se dedica a manejar su mototaxi, la cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo, el a parte percibe una jubilación ya que tuvo un problema de salud en su pierna derecha la cual, le colocaron  mal una inyección intramuscular, el cual estuvo cerca de 02 años con un largo y costoso tratamiento, ya que con el apoyo de sus hijos pudo salir adelante. Dia busca su superación para el bien de su familia. Solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
T. Morón Luis Modesto is from Ica. He lives with his wife in his own house, which is located in the Grimaldos C-01. He drives his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which he got through a lot of effort. He receives a pension because he had health problems with his right leg. They placed an intramuscular injection poorly, and he had two years of a long and expensive treatment. With the help of his children he was able to get ahead. He looked to overcome the problem for his family’s well-being. He is asking for a loan to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., age 53, is widowed and lives with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Since 2008 she has run a business selling crushed ice with sweet syrup in her village, earning an income of $2.5 USD per day. One of her children helps her in this business. By doing so, S. is able to cover her family expenses, especially her children’s education.
S. is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a machine to crush ice to expand her current business. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a machine to crush ice

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Este Sra. Se llama Ana Lucía C. F., tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, un varón y una mujercita, el mayor que es el varón ya está cursando la secundaria en una escuela técnica, y la niña en escuela primaria, 

Ella se dedica  a la venta todo tipo de dulces que son propios de nuestro país.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte créditos, los cuales le han servido para invertir en el negocio, gastos personales,  a si también para mejoramiento de vivienda, vale mencionar que en todos los créditos otorgados a esta cliente, ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This woman is named Ana Lucía C. F.. She is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, a boy and a little girl. The boy is older and already attending a technical high school, while the girl is in elementary school. She sells all sorts of sweets typical of this country. She has received 20 loans from this institution, which she has used to invest in her business, cover personal expenses, and to improve her home. It should be noted that the client has been very responsible in fulfilling her obligations with every loan she's been offered.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, flour, spoons)

loans.name: Solecitos Group

texts.es:
El nombre del grupo surge por que comentan que ellas son como el sol que brilla. Ellas se reúnen semanalmente para realizar sus pagos. Este grupo esta ubicado en Rancho Grande municipio de Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa Oax. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes de las cuales todas salen en la foto.


La representante del grupo se llama Nelida A. Rodríguez tiene 25 años y 2 hijos ella se dedica ala venta de cosméticos y cría marranos (cerdos) y necesita el préstamo para invertir en su actividad y así poder salir adelante y darle una buena educación a sus hijos, así como una alimentación adecuada.


Su meta es criar más marranos (cerdos)  y poder tener su propia carnicería, ampliar más su negocio de cosméticos.


Los integrantes del grupo son: Nelida A. Rodríguez vende cosméticos y cría marrano, Norma P. R. vende tamales, Flor Ofelia M. P. vende antojitos, Maritza M. P. vende antojitos, Natalia C. P. vende gasolina, Antonia C. V. vende antojitos, Paulina Domínguez V. vende ropa, Margarita Rodríguez Torales compra alimento para criar animales, Janette A. Rodríguez vende antojitos, Judith M. U. y abarrotes.
texts.en:
The name of the Solecitos group comes from the word "Sol" ("Sun") and is because the women are shining like the sun. The members meet weekly to make their payments. This group is located in the municipality of Rancho Grande, Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa Oax. The group consists of 10 members, all of whom are in the photo. They are represented by Nelida A. Rodríguez, who is 25 years old and has two children. She makes a living selling cosmetics and raising pigs, and needs the loan to invest in her activities so she can make headway and give her children a good education and adequate nourishment. Her goal is to raise more pigs and be able to have her own butcher shop, and also expand her cosmetics business more. The other members of the group are: Nelida A. Rodríguez, who also sells cosmetics and raises pigs; Norma P. R., who sells tamales; Flor Ofelia M. P. who sells snacks; Maritza M. P., who also sells snacks; Natalia C. P., who sells gasoline; Antonia C. V., who sells snacks; Paulina Domínguez V., who sells clothing; Margarita Rodríguez Torales, who buys animal feed; Janette A. Rodríguez, who sells snacks; and Judith M. U., who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses to increase their income and offer a better future for their families

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita U. and her family are very much thankful to ASHI. Because of her membership, she has able to access loans she used to finance a business from its start and through its growth. Her husband’s fishing business started very small. Eventually, through their consecutive and increasing amount of loan received through ASHI, it has grown because they were able to purchase two fishing motorboats.

Lolita is the one who sells the fish to the fish vendors in the town’s public market and the proceeds of her business are used to improve the lives of her family and support the education of her three children. Unfortunately, Lolita’s children didn’t want to pursue their education in college. Lolita is unhappy with their decision but she has to respect her children’s decision to help her in growing her business and making it stable and profitable.

With that, through the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase another fishing boat to be managed by her eldest child who is now 24 years old. Lolita and her two daughters (18 and 19 years old) will be helping each other to sell their fish and record the family cash flow.

Someday, Lolita wishes her business will become stable and sustainable whereby it generates employment. She wants to help other people in their community have their own source of income through her family business.

loans.use: To purchase another fishing motorboat for the family business

loans.name: Kathia

texts.es:
Kathia C. L., tiene la edad de 39 años, está casada, y vive con su esposo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Kathia también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Kathia C. L. is 39 years old, married, and lives with her husband. Her loan will be used for attending to her farm, specifically for growing coffee. She plans to buy compost and fertilizers so that she can adequately maintain her coffee crop in order to obtain better quality and the best price when it is time to harvest. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Doña Kathia has been farming for many years. She hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater financial stability for her family. In addition, she wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers for her coffee crop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is a school teacher. Along with teaching, she runs a small farming business where she grows vegetables in a greenhouse. This business brings additional income to her family and provides her family with good quality vegetables. Natalia enjoys growing vegetables and selling them at the market. She knows that her clients will be thankful for good quality at reasonable prices. 

Natalia and her husband have three adopted children. She teaches them how to work and provide for themselves. Natalia needs to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase plastic sheeting for her greenhouse and fertilizers for her plants.

loans.use: To purchase plastic sheeting for her greenhouse and fertilizers for her plants

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy L. is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by her general store and rice retailing business. She lives in Brgy Mahilum, Calatrava, Negros Occidental, with her four children aged 15 to 37 years old. One of her children has their own family while the other three children are currently in school.
Lucy has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 1990 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.
Lucy is now borrowing 20,000 PHP to continue her general store and rice retailing business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lucy aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additonal working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy food ingredients and drinks to meet demand; she has little capital to increase her production; this loan will help her buy what she needs to make her sales

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty C. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 50 years old. Betty is single. To make a living, Betty owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Betty joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Betty is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Betty from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.en:
A. Abdumalik is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling clothing and shoes for teenagers. He is not married and lives with his parents. Abdumalik started his business 15 years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people’s clothing needs. He sells clothes that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Abdumalik is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable. 

One of his main goals is to have his own family and to build his own house. Abdumalik has requested a loan of $3000 USD to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Abdumalik. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Tajikistan has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have the opportunity to have a viable business. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Malahka Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Malahka” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aruna I. K. who is pictured on the left. Aruna  was born in Magburaka, thirty-two years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have  five children, four of whom are attending primary school. Aruna has been a businessman for twelve years now. He now sells salt, rice, sugar and caustic soda wholesale (by the bag). Aruna will use his share of the loan to buy more of the above-mentioned items to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy salt, rice, sugar and caustic soda

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Antonio, es casado y tiene una hija de diez años de edad. Su esposa trabaja en una farmacia. El señor se dedica al servicio de taxi. Este negocio ya tiene seis años de estar funcionando, en primera instancia dio inicio ante la necesidad de trabajo, después vio que era rentable el negocio y decidió continuar con el mismo. Don Marlon solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar repuestos para el vehículo, no porque este malo, sino porque desea darle mejores condiciones y mas presentación al mismo. El además trata de brindar un buen servicio, para que las personas lo conozcan y si es posible lo elijan cuando desean viajes privados. Su sueño, es comprar otra unidad que sea manejado por otra persona de su familia, con el objetivo de brindar empleo a otro miembro de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon Antonio is married and has a 10-year-old daughter. His wife works at a pharmacy, while he offers taxi services for a living. He has been in business for six years. He started the business because he needed work, but as he saw how lucrative it was, he decided to stick with it. Mr. Marlon is requesting this loan with the goal of purchasing spare parts for his vehicle, not because it is in disrepair, but because he wants to fix it up and make it look better. He tries to offer the best possible service so that he can become well-known and people can choose him for their private transportation needs. His dream is to purchase another vehicle so that he can offer a job to another one of his family members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jesus Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Jesus Carlos; el tiene 50 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio trabaja técnico en arreglo de  computadoras, también vende repuestos para computadoras y también vende equipos de computadoras, él tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio quiere tener una tienda mas grande e implementarla. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como repuestos para las computadoras. 

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesus Carlos is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorimankacha”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 50 years old, married, and has two children. Jesus Carlos works as a computer repair technician and also sells computer parts and equipment. He has a shop that he manages from 9am until 7pm. Jesus Carlos wants to have a larger shop that is more established. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as computer parts.

Sr. Jesus Carlos is grateful to everyone who made this dream possible and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer parts

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: José Rolando tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte y vive en una zona caracterizada por comerciantes informales. Inicio su negocio con muy poca experiencia pero con la ayuda de una amigo que le enseño a manejar decide hacerse cargo pues siempre ha sido un padre muy responsable tiene 8 hijos y poco a poco fue logro obtener este medio de vida. Con este crédito quiere mejorar las condiciones de su automóvil. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
