José Rolando’s business is providing public transportation services. He lives in an area noted for its informal merchants. He started his business with very little experience but when a friend taught him to drive he decided to take charge because he has always been a very responsible father. He has 8 children. Gradually he attained this way to earn a living. He will use the loan to improve the condition of his car. In the future he’d like to improve the conditions of his house in order to provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Ma. Gloria

texts.en:
Ma. Gloria T. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48 years old. Ma. Gloria is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector managing a vegetable vending business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Ma. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ma. Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ma. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ma. Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
"Epifanio B. is a 50-year old married man who supports his family by operating 3 business ventures: raising pigs, operating a General Store and a tricycle transport business. He lives in Prk. 6, Brgy. Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since Feb. 2002 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through his own efforts. By working hard in his pig raising, General Store and Tricycle transport businesses, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Epifanio is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that he  could  fund operations of his 3 business ventures.  This will be his 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of PHP 12,000, which he paid off well within its term was just another step in his journey toward economic freedom. Epifanio aspires to elevate his family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of Piggery

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim C. (shown in the photo) has been married since 1976 and has five daughters. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker, one is in a local school and another one weaves silk at home and assists her mother in the business. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Yim raises pigs at home and her husband produces rice wine. Yim is requesting a loan of US $600 to continue her business by purchasing feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eight members, all residents of Ruessei Srok village, Kandal Province. Mrs. Mean C., a 38-year-old married woman, was selected as the village bank president by its members. The group loan members will each use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Mean C. earns her living by selling bananas. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy more bananas. Her husband, Mr. Un Sopheak, 38 years old, works as car driver, earning a little salary to support his family. This couple has four children, three of whom are attending the local school, while the fourth is four years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Khcyorng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Khcyorng S. H., 47 years old, is the group leader selected by the four members of a group loan in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. 

He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows sapota (a fruit) to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Tang H. Tey, is a rice seller who is able to earn some profit to support her family. Although they work hard, they earn a small income. To improve his family's standard of living, Mr. Khcyorng S. H. is applying for a loan to start a new business by buying beef to sell. He is the father of four children, one of whom is an air-conditioner repairer while the others are students.

loans.use: to buy beef

loans.name: Malinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Malinda L. is 39 years old and married. She is a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She and her husband have been blessed with eight children who are now teenagers. Her husband is a driver of motorcycles for hire with an average net income of not less than P150 a day. To help her husband in raising their children, she decided to start a business, and opened up a little dried fish-selling shop in their barangay. For a year, she has been able to maintain this business and has been able to purchase stock for her business. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than P1500 a month, which amount is very helpful for their family.

She joined PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a first-time borrower with an excellent credit record, she was allowed to borrow the amount of P4000 to add to her capital for her existing dried fish business. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments, daily basic needs and savings for the future use of their child.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel G. G. tiene 37 años y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Angel es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Desde hace 3 años Angel se dedica a la siembra de yuca y cacao. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. El solicita este crédito para comprar y sembrar más cacao y yuca. De esta manera el podrá mejorar su cosecha. 

Para el futuro Angel desea tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Angel G. G. is 37 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Angel is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.


Angel has been growing cassava and cacao for 3 years.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther.  He is requesting this loan so that he can buy and sow more cacao and cassava.  In this way he will be able to improve his harvest.  In the future, Angel would like to own his own home.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is 48-year-old married woman with five children. She started as a farmer and raised capital which she used to start up a crafts business in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She hopes to change her business to a retail shop and educate her children. She wants a loan to buy craft materials.

loans.use: to buy craft materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand and develop her business

loans.name: Clarita Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Clarita, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Amilcingo, Temoac, en el Estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por 6 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Clara Antonia R. Ríos va a comprar con su crédito ollas, cazuelas y cacahuate por carga para vender,  Esmeralda Maribel Ríos Gutiérrez va a comprar cacahuate por carga y dulces (palanqueta de cacahuate y jamoncillo para vender, la señora Rosalina Roberta L. C. va a comprar obleas por paquete para recórtala en diferentes tamaños y venderla por caja, la señora Imelda Marín Velázquez va a comprar cacahuate por carga, palanqueta de cacahuate, alegría, tamarindo, jamoncillo, cocadas para vender, la señora Anadeli L. Pérez va a comprar cacahuate por carga, camote por bulto, elote por ciento para vender, la señora Maleni N. Ríos va a comprar catálogos y surtir sus primeros pedidos. La señora Esmeralda Maribel Ríos Gutiérrez tiene 38 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria obteniendo su certificado, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Jorge de 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria, Wilbert tiene 16 años de edad estudia bachilleres, y Maleni tiene 18 años de edad y trabaja, ella elabora los dulces típicos y cacahuate, ella solicito su crédito para comprar piloncillo, miel, cacahuate, amaranto, tamarindo, azúcar. La señora Esmeralda tiene su negocio de venta de dulces, los productos que ofrece son alegría, palanqueta de cacahuate, jamoncillo, tamarindo, chilacayote, camotes. Su negocio lo ha tenido desde pequeña sus papas a eso se dedicaban, sus papas le enseñaron es herencia de sus padres son de generaciones, al principio los proveedores de la materia prima le daban crédito y después pagaban pero algunos quedaron mal ya no pagaban y ahora ya no le dan crédito tiene que pagar al contado lo que ella compra, ella sale a vender sus dulces a la feria de Amecameca en los tianguis, va a Cuautla, a Yecapixtla, Ozumba, sus cliente son de todo tipo señores, señoras, niños, muchachas, ella paga fletes o en transporte público para trasladarse a las ferias o tianguis, su negocio es importante porque de aquí nos mantenemos, par la escuela de los niños, para la alimentación, los pasajes, para pagar el préstamo, la parte favorita de su negocio es cuando vende bien y está orgullosa de poder elaborar los dulces que sus padres hacen y que le enseñaron a elaborar desde que era pequeña, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son costos elevados y el clima donde hace frio le perjudica a la alegría y cuando hace calor suda mucho el dulce, su familia participan en el negocio sus hijos empaquetan los dulces y su esposo le ayuda a elaborar los dulces, su negocio enfrenta la competencia de otros puestos de dulces pero en un tianguis va de todo y los clientes compran con quien ellos quieren, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza invirtiéndolas en mercancía, para comer, y para pagar el préstamo, la señora Esmeralda está planeando ampliar su negocio meter otros dulces diferentes y lo piensa lograr administrando bien las ganancias. Este negocio ha ayudado mucho a la familia en la alimentación y para todos los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son arreglar el techo y repellarlo, ella está muy feliz con esta oportunidad que le dieron y gracias por confiar en nosotros, las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son que ellos tengan una profesión y que vivan bien y contentos y este préstamo le va a ayudar a invertirlo en los dulces para así seguir ayudando en los estudios de sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “gracias por confiar en nosotros y ojala sigan ayudando a más personas que lo necesiten”
texts.en:
This group is called Clarita, and it is located in the community of Amilcingo, Temoac, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  It has 6 members, women who are neighbors and know each other. Clara Antonia R. Ríos will use her loan to buy pots, pans, and bulk peanuts to sell.  Esmeralda Maribel Ríos Gutiérrez is going to buy bulk peanuts and candy (peanut brittle and jamoncillo--candy made with milk, sugar and ground pumpkin seeds) to sell.  Rosalina Roberta L. C. is going to buy packages of wafers to recut them into different sizes and sell them by the box.  Imelda Marín Velázquez is going to buy bulk peanuts, peanut brittle, alegría (amaranth candy), tamarind, jamoncillo, and coconut cookies to sell.  Anadeli L. Pérez is going to buy bulk peanuts, bulk sweet potatoes, and corn to sell.  Maleni N. Ríos is going to buy catalogues and supply her first orders.  

Esmeralda Maribel Ríos Gutiérrez is 38 years old and studied through the third year of secondary school, obtaining her certificate.  She is married and has three children: Jorge, 14 years old, who attends secondary school; Wilbert, 16 years old, studying for his bachillerato (a level between secondary school and college); and Maleni, 18 years old, who works making typical candy and peanuts.  Esmeralda is asking for the loan to buy brown sugar, honey, peanuts, amaranth, tamarind, and sugar.  She has a business selling candies.  The products she offers are alegría, peanut brittle, jamoncillo, tamarind, chilacayote (squash), and sweet potatoes.  She has been doing this since she was little; her parents were in the business and taught her.  It has been her family heritage for generations.  In the beginning, her raw material suppliers gave her credit, and she paid later, but some of the other customers did not pay.  Now they don't give credit, and she has to pay cash for what she buys.

She goes to sell her candies at the fair in Amecameca in the market stalls. She goes to Cuautla, to Yecapixtla, and to Ozumba.  Her customers are all kinds of people: men, women, children, young women.  She buys a ticket or takes public transportation to get to the fairs or market stalls.  Her business is important because it's how she maintains herself and her family.  It's how she pays for her children's schooling, for food, and for transportation tickets, and it's how she pays back the loan.  Her favorite part of her business is when her sales are good and she is proud to be able to make the candies her parents make and taught her to make since she was a little girl.  The challenges her business faces are elevated prices and the climate.  When it's cold, it harms the alegría, and when it's hot, the candy sweats a lot.  Her family participates in the business.  Her children package the candy and her husband helps her to make it.  Her business encounters competition from the other candy stands, but in the market stalls, everything is there, and people buy from who they want.  She will invest the earnings from the business in merchandise, in food to eat, and in paying back the loan.  Esmeralda is planning to expand her business into other candies, and she plans to do it by managing her profits well.  This business has helped the family a lot in affording food and all the children's school costs.  The improvements she would like to make to her house are fixing the roof and plastering it.  She is very happy with this opportunity she has been given and says thank you for having confidence in us.  She hopes her children will have a profession and live happy and well.  This loan will help her to invest in the candies in order to keep helping her children's education.  The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad "thank you for having confidence in us and we hope you keep helping more people who need it".

loans.use: Purchase of brown sugar, honey, peanuts, amaranth, tamarind, and sugar to make candy

loans.name: Kalyiman's Group

texts.en: Kalyiman K. is the treasurer of this group. She is 50 and married to a tractor driver. Together they are bringing up a 3-year-old son. The family earns money by providing tractor services. Kalyiman’s husband has been doing this for 22 years. He got that tractor as an inheritance from his father. In this way the family earns 10,000 soms per month. That profit made it possible for them to save money and purchase 10 livestock animals for breeding. Kalyiman applied for the loan because they need money to repair the tractor. In the future, the family wants to purchase a piece of land in Kerben for farming. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To repair a tractor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 59 year old business lady. She rears and sells chicken to earn a living, and has been operating the business for over ten years. She has used her previous loans from Faulu Kenya to uplift her business, which has made a big impact in her life.

She hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy more chickens and chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Elinestine

texts.en:
Elinestine is a mother of one child who is one year and eight months old. She is 27 years old and her husband is a businessman. 

She sells sorghum and beans; she has sold sorghum for 3 years which has enabled her to renovate her house. She hopes to expand her shop with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy sorghum and beans

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 42  años, es casada,  vive en casa propia y tiene 03 hijos. Cliente vive en   un caserío, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.  La provincia de Lambayeque se encuentra a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que realiza Yolanda es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales negocia quincenalmente en los  mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Rafael cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio.
Los ingresos que percibe le sirve para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Yolanda desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 42, is married and lives in her own house; she has three children.  She lives in a hamlet located ten minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  Lambayeque Province is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Yolanda raises animals that she sells biweekly at the Chiclayo and Lambayeque markets.  She raises the animals in corrals located in her back yard.
Income is used to cover family expenses.  Her husband is a farmer.

Yolanda wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals so she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33. She is a married woman with two children. The oldest child is 12. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for 10 years. She earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jesus-Marie Group

texts.fr: JESUS-MARIE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres  pratiquent tous la même religion et fréquentent la même Eglise. La représentante du groupe Lydie Amour (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est née le 27 juin 1985 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Lydie Amour est mariée à un militaire nommé Arouna. Le couple a deux enfants à charge, tous scolarisés dont un est leur propre enfant. Lydie Amour vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cocotomey  dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Il y a près de quatorze ans que la famille s'est installée dans cette commune. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Lydie Amour vend depuis cinq ans divers produits (lait, sucre, savons...), des condiments de sauce (tomates  fraîches,  piments, oignons...)  et des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Lydie Amour s'approvisionne à Dantokpa  marché international du Bénin, et parfois au marché de Cococodji. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Lydie Amour désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
JESUS-MARIE is a group composed of three people whose members practice the same religion and attend the same church. The group’s representative, Lydie Amour (with her hand raised in the photo), was born on June 27, 1985 in Allada, in Atlantique county. Lydie Amour is married to a soldier named Arouna. The couple have two children to support. Both children are in school; one of them is their own child. Lydie Amour lives together with her children and husband in Cocotomey, in the commune of  Abomey Calavi. Nearly fourteen years ago, the family settled in this commune. Together, the parents ensure that the various family expenses are covered.

For five years, Lydie Amour has been selling various goods (milk, sugar, soaps...), sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, chili peppers, onions...), and some cosmetics out of her house. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sometimes at the Cococodji market. 

She is a previous ALIDé client who has repaid her past loans properly. With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying the demands of her customer, she would like to obtain more financing along with the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, baskets of fresh tomatoes, chili peppers, boxes of soap, and boxes of milk

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and 45 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products like shampoo, soap, canned goods and some daily needs in every day life. Mary Ann has had this business for 15 years.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase drinks and cooking ingredients to sell. Each month, Mary Ann earns about PHP 3,000 from her selling business.

In the future, Mary Ann hopes that her business will improve to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothes, shoes and pieces for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has a talent for preparing embroidered dresses. She learned the skill of embroidery from her mother in her teenage years. Before her marriage, she took advantage of her skills and she has continued it after her marriage as well. 

She does this work for her family so they have a better standard of living. Her family respects her a lot for her caring behavior towards them.  Her husband is involved in an animal feed selling business. He sells animal feed to those who are involved in the livestock business. They are his regular customers.  

Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animal feed in larger quantity for resale. Surriya is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband’s business will improve further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Surriya.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Babacar est créé depuis le 17 mai 2010, il est composé de neuf femmes issues du même village et qui ont comme lien commun le petit commerce.

Madame Astou la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère d'un enfant et a en charge une nièce, son activité principale est le commerce de tissus et elle a une expérience de 25 ans; sur la photo elle est debout à droite derrière la femme assisse et habillée en wax vert.

EllE s'approvisionne dans les villes en ( wax, voile, bazin, soie....)et revend dans le village.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt augmenter les tissus afin de se faire beaucoup de revenus.

Elle compte bien fructifier son capital afin de réaliser de bons bénéfices et ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout pour la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Babacar was created on May 17, 2010. It comprises nine women from the same village who have small businesses as a common tie. 

Ms. Astou, the group’s official, is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one child, plus she has her niece in her care. Astou’s main business involves commerce in fabrics. She has 25 years of experience; she is the one standing at the right, behind the woman sitting down, and she is dressed in green 'wax' cloth. 

She gets her supplies (‘wax’ cloth, sheers, damask, silk...) from cities and resells them in the village. She would like to use her loan to augment her supply of fabrics in order to make much more income.

Astou really plans on making her capital grow, so as to make good profits and thus to improve her family’s living conditions, especially regarding food and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to be sold

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a skillful lady who does sewing for her neighboring clients. She receives regular orders and makes good profits every month from her skills. She is 28 years old and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Four of her children are getting their education while her youngest child is not of school-going age yet. 

Her husband is an employee in the factory. His income is not enough for the whole family. That’s why Rukhsana adopted the profession of sewing clothes. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her business of sewing. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish her orders on time and earn better profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business for the past five years. She is confident that an investment will bring even better profits to her and help her family to live a better financial life. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Alppha

texts.fr: Monsieur Alpha  est un jeune technicien de 35 ans.  Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 5 ans. Il est spécialisé dans la réparation de téléviseurs. En même temps  il s’active dans la commercialisation de télévisions et d’habillage de téléphones portables depuis 2004. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour. C’est aussi pendant la période de chaleur voire l’hivernage  et surtout avec les coupures d’électricités  que ses affaires marchent le plus. Alpha est un habitué de son guichet locale puisqu’il y a déjà remboursé 3 crédits antérieurs. Son adhésion  date du mois de mai 2009. Il emprunte un montant de 300 000frs avec lequel il compte s’approvisionner en habillages de téléphones portables et téléviseurs d’occasion destinés a la vente. Avec ce financement il souhaite renforcer son stock de marchandises, améliorer ses gains financiers pour ainsi stabiliser son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. Alpha is a young technician of 35. He is married and a father of three children aged three to five.
He specializes in repairing televisions. At the same time, he has been active in the retail of TVs and cell phone cases since 2004. He chose this business out of love. His business is also at its most successful during the hot and rainy seasons, and is especially brisk with power outages.
Alpha is familiar with the Baye Laye counter, since he has already repaid three previous loans there. He joined the organization in May 2009. He is borrowing a total of 300,000 XOF with which he plans on stocking up on cell phone cases and refurbished TVs intended for retail. With this financing, he hopes to increase his inventory, grow his profit, and thus stabilize his standard of living.

loans.use: to buys cell phones cases and refurbished televisions to resell.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia, age 56, operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resells them at a small profit. Her products are slippers, sandals, and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy her merchandise due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. She has to work hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
 
Pelagia lives in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, with her husband Agustin, who works as a welder, and their children. Pelagia has managed to afford her older children's schooling. The entire family helps each other to manage their household while operating the business.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pelagia dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes eventually to have her own equipment for making slippers and sandals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities and varieties of products so as to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is 37 years old, married and has three school-age children. He finished his tertiary education but due to lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in corn farming to earn an income and support his family needs. Being a farmer is difficult, but he needs to work hard and strive harder for the sake of his family. He has been in this business for almost nine years and usually earns a profit of PHP 25,000 every harvest season. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, he wants to increase his yields and income to satisfy their needs. He is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor required in corn production. He hopes that the loan will help them to increase their yields. He mentioned that hard work and strong determination will makes his dream comes true.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for labor

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Telesforo de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el pilar de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Norma, es el cultivo de plantas de cacao, café y plátano, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Esta será  su primer crédito con MFP y por ello ya se siente muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas y así progresar gracias al apoyo de ellos. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará la fachada de su vivienda comprando calaminas y maderas.
texts.en:
Norma, 34 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Telesforo, who is 35, and her 3 beloved children -- the focus of all her efforts. Norma dedicates herself to cultivating cacao, coffee, and plantains in the fields she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day, then when the proper moment arrives, she harvests her crops and sells them in the city of San Francisco.

What Norma likes most about her work is the liberty she has in carrying out the task, doing whatever she decides is best for her crops. She has been doing this for 10 years and considers the most difficult task to be transporting her harvests to market. Most often, it is difficult for her to obtain a car to transport what she wants to sell.

In the future, Norma wishes to buy new land to increase her plantings. This will be her 1st loan through MFP and already she feels very content at knowing that she can count on the help of investors and thus, she can progress, thanks to their help.

With the loan she is requesting, Norma will repair the outside of her house, buying sheets of corrugated iron and lumber.

loans.use: buy lumber and sheets of corrugated iron to repair her house.

loans.name: Zayola

texts.en:
Zayola is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Zayola provides transportation services by motorela (an enclosed motorcycle carriage) or habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that can carry multiple passengers). She has had this business for five years. 

Zayola requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and maintenance. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Zayola hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Buena Vista San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Eduardo es soltero, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y para diferente edades, inició este trabajo con sus padres y hasta ahora lleva 3 años con su propio negocio. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo para utilizarlo para capital de trabajo para la compra de mercadería: lencería, chupas, suéteres, playeras, camisas; para su posterior reventa, espera en el futuro tener un capital grande. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo, 22, is single.  He completed third grade.  He’s a merchant selling all types of clothes for all ages.  He started this work with his parents and now has had his own business for three years. 

He organized a group to request a loan to use as working capital to buy merchandise: lingerie, jackets, sweaters, t-shirts, shirts to resell later.  He hopes in future to have large capital.  The other group members are merchants.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis, un joven de 24 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Estelí, es casado, de oficio agricultor, siembra papas. En inicio sembrando hace 5 años, en la comunidad llamada la Tejera localizada en la afueras de Estelí, en ese entonces el estaba estudiando Ingeniería Agrónoma pero no puedo pues no tenia los recursos económicos para poder finalizar esa carrera, pero el con sus deseos de su superación siguió adelante hasta que logro estudiar contabilidad, trabajo como cobrador y luego paso al área de contabilidad don es auxiliar contable. Hoy en día además de trabajar como auxiliar contable, tiene unas siembras de papas en le Tejera, que por cual esta solicitando el préstamo  quiere sembrar 3 manzanas de papa, el desea que sacar una producción con muy buena rentabilidad y productividad que le permita poder tener ingresos para comprar su propio terreno de siembra, lograr el mismo producir la semilla y no comprarla y ser un productor prospero, capaz de ser auto sostenible y mejorar sus condiciones vida a su familia.
texts.en: Luis is a young man of 24 who is from the city of Estelí. He is married and works as a farmer, growing potatoes. He started growing crops five years ago in a community called La Tejera, which is located on the outskirts of Estelí. Back then, he was studying for a degree in agricultural engineering but he had to stop because he didn't have enough money to finish his course. However, he has a desire to improve himself and so he carried on and later managed to study accountancy. He worked as a collector and then started working in the field of accountancy where he is a junior accountant. Now, in addition to working as a junior accountant, he also grows potatoes in La Tejera. He is requesting this loan because he would like to sow 3 manzanas of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres) with potatoes. He would like his farming to be very profitable and productive and provide him with the income he needs to buy his own plot of farmland, produce his own seed instead of buying it, and become a prosperous farmer who is capable of being self-sustaining and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to sow three manzanas (just over 5 acres) with potatoes

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 46 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, biscuits, spices, beans, etc.. 

In the future Anecita would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Ricardo Candelario

texts.es: El Señor Ricardo titular de este crédito desea mejorar sus ingresos abasteciendo de manera más surtida el kiosco de dulces, cigarrillos y refrescos, porque este es el medio para subsistencia tanto de él como de su familia. Es padre de 2 hijos y además se hace cargo de los hijos de su pareja quien debido a un accidente, se encuentra en recuperación. La hermana de su cónyuge al ver la necesidad y además valorando el sacrificio de Ricardo es que le alquila el Kiosco que se encuentra en un lugar bastante estratégico por la afluencia de gente que hace su compra al paso. Los días que su hijo mayor Leo; no tiene escuela; Ricardo también trabaja como albañil, pues así contribuye para la economía de su hogar. El solo espera que sus hijos sean hombres de bien por lo que insiste en darles buena educación y en lo posible darles todo lo que ellos necesitan. Su hijo mayor tiene 16 años el segundo tiene 12 años, y los pequeños son de 6 y 4 años. El hijo mayor también tiene su aporte en la familia pues él se hace cargo de la supervisión de sus hermanos pequeños mientras su padre está en su fuente de trabajo. Durante la  evaluación del crédito pude conocer a la cónyuge del Sr Ricardo, ella se llama Patricia, quien está en etapa de recuperación por una caída que sufrió, estuvo por más de un año en tratamiento médico pues se encontraba inconsciente, ahora sin embargo el proceso de su recuperación es totalmente favorable. Hay días que ella también baja al kiosco para acompañar a Ricardo de manera que pueda distraerse y ayudar a su recuperación. Ella trata de colaborar en el Kiosquito.
texts.en:
Ricardo, the man who is requesting this loan, would like to improve his income by better stocking his kiosk where he sells candies, cigarettes and soft drinks as this is how he supports himself and his family.  Ricardo has two children and also takes care of the children of his partner who had an accident and is in recovery.  It was his partner's sister who, seeing the need and also valuing the sacrifice that Ricardo was making, hired the kiosk which is located in quite a strategic location owing to the large number of people who purchase things from it as they pass by.  On days when his eldest son Leo doesn't have school, Ricardo also works as a builder so that he can further contribute towards his household finances.

Ricardo hopes for his sons to become fine, upstanding young men and so he insists in providing them with a good education and, so far as he can, provides them with everything they need.  His eldest son is 16 years old and his second is 12 years old.  The little ones are 6 and 4.  His eldest son also contributes towards the family as he looks after his young siblings while his father is working.  During the loan evaluation, I was able to meet Ricardo's partner, Patricia, who is recovering from a fall that she suffered.  She was receiving medical treatment for more than a year as she was found unconscious.  Now, however, her recovery process is completely favorable.  There are days when she also goes down to the kiosk to accompany Ricardo so that she can occupy herself and aid her own recovery.  She tries to help out with the small kiosk.

loans.use: to have working capital for his business selling candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Joena

texts.en:
43-year-old Joena is a married woman with 5 children. She has had a sari-sari store for 10 years, where she sells items like shampoo, soap, and bottled water to her community. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from her business, which she does her best to improve while supporting her family.

Joena is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and gasoline. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, shampoo and gasoline

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de los socios del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Ruben es una padre emprendedor y trabajador que tiene una agencia de viajes donde brinda servicio de paquetes turísticos del valle sagrado de los incas, valle de sur del Cusco, visita a la ciudadela de Machupicchu y otras mas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Ruben requiere el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. 

Ruben agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ruben is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Ruben is a resourceful and hardworking father who runs a travel agency where he sells package holidays to the Incan sacred valley, to the Cusco southern valley, guided tours of the town of Machupicchu and many others more. He has been engaged in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for him thanks to the dedication he works with.

In this occasion Ruben is requesting a loan to buy tourist coupons.

Ruben is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and he commits to complying with the repayment of his monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy tourist coupons.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 and married. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, Mary has operated an electronics shop, selling to local area customers. Her major business challenge is price fluctuation. Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase electronics to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 54 years old and lives in D'Ban, Calamba. She is married and has 3 children. Aurora has a grocery store business and earns approximately PHP 6500 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP20,000  to purchase 10 cases of soft drinks and 20 boxes of grocery items. Aurora has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 cases of soft drinks and 20 boxes of grocery items

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en:
Jenty is a 30-year-old, married woman with four children two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Jenty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es:
José, tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de fibra de henequén, se dedica  a tiempo completo, desde hace 30 años, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparacion de un motor de 8 HP para desfibrar y además sembrara más henequén, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para José, pues le permitirá tener las herramientas necesarias para la realización del trabajo.
La aspiración de José es realizar un buen trabajo, mejorando cada día su productividad para poder mejorar tambien las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He makes a living producing hemp fiber. He has worked full time in this activity, which he learned from his father, for the last 30 years.

At present he is requesting this loan in order to repair an 8 HP motor for shredding and he will also plant more hemp. This loan will be a great help to José as it will allow him to get the necessary tools to do the job.

José goal is to do good work, improving his daily productivity to be able to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair a hemp shredding motor.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 36 años es un técnico electricista reconocido en el municipio de Madrid por su excelente servicio, él cuenta con una amplia experiencia de nueve años en el oficio y desde niño sintió inclinación por esta profesión en la que tomó estudios para poder ejercer certificado.  Él es padre de tres hijos menores de edad y se encuentra separado de su cónyuge, lo que no le impide cumplir con sus obligaciones como padre.  En la actualidad está requiriendo comprar una escalera de 16 pasos con niveles y una pulidora, proyecto que financiara a través de un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y acercarse a su meta de contar con un equipo de trabajo completo y ampliar la capacidad su negocio.

loans.use: comprar una escalera de 16 pasos con niveles y una pulidora

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace wants to pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Nafas Gul

texts.en: Nafas Gul, daughter of Saifullah, was born in 1960 and currently lives in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has 10 family members. She has a tailoring business at her home through which she solves her financial problems. She has taken 4 loans and now wants to take a 5th cycle. In her previous cycle she made very good use of her loan and bought a sewing machine in order to do her works quickly. Now she wants to take a 5th cycle loan with which she will buy more fabrics in order to produce more clothes. She has a deal with the wholesalers to whom she sells the clothes she makes. She is very happy with the loan process and wants to continue taking loans.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and machines

loans.name: Kayi

texts.en:
Kayi M. was born in 1961 in Aklakou, which is still her home. She is married, the mother of six, and mainly cooks and sells meals in a traditional restaurant, something she has been doing for over 20 years. With her income, she manages to see to the schooling of her children. Nicknamed « Mother AKOUMETO », she is known by all the kids, and she enjoys a good reputation because of her generosity. Each day, she strives to meet customer expectations. Corn, oil, condiments, firewood, and fish are what is necessary for her to make meals. Towards this end, she is requesting a loan of $800 to acquire the basic ingredients. Meeting these needs will lead to a loyal customer base for her and to an improvement standard of living for her and her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1961 à Aklakou où elle vit encore, Madame Kayi M. est mariée et mère de six enfants. Plus de vingt ans déjà, elle a pour activité la préparation et la vente de repas dans un restaurant traditionnel. De ces revenus, Madame M. arrive à s’occuper de ses enfants en scolarité. Surnommée « Maman AKOUMETO » et connue par tous les enfants, sa générosité lui offre une bonne réputation à AKLAKOU. Chaque jour elle fait des efforts pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Le maïs, l’huile, les condiments, le bois de chauffe, les poissons sont les nécessaires pour la préparation de ses repas. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour faire l’approvisionnement de ses matières premières. La satisfaction de ces besoins amènera Madame Kayi M. à fidéliser sa clientèle et à améliorer son cadre de vie ainsi que celle de ses enfants.

loans.use: Acquiring basic ingredients to make and sell meals

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is single. He lives in Melitopol, Ukraine. After his parents were tragically killed in a car accident, his mother’s friend took care of Alexei, helping him with his schooling and with starting his business. He became an entrepreneur after his mother’s friend suggested he should start his own venture. Today he runs a business selling office supplies. He rents a facility in one of the busy local malls which is a very favorable location. Alexei has been in this business for 2 years. Presently, he has about $3000 in inventory. His gross income per month is about $1200 and his net monthly profit is about $600.  

He is requesting a loan of $300 to increase the range of inventory in his store. He is planning to develop his business and improve his living standards. He hopes to use generated profits to do some remodeling in his apartment. We believe his diligence, determination and good credit history will guarantee the further success of his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Thanks to the help I have received in the past I've been able to improve my business, which sells personal hygiene products and cosmetic items, a little bit. My sales have increased because I've been able to better supply my business, and customers like the new products. I also sell some candy and drinks because I needed to stock my store a little more so it could grow. Thanks to the income, I've improved my family's finances a little bit. I need your help to keep my business growing and provide my children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Gracias a la ayuda recibida he podido acrecentar mi negocio un poco mas, mis ventas mejoraron ya que surti mi negocio y las personas les gustaron los nuevos productos. Tambien vendo algunos dulces y refrescos por lo que necesito surtir un poco mas el negocio para crecer. Gracias a los ingresos que he percibido he mejorado un poco mi ingreso familiar, necesito su ayuda para seguir creciendo y darles una mejor vida a mi hijos.

loans.use: Purchase personal hygiene products and other items.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Located along a busy street, which is a good location, Monica has a small bar where she sells cold beer and soft drinks. Refrigeration is rare, so cold drinks help a business to get customers. Villagers will take great pride in telling you that they have refrigeration.

Monica has operated her business for 4 years and has been a member of her lending group for two years. During that time, she has always been able to repay her loans. With this loan, she plans to restock her supply of beverages. The loan will also help her to meet basic family needs such as school fees for her children.

Monica is married, 27, and has 3 children of her own. She also cares for 3 orphans. Most of the people here care for orphans of relatives who have passed away. It is expected that you will care for your family members' children, but this creates an additional financial hardship. In time, Monica hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To restock her supply of beverages.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn M., age 29, works selling desserts and beef soup in her community, making about $3 to $4 each day of profit. Her husband is a construction worker, earning around $5 each day. They have three children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation and to invest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family’s transportation and to invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: New Kabale I (B) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for 11 months. Alice is 49 years old and marreid with three children. Her current business is livestock farming. She has two cows and four goats on zero grazing. Alice wants to start up a cultivation business with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting rice crop.

loans.name: Sokkin

texts.en:
Mr. Sokkin B. and his wife married in 1996. They have three daughters. One of their daughters studies in primary school and the other two little daughters stay at home. The family lives about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sokkin has been fishing for four years. He fishes in his village and then sells the fish at the Prek Pnao Market. His wife stays at home to take care of their children.

Mr. Sokkin is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $400 to purchase a motorbike to use to sell fish.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to use to sell fish

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.en:
Clemencia lives with her three children (ages: 14, 12, and 4) in a small community on the eastern peninsuL. of the Dominican Republic. Right now she sells clothing, but she wants to use this loan in order to buy more shirts, blouses, and jeans to sell and she also wants to add some curtains and interior decorations to her small business. In the future she wants to continue working in order to overcome the difficulties in her life. Clemencia told us that she enjoys studying in her free time, but usually she doesn't have much time to do that.

10 of the women in this bank have taken out a previous loan with Esperanza, but 5 of them are applying for loans for the first time! We are very excited for this group, and we want to thank all the Kiva lenders that make this possible. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy clothes and interior decorations for her business

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un  V., 41, and her husband were married in 1984 and have five two sons and three daughters. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. One of daughters works in a garment factory and other two children are in school. Her husband has been a mechanic for over ten years. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sam-un has been in the business of selling fruits, fishes, and vegetables such as tomatoes and cucumbers since 1984. She buys them from farmers in her village to resell at the market in Phnom Penh. Now is in that mangoes ar in season, Sam-Un needs some money to buy mangoes from farmers on contract (pay money first before harvesting).

She is requesting a loan of US$600 to purchase mangoes on contract from farmers  for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes on a contract from a farmer for resale.

loans.name: Sara Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara Galán is 50 years old, lives in the neighbourhood ‘Laureles Sur’ in Managua, and is married. Her husband is a bricklayer, is self-employed and helps his family with the home expenses.

Sara is a cleaner, a job she has worked at for some years and that has helped her, together with her husband, to keep constructing their house. Both want to finish building their house because they do not have children and they can allocate a large part of their income to doing so. They require the loan to construct a wall in their house and in this way improve security of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sara Galán tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, es casada. Su esposo es albañil, trabaja por cuenta propia, y apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Sara es afanadora, oficio al que se dedica deshe hace algunos años y el que le ha ayudado a ir construyendo junto a su marido su casa. Ambos quieren terminar de acondiconar su casa ya que no tienen hijos, y así le pueden dedicar la mayor parte posible de sus recursos. Requieren del préstamo para levantar un muro de su casa de habitación, par así darle mayor seguridad.

loans.use: To construct a wall in her home

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana is a women who lives in a common law marriage. She is pregnant. Because of this she now feels the tremendous necessity to achieve a higher income in order to be able to improve the life of the baby that is on its way. The income of her spouse is not sufficient although he works as a shoe shiner. His income is not sufficient to be able to do much in the house, or above all else to have better quality of life. She was told that selling shoes from a catalogue is a good business, and that was it easy to collect sales. Because of this she decided to do it, and for one and a half years she has been selling shoes. It has allowed her to have a better income.

She needs a loan of USD $300 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy more shoes, and to satisfy the needs of her clients quickly and with this she will generate more earnings and recommendations.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana es una mujer que vive en unión libre y esta embarazada, por lo mismo ella siente ahora la tremenda necesidad de percibir un ingreso mas alto para poder sacar adelante a su bebe que vine en camino, el ingreso de su esposo no es suficiente ya que el trabaja de bolero (aseador de calzado) y su ingreso no es suficiente para poder dar algo mas en la casa y sobre todo tener mejores condiciones de vida. Le comentaron que era buen negocio la venta de zapatos por catalogo y que era fácil colocar ventas así que ella decidió hacerlo y ya lleva 1 año y medio vendiendo, lo que le ha permitido tener mejore ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más zapato, y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes rápidamente ya que esto le generara más ganancias y recomendaciones.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Dembagnouman (La Bonne Maman) Group

texts.fr:
The 8 members of the Dembagnouman group are all married and have an average age of 31 years and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional polygamous families, mostly with co-spouses, their husbands, children, and other relatives in the Bamanan district of the village of Mèfa (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali).

This group of women, bound by ties of neighborhood, age, and family, sell foodstuffs, agricultural products, and firewood.

In order to satisfy the ever growing demand for their wares, this group decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, which has just approved their request for their first loan. This loan will be used to purchase 30 wagonloads of firewood, 300 liters of fresh cow’s milk, and a substantial quantity of condiments.

They purchase their condiments from wholesalers at the big open-air market of the town of Ségou, their fresh cow's milk where they live in Mèfa and in surrounding villages, and their firewood in the villages of Zenguela, Farabougou and Gachi from legal suppliers.

The firewood and fresh cow’s milk are sold for cash, going door-to-door in the residential neighborhoods of Ségou. The condiments are sold in the surrounding villages or out of their homes. Their clientele is composed of women and men.

They hope to have an average monthly profit of 16,000 FCFA which they will use to invest in their businesses and cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Les 8 membres du groupe Dembagnouman sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles polygames en majorité avec des coépouses, leurs maris, les enfants et d’autres parents dans le quartier Bamanan du village Mèfa (Région de Ségou République du Mali)

Ce groupe de femmes lié par des relations de voisinage de groupe d’âge et de parenté, exerce le commerce des produits alimentaires, agricoles et de bois de chauffe.

Afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus forte, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qui vient d’accepter de leur octroyer leur premier prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe, 300 litres de lait frais de vache et une importante quantité de condiments.

Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments alimentaires au grand marché de la ville de Ségou auprès des grossistes, en lait frais de vache sur place à Mèfa et dans les villages environnants, en bois de chauffe dans les villages de Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi auprès des exploitants forestiers légalement établis pour cette activité.

Les bois de chauffe et le lait frais de vache sont vendus au comptant d’une façon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville de Ségou. Les condiments alimentaires sont vendus sur place dans les villages environnants ou sur place à domicile. La clientèle est composée des femmes et d’hommes.

Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16.000 FCFA.qu’elles utiliseront à investir dans leurs activités et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use:
Purchase of foodstuffs and firewood for re-sale

Achat de produits alimentaires et de bois de chauffe

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, ella desde muy joven se ha encargado del cuidado de su madre, es por esa razón que siempre se ha visto en la necesidad de tener un negocio para poder solventar tanto sus gastos como los de su mama, ahora entre su misma clientela le han empezado a pedir que venda otras cosas esa por eso que ya vende cosméticos y quiere invertir en ello para complacer a sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y tener más opciones para sus clientes.
texts.en:
For the past 18 years Carmen has sold natural products. Since she was very young she has taken care of her mother and for that reason she has always had the need to have a business, to pay not only her expenses but also her mother's. Now her clientele has started asking her to sell other things and because she already sells cosmetics, she wants to invest more in that to please her clients. She needs a loan for US$250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and have more options for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im C., 40, is married, and is a mother of four children. She has been working with her husband since 1998, as fishermen at the Tunle Mekong River, in Cambodia. They make around $5 a day from selling fish at a river dock market. They use a boat, fishing nets, and other fishing tools to help improve the output of their business. 
Eventually they will like to build their own pond to breed fish, which will bring in more money and will help improve their current living conditions. Im C. and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase larger fishing nets, in order to catch more fish. It will help increase their family's income.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for a business.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Mrs. Rem C., 49, and her husband, Mr. Ouch Thy, 52, live in a small village located fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Married in 1980, they have one son and one daughter. Their son is a fisherman, while their daughter works in a factory. Both husband and wife have been working in the fishing business for twenty years. She sells fishes that he catches in a nearby lake. Mrs. Rem is requesting loan of $600 to purchase one boat, a fishing net, and fish traps.

loans.use: To purchase one boat, fishing nets, and fish traps

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 45 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que la apoyan y que son la razón de su esfuerzo. De niña ayudaba a los quehacer de la agricultura a sus padres, una vez que empezó a vivir con su esposo sembró varias hectáreas de cítricos, los que le generen bueno ingresos económicos. Hace dos años abrió un pequeño kiosco frente a su casa para vender gaseosas y galletas, y nota que la venta le deja ganancias, ya que por el calor las gaseosas son muy demandadas, y ahora también está preparando refresco con hielo. Adicionalmente cultiva café y frutos cítricos, pero solo para la temporada cuando los precios son altos y puede tener ganancias. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Una parte del dinero será invertido en la compra de las golosinas y gaseosas y la otra parte en la compra de insecticidas para su chacra de cítricos.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children whom she supports and who are the reason for her strength. As a child she helped her parents with their agricultural work, and once she moved in with her husband they planted a few hectares of citrus trees, which earn them a good income. Two years ago she opened a small kiosk in front of her house to sell soft drinks and cookies. The booth made a profit; soft drinks were in high demand because of the heat, so she began to sell them with ice. She also grows coffee and citrus fruits, but only for the season when prices are high and she can make a profit. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. One part of the money with be spent buying cookies and soft drinks and the rest on purchasing insecticides for her citrus farm.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. is the president of a village bank in Phum Dabprambei village in Kampong Chhnang province. There are sixteen people in her village bank.

Mrs. Mom C. breeds pigs. Since her pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan to buy more piglets for her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions when she sells the pigs that she buys with this loan. 

Her husband, Mr. Prum Saren, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Mrs. Mom C. is 40 years old and the mother of five children. Two of her children are workers, two more attend the local school, and the youngest is just five years old.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou est jeune fille agée de 23 ans quivit à Mbour avec ses parents qui  n'ont pas baucoups de moyens .Pour aider ses parents et survenir à ses besoins personnels elle produit  depuis trois ans (03)des jus fruit qu'elle vend à la gare  routiére.Avec le prêt sollicité ,elle veut renforcer  ses capacités de production  pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Fatou is a 23-year old woman who lives in Mbour with her parents who do not have a lot of financial resources. To help her parents and provide for her own needs, she's been making and selling fruit juices at the bus station for three years. With the loan she's seeking, she wants to bolster her business to increase her income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her fruit juices business

loans.name: Mohammad Aqa Group

texts.en:
M. Aqa is the group leader of M. Aqa group. There are four members in this group and all of them want a loan for his/her business.

M. Aqa wants a loan for his fruit cart business. He wants to buy the necessary materials for his business. Zayah Jan wants a loan for her husband’s general store to expand and improve his business. Maleha wants to take a loan for her tailoring business so she can purchase a new sewing machine. And Palwasha wants to take a loan for her brother’s fruit cart business so he can make it a larger his business.

They want to say this loan is very useful because this loan can provide a good opportunity for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses and become stronger not only in their business, but also in their lives. The group wants to thank everyone involved in this process of offering loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses-fruit carts, tailoring and general store

loans.name: Phorng

texts.en: Mr. Phorng T. lives in the Krang Samroung Village in the Takeo Province. He is a chicken breeder. Aside from his breeding, he sells ice cream in the local village. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his ice cream to sell door-to-door. His wife, Mrs. Nget Saran, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Phorng T. is 30 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M., 33, sells fish-paste and fresh fish in a mobile business. She can generate a daily income of approximately $5 per day and has been running the business since 2005. Her husband makes a living selling a little cloth in the neighborhood, as well as assisting his wife selling fish. The family have two children who are single and attend school. They also help in the family business when they are not studying. Sen M. is looking for a loan in order to increase her family's business capital.

loans.use: To increase her family's business capital

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en:
Chuc T. is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has six adult-aged children.

To make a living, Chuc owns and operates a business venture specializing in the trading of sand and metal. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling metal and metal-related products in the local community. Chuc has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Chuc joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chuc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Chuc is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Chuc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To renovate her business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза-молодая девушка 22-х лет,замужем,детей пока не имеет.Занимается продажей конфет,печенья,cахара и других сладостей на продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Один раз в неделю она вместе с мужем Шукурулло привозит товар с города Худжанда.В данный момент они имеют прилавок на продовольственном рынке.Шахноза мечтает расширить свой товарооборот и в будущем открыть собственный продуктовый магазин.Она рада,что кредитуется в нашей организации и рекомендует нас свом соседям по бизнесу.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young 22 year old woman; she is married and does not have children yet. She sells candy, cookies, sugar and other sweets at the food market in the Spitamen region. Once a week she, with her husband, Shukurullo, bring products from the city of Khujand. Right now they have a sales location at the food market. Shahnoza dreams about growing her turnover and opening her own food store in the future. She is happy to get credit from our organization and recommends us to her business neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of sweets

loans.name: Onofre

texts.en:
Onofre is engaged in a native hog raising business in their poor and remote village of St. Teresa in Lallo, Cagayan. He is 30 years old and married to Wilma, 28 years old, who is a housewife.

He was glad that he was given opportunity to have his pig to raise considering that most residents in their village lack income opportunities and most have low educational attainment. Through serving as rented farm laborer and tilling his small farm lot and by patiently raising his pig, Onofre is able to continuously support the education of his two children and provide their daily living. 

Onofre finds it difficult to keep his pig raising progressing due to lack of finances to supply feed for the animal to grow and produce piglets. Thus, he is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 for maintenance of the business and also to use for some other needs. He hopes to improve his business and somehow is planning to put up a pig house where he can secure his livestock.

loans.use: For maintenance of his business

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
H. Lê Thị (821040404) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 3 adult children. To earn a living, H. owns anc operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Maria Yani

texts.es:
La señora María Yani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II”, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Yanita, como le dicen de cariño, se inició con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia fue quien decidió emprender su negocio de venta de chupetes y hielos que son muy solicitados por el clima caluroso que tenemos, empezó poco a poco, luego fue aumentando e implementando mas su negocio, ahora vende mas y ya es conocida por sus clientes, vecinos y amigos.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un pequeño local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad y el buen carisma que tiene.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,000.0 lo invertirá pagando la última cuota  que le faltaba pagar de su congeladora 

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy luchadora y constante en sus metas que desea lograr y es muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Yanita, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, así mismo ayudar a muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
The señora María Yani belongs to the communal bank “Las Estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II” and lives in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín Department. She lives with her partner, is 29 years old, and is mother to 2 children that still depend on her. Yanita, as she is affectionately called, began with a loan of S/. 300.00 and with her own initiative decided to launch her business of lollipops and ices, which are greatly sought after because of the hot climate.
