She began little by little, later augmenting and installing more in her business, and now she sells more and is known by her clients, neighbours and friends. She continues with the same business, and has a small area specially air-conditioned in her own house, where she attends her clients amiably and with the great charisma that she has. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 she will pay the final installment which was lacking to pay off her freezer. She makes the decisions about the earnings of her business. Personally, she is born fighter and constant with her goals that she wants to achieve, and is very responsible with her payments. Yanita is very thankful for the Movimiento Manual Ramos for permitting her to grow as a businesswoman and woman, and help many other women who want to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the last instalment for a freezer

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị thirty-three years old and lives in the town of Kim Động.  She is married and has two school-age children.  To make a living, T. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately $173 a month from these activities.

In 2000, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to purchase additional products to sell.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Los Plata Group

texts.es:
El grupo los P. está conformado por María Lourdes Sánchez, Reynaldo Jose P. Sánchez y Olga María Baltodano Pavón. Los integrantes de este grupo viven en Piedra Quemada una comarca de Nindirí, esta es una zona rural de difícil acceso.

La coordinadora del grupo es María Lourdes Sánchez P. de 26 años de edad. Ella vive en la casa de su madre, junto con sus hermanos, su esposo y sus dos hijos. Las edades de sus pequeños son uno de nueve años  y un bebe de dos meses.

Esta joven comenzó desde temprana edad a trabajar junto con su madre en la venta de candelas y veladoras. Actualmente ella  tiene 14 años de experiencia en este tipo de comercio lo que le ha permitido conocer bien como debe ser  administrado. Ella trabaja desde  su casa y su meta inmediata es poder invertir en la compra de veladoras y candelas para su negocio además que con las ganancias podría construir un cuarto ya que vive en un pequeño espacio. 

Los otros integrantes del grupo son personas ya de la tercera edad, muy activos y trabajadores. Estos son doña Olga María Baltodano Pavón de 64 años de edad vive en una casa junto con una nieta quien le ayuda en sus labores, ella vende ropa usada.
 
Mientras don Reynaldo José P. Sánchez de 69 años de edad vive en una casa modesta junto con su esposa quien es una ancianita que tiene Alzheimer. El es  analfabeto y su negocio  trata de la  compra y venta de animales o su carne.
 
Este grupo de  ya  han tenido dos créditos con adim con los cuales lograron incrementar su materia prima y sus clientes. En la actualidad ellos necesitan de ingresos para adquirir mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
The Silver (P.) Group is made up of María Lourdes Sánchez, Reynaldo Jose P. Sánchez, and Olga María Baltodano Pavón. The members of this group live in Piedra Quemada, an area of Nindirí. This is a rural area that is difficult to access. The group leader is María Lourdes Sánchez P., who is 26 years old. She lives in her mother’s house with her siblings, her husband, and her two children, who are 8 years old and 2 months old. From a young age, she started working with her mother selling candles. At present, she has 14 years of experience in this type of business, which allows her to know how to manage it. She works from her home, and her immediate goal is to invest in the purchase of candles for her business. Also, with her earnings, she wants to be able to build a room, since she currently lives in a very small space. The other members of the group are older, very active, and hard-working. One of them is Mrs. Olga María Baltodano Pavón, who is 64 years old and lives in a house with her granddaughter, who helps her in her work. She sells used clothes. The other members, Reynaldo José P. Sánchez, is 69 years old and lives in a modest house with his wife, who is an old woman with Alzheimer’s. He is illiterate, and his business deals with buying and selling animals or their meat. This group has already had two loans with Adim, with which they succeeded in increasing their raw materials and their clients. At present, they need income to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aromatic candles

loans.name: Djiguiya 1 De Wayere Farakala Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Djiguiya 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant en moyenne  35ans, 4 enfants et vivant  la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à WAYERE un des villages de la commune rurale de FARAKALA, préfecture  de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs cultures de maïs. Ils sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce  prêt, ils comptent acheter,  des  engrais et d’herbicides pour entretenir 10 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de FARAKALA  et  de SIKASSO après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes souvent venant de BAMAKO ou du SENEGAL. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénefice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Les producteurs du groupe Djiguiya 1 souhaitent avoir des montants à hauteur de souhait.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguiya 1 group are married men with an average age of 35 and on average, 4 children. They mostly live in traditional extended families in Wayere, one of the villages of the rural township of Farakala, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can successfully grow their maize crops. They are working with the institution for the first time.

With this loan, they intend to buy fertilizer and herbicides to maintain 10 hectares. Their crops are sold in the village, in the markets of Farakala and Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women, often coming from Bamako or from Senegal. They expect to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA per growing season. The agriculturalists of the Djiguiya 1 group would like to have unlimited amounts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells crates of drinks and pepper soup. Elizabeth is a very energetic and vibrant business woman. She is 58 years old and married with four children. She is requesting a loan of 160,000 nairas to purchase more crates of drinks and soup ingredients. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase drinks and soup ingredients

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida D. is a rice farmer in the town of Magsaysay, Veruela, Agusan Del Sur.  Her rice field, which is her means of living, needs financing. A member of CEVI, she applied for a loan of Php6, 000. She will use the loan to finance her farm. She likes CEVI’s program especially the Insurance and Savings policy.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda M. is a 54 year-old widow who has 6 children who were left fatherless at a very young age when their father died late last year. Her oldest son, Jimmy is just 19 years old and has settled down with his own family, but the rest of Gilda's children are still going to school. Jimmy helps his mother run their small restaurant in Isabela, Negros Occidental. Gilda hopes that all of her younger children will be able to finish their college education so that they could earn good incomes and provide for their own families.

The death of her husband left Gilda alone to raise her family, but she faced this trial with courage and conviction because her love and concern for her children transcended any difficulty that she experienced. She doubled her efforts knowing that she was the only one left who could provide for the family.

Even with her recent loss, Gilda was not fazed by the trials that have come to her at that time. She knew that she could sustain her family if she held on and used her skills and knowledge in running a food business. This is not surprising because she's been doing it for quite a long time. She was already engaged in food vending long before she married her husband, and continued with it during her married life, becoming her husband's helpmate in supporting their large family. 

She also trained her children while they were young and now they are also able to lend a hand in running the business when they had no school work. In 2006, Gilda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could expand her business. As she paid off each loan on time and performing well as a member, Gilda gained access to larger loans which she fully made use of by expanding her operations even further. It now earns her a monthly net income of PHP 7,500.


Her previous loan of Php 13,000 was used as additional capital for her business, and she was able to repay her loan on time without any delays. For her 7th cycle loan, she intends to borrow the same amount to be used as additional capital for her business and whatever income from it will be used for the education of her children and for her family needs.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Food Vending and Restaurant Business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 46 years old, married and blessed with a child named Jennifer. They are living happy in the village of San Andres Aurora, Isabela.  Estelita operates a sari-sari store business (community based store) in their village for four years.  She wishes for her business to grow for it is a great help in meeting the needs of their family.  With her income, she is able to assist her husband in earning an income.  

Now, she wants to borrow additional capital for her business since she needs more stocks for the improvement of her store. She is now in need of PHP18,000 and this will be used to buy more stocks to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her store

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren O. is 21 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter in a house in the Tosontsengel Province of Central Mongolia. His wife works as a bank teller. O. operates a raw-material retail business in his town. He started his business in 2006 with the help of his older brother. After lots of hard work and determination, O. operates his business independently. He purchases skins and wool from herders and sells them for a profit in the Central Market. One day, O. hopes to have his own store where his customers and suppliers can come to him. He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (approx. $1381 USD) loan to purchase livestock skins that he will sell in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, and to buy a car for his family. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase livestock skins to sell, and a car for his family

loans.name: Jenishgul's Group

texts.en:
Jenishgul is the leader of her borrowing group. She is forty four years old and is the mother of two children, an eighteen-year-old daughter and a fourteen-year-old son. To support their family, Jenishgul’s husband works as a taxi driver. In the summer he switches to working at a private construction business. Their daughter is a junior in college and she studies there on a state scholarship. Their son is in the seventh grade in middle school.

Jenishgul buys and sells fruit such as oranges, bananas, etc.  Since childhood, she has always liked exotic fruit. She always dreamed of having a shop of her own where she could sell all kinds of fruit. Her dream came true ten years ago, when she finally opened her own fruit shop. It took her great effort and patience to do so but it was worth it. Since then, Jenishgul has bought herself a car and some equipment for her home.

Jenishgul’s husband helps her haul the fruit. Now Jenishgul’s monthly income is about $465. She has applied for this loan to buy apples in the Yssykkul region. As apples of this region are well known, she believes that this purchase will help her increase her turnover and make more money. In the autumn of 2010, Jenishgul's daughter will get married. Jenishgul has already started to save money for her daughter’s dowry. Beyond the dowry, Jenishgul wants to surprise her daughter with a gift of bedroom furniture. 

Jenishgul has three partners in this group loan: 

Damira, 56, is divorced. She has three children. Two of her daughters are married and live separately, and her son is in the sixth grade. Damira raises cattle. She hopes buy a cow with the money from this loan.

Sinat, 60, and her husband are retired. They have raised three children. Sinat keeps cows and sells twenty liters of milk a day. Sinat needs this loan to buy a calf for breeding.

Gulzat, 30, has one ten-year-old daughter. Her husband is a builder. Gulzat works as a saleswoman in a small shop. Gulzat needs this loan to buy more goods for her shop. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy apples for resale at a fruit shop.

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en:
Eva F. is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan City. She is 32 years old. Eva is the group leader of a 4-member group requesting a loan through ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Eva is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from it.
Eva joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase vegetables to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eva from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lanh's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lanh S. is the group leader of four people who are all living in Voat Svay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Lanh S. is a farmer who owns 2 hectares where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bao Phon, helps her on the farming. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Lanh S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to make a profit after she sells her cow. Mrs. Lanh S. is a mother of six children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while two are attending the local school and the other is staying at home to help  with the housework. Mrs. Yen K. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham S. is from the town of Gud San Isidro. He is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Abraham owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from motorcycle transport. Abraham has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 1000 PHP weekly for these activities.

In 2009, Abraham joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for the maintenance of his passenger motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan that he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For maintenance of a passenger motorcycle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Teresita is widowed and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business of buying and selling food supplements and beauty products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $185 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un joven muy empeñoso de 21 años, que vive en su casa propia con sus padres Mauro de 45 y Reída de 47 años.
Él como ejemplo tiene a sus padres que son personas integras y trabajadoras que a diario le enseñan las técnicas agrícolas para una eficiente labor, Walter desde hace 6 años se dedica a sembrar arveja, habas, papa y maíz conjuntamente con sus progenitores, lo que más le gusta es arar las chacras porque según cuenta siente que siembra una esperanza o una nueva vida que le dará  frutos de calidad en grandes cantidades ya que las labra con amor, por otro lado estos meses le incomoda tener que luchar con las inclemencias del tiempo puesto que pondrían en riesgo su producción sino es atento y cuidadoso.
Las adversidades no le asustan y está confiado en que la próxima campaña de cosecha incrementará sus ingresos económicos debido a que en la agricultura no hay perdida más aún si le brindas los cuidados necesarios, por eso para su futuro piensa incrementar sus producción, también ser negociante mayorista y trasladar su mercadería hasta la capital del Perú (Lima).  
               
Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, con su responsabilidad y puntualidad se a ganado la confianza de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes le gusta trabajar.  El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono, para lo cual necesita mil nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Walter, 21, is an enterprising young man, who lives in his own home with his parents: Mauro, 45 and Reída, 47. He has, as examples, his parents, who are hard-working, honorable people, who daily teach him farming techniques for efficient labor. For the past 6 years, Walter has farmed peas, broad beans, potatoes and corn with his parents. What he likes best about his work is plowing the fields because, as he says, he always feels that he's planting hope or a new life that will bear abundant fruit because he works his fields with much love. On the other hand, these last few months he has had to struggle against the inclement weather which, if he's not attentive and careful, can wreak havoc with his crops. He isn't frightened by these adversities, however. He is confident that the next harvest will increase his earnings because, in farming, there are no losses, especially if you provide the proper care to your plantings. For the future, he plans to increase his production, to become a wholesale merchant, and to sell his merchandise all the way to Perú's capital, Lima. This is his second loan with MFP. His responsibility and punctuality has won over the trust of all his fellow communal bank members, with whom he enjoys working. The money requested, 1000 new soles, will be used to buy pea seed and several sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Dosumbetova Seyil`s Group

texts.en: Seyil is 72 years old and is a native of Uzgen city, which is one of the ancient cities of Central Asia. Officially she is a pensioner but she is still very active. She is married with twelve children! Wow! It is a very big number even for Central Asia. Her husband is also a pensioner. All her children are grown and most of them live separately from their parents. Seyil has a family business: they raise rice, corn and sunflowers. She has been in this business since 2001. Also they keep some cattle and sell milk and milk products. This loan will be used to buy building materials (cement) to repair their house. Aytolkun is 49 and she is a younger sister of Seyil. She is 49 years old and is married. She is raising two children: a 15-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter, both pupils. Her husband is a farmer and they have a small livestock business. With this loan she hopes to buy a few lambs to fatten. Asilkan is 68. She is also a pensioner and married and has raised nine children. Due to her hard work, all her children live separately and happily, and they are very thankful to their mother. With her husband she fattens cattle. This loan will be used to buy milk cows, so that she will be able to produce more milk. S. Apakan is married with three children. She is 68 years old and receives a pension of about USD 30. She sells milk and milk products in her village. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy cement to repair her house

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga esta casada con el Sr. Antonio Gonzalez, poseen cuatro hijos dos mujeres y dos varones, que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.
Anteriormente la señora contaba con una ferretería, pero con el tiempo el ingreso ya no resultaba suficiente por ese motivo decidió invertir en una despensa.
Le gustaría para el futuro ampliar mas  su negocio ya que es  local propio y posee buena ubicación contando con varios clientes.
En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de mercaderías con el objetivo de llenar las expectativas de los clientes en cuanto a sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Dominga is married to Antonio Gonzalez. They have four children, two girls and two boys who are in college. Previously, she had a hardware store but after some time, the income was not enough. Because of this, she decided to invest in a store. In the future, she would like to increase her business because it has a good location and many customers. At this time, she asks for a loan for the purchase of merchandise, with the objective of fulfilling the expectations of the customers and meeting their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, soap, sugar, and eggs for her store.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela, tiene 43 años, junto con su esposo se dedican a comercializar sandalias en los lugares aledaños de sonde viven, la actividad vienen ejerciendo aproximadamente hace 10 años, la cual les ha ayudado para sostener a su familia, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, el primero lo pagaron sin problemas de atraso, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona trabajadora y colaborador en su comunidad, el crédito le servirán para incrementar su venta.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43 years old and she and her husband sell sandals in the outskirts of the zone where they live. They have been doing this for about ten years and it has helped them to support their family. This will be her second loan through ASDIR. She repaid the previous one without falling behind in her payments. Her personal references tell us that she is a very hard working person who contributes to her community. She will use the money from this loan to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for making sandals

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu A. is from the village of Pagalungan, Cagayan de  oro City. She is 28 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu sells seafood products including fish and shrimp. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jose  Martin

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JOSE VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE SANTA CRUZ, EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SAN CARLOS, DISTANTE 15KM DE EL MUNICIPIO DE EL TORNO, ESTA CASADO  SU ACTIVIDAD ES EL TRANSPORTE DE PERSONA A DICHA LOCALIDAD, SU ESPOSA SE DEDICA  A LABORES DE CASA, TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO QUE YA SON MAYORES, SU DESEO ES TENER SU CASA PROPIA EN EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EL TORNO QUE ES LA CAPITAL DEL MUNICIPIO AL QUE PERTENECE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA LLANTAS PARA EL ARREGLO DE SU VEHICULO YA QUE ESTA TENIENDO FALLAS Y NO LE PERMITE BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose lives in the town of El Torno, which is 40km from the city of Santa Cruz and 15km from the community of San Carlos. He provides passenger transport services to the local residents. His wife is a homemaker and they have three adult children who still live with them. Jose hopes to acquire his own home in El Torno, which is the municipal capital.

The money from his loan will be used to replace the tires on his vehicle since they are worn and prevent him from providing the best service to his customers. Jose is extremely grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a two door refrigerator for her business

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Mr. Yorn C. is 31 years old and lives in Svay village in Kandal province. He is a laborer in a garment factory and his wife, Mrs. Sambath Choi, is a seamstress in a garment factory. With both positions, they earn a small income to support their family. In order to maintain his job, Mr. Yorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for transportation. This couple has two children; one attends the local school while the youngest one is 5 years old. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen E. T. es una mujer trabajadora, humilde y esforzada originaria de de la Montañita 1 zona rural de Tisma. Ella hace seis años empezó a  vender de ropa y cosmético en pequeñas cantidades, hoy en día distribuye por mayor y tiene colaboradores que le ayudan en la comercialización y el cobro de dichos productos.

E. sueña con ser una gran distribuidora de productos variados pero para ello necesita invertir en la adquisición de estilos de ropa de vestir y de cama, cosméticos y plásticos como vasos, platos y panas entre otros.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen E. T. is a modest but spirited, hard-working woman from La Montañita, a rural area in Tisma. Six years ago she began selling clothing and cosmetics in small quantities. Today she is a wholesale distributor, with partners to help her with marketing and collections. E. would like to be a major distributor of an array of products, but to do so she must invest in the purchase of clothing, bed linens, cosmetics, and plastic items such as glasses, plates, bowls, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, cosmetics, plastic goods, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 25 years old. Catherine is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Catherine owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from gathering and selling seaweeds at the market. The business existed for more than 20 years already handed down to her from her father.

Catherine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Catherine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat is a married mother of five children. Her kids’ clothing sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past 10 years that she’s been in business. In a typical month, Inobat makes about $200 in profit from the business. Inobat is a hardworking, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help her clients with their clothing needs. Inobat has requested a loan of 4,000 Somoni to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and to provide a good income for her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for kids for the summer season

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 09 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Seune N. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

Elle fait un commerce de tissus depuis plus de dix ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Touba ou à Dakar pour revendre dans son quartier et les villages environnants. 

Avec son prêt elle va acheter des tissus en quantité plus importante pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM came into being six months ago. It is made up of nine women who all come from the same neighborhood. They also all belong to the same "Banc Villageois" SANTHIABA COKI2. Mrs. Seune N., on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 55, married, and the mother of five children. She has been selling cloth for more than ten years. She buys her supplies in Touba or in Dakar and resells them in her neighborhood and the surrounding villages. With this loan she plans to buy a bigger quantity of cloth so that she can increase her profit margin. Her goal is to help her husband with the expenses of supporting their family, for example helping with food, healthcare, and school expenses for the children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth in larger quantities

loans.name: Rosa Elsy

texts.es: Rosa Elsy de 36 años de edad, Vive junto a su hijo y esposo. Ella posee el negocio de cosméticos y libros, la cual es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que se necesario sufragar los gastos del hogar, es por ello que Rosa cuenta con todo el empeño de salir adelante y mejorar la vida de su pequeño hijo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad de poder comprar cosméticos y libros los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza de que este préstamo sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio y que por medio de este pueda mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Elsy, 36, lives with her son and husband. She has a cosmetics and book business which are of great help to her family since it is necessary to meet household expenses and Rosa has the determination to do all that is necessary to get ahead and improve her young son’s life. She is asking for funds to buy cosmetics and books which are highly sought after in her business. She has the hope that the loan will be of great use to her business and that it will help her increase profits thereby providing everything necessary for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and books.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca es una maestra en la escuela de la comunidad de Santa Elena de la región Brunca en el sur de Costa Rica. Tiene la edad de 30 años y es soltera pero tiene una hija de 9 años. Hace poco su carro se rotó y desde entonces no ha podido ir a la escuela para impartir clases a los niños. Ella quiere arreglar su vehículo, comprar partes dañados para volver a tenerlo en buen estado y viajar a impartir los lecciones en la escuela. Además, le gustaría usar su vehículo para facilitarse el transporte de su hija. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y también ella ha realizados otros préstamos en el unión de crédito Coopealianza, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hija y los hijos en la escual la educación necesaria para que sean en el futuro personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a teacher in a school in Santa Elena in the Brunca region in southern Costa Rica. She is 30 years old and single but has a 9 year-old daughter. Her car broke down recently and since then she has been unable to get to school to teach her students. She wants to repair the car and buy replacement parts for the damaged parts to once again have it in good running order and be able to get to school to teach her lessons. In addition, she’d like to be able to have the car to transport her daughter. This is the first loan from FUDECOSUR and she has had previous loans from Coopealianza Credit Union. However, FUDECOSUR offered more comfortable loan terms. She wants to provide her daughter and the children at the school with the necessary education so that they will be prepared individuals in the future to face life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brígida tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha aprendido a trabajar eficientemente en las tareas agrícolas, hoy cultiva papa, maíz, habas y arveja en sus propios terrenos de cultivo que le fue heredado. Ella y su esposo  se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a sus hijos, quienes también están aprendiendo las técnicas de esta actividad. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura porque le brinda la mercadería abundante para comercializarla en el mercado, además que tiene disponible del producto para el sustento familiar, por tal motivo desea adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y mayor cantidad de animales como ovejas y cerdos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono que le servirá para preparara la tierra en la siguiente siembra y asegurar obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Brigida is 39 years old and she lives in a house that is their own together with her husband and their 5 children. Since she was a little girl she has learned to work in the fields. Currently she cultivates potatoes, corn, fava beans, and sweet peas on land that was inherited to them. She and her husband work hard to provide the best to her kids. They, too, are now learning the business of agriculture. She says that she loves to work in agriculture because it yields abundant products to sell in the markets. She also uses the harvests to feed her family. For these reason she needs to have larger fields and greater numbers of livestock, including sheep and pigs. This is a first time loan for her through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know that she has the financial support. She is known as a very responsible person with payments and she is also happy to be a member of her community bank. All the other members that she knows are responsible and they are team players. She is grateful to all those individuals that will contribute towards the loan that she requests and it will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to ready the fields for the next plantation, ensuring a good future harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 36-year-old man, married with three children aged 6 years, 2 years and 7 months. He has no other dependents and lives in a 4-roomed house which he owns. His family goal is to have a healthy and well educated family. His home address is Masindi, Uganda.

He is in the retail business and farming and has been in the businesses for 2 and 10 years respectively. He started with farming just like the majority of the country's population. He put aside savings from his income and started the retail business. He faces hardships of bad debts and he wishes in future that his business will grow into a big retail shop. He needs the loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his child
